Reviews.Title: “Average for London, poor for everywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Houston3214
Reviews.Content: Upgraded me, which was very nice but the hotel is old. And not the good old. The bed was good and the location was great but really nothing else. Unfortunately, I thought I had booked the Park Tower Sheraton, which is spectacular, but nope, I hadn't. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great bellmen, nothing else to rave about”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_calgarian
Reviews.Content: First recommendation just in case anyone is looking to use this hotel for business - don't stay here if you are booking meeting on a weekend - pm me if you want more info. Rooms are okay, standard London fare. Hotel breakfast is good, expensive but you are on Park Lane. Lovely lounge, very old London, old Park Lane feel, thinking back on it it's really the only place I like in the whole hotel and I've stayed several times. Apart from the lounge this place really lacks in atmosphere. Can't beat the location though. If you really want to stay at a Sheraton I prefer the one in Knightsbridge, bigger rooms, better service, right next to Harvey Nicks, fun lounge. Also, check your bills - I don't think there was one time when it was correct (and always in the Sheraton's favour, not mine). Bellmen though really are great, upbeat and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Little niggles add up to dissapointing stay (SPG Platinum)”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller to SPG hotels I have come to expect a certain level of service so I had high expectations for this premium hotel. When in London I typically stay outside of the SPG group because SPG rates are either too high or unavailable - this was an exception. Certainly this hotel has the potential for a great London experience: The hotel is ideally situated in central London right on Green Park, making it an easy walk to Buckingham Palace, Big Ben & Parliament and Oxford St for shopping (the tube provides easy transport if walking is not your thing). This is an older hotel so don't expect the same standards in rooms as you find in modern hotels, but it has a classic charm that some will find delightful. As an SPG Platinum member I received a suite upgrade which was great (thank you). My room was large, especially by London standards, with a large bathroom and a sitting room. The bathroom had a wonderful Victorian tub that I just had to try ... It's been years since I was able to slip into such a deep bath and soak away the stresses of travel - plus a heated towel rail kept the towels warm.  The sitting room had a small couch and desk and made a good work area with WiFi. My bedroom overlooked the park on the first floor. Even though I was right next to Picadilly Rd, I heard very little road noise. My bed was comfy and up to the usual Sheraton standards with nice fluffy pillows. There was a second desk in my bedroom and coffee/tea making facilities. The wifi worked well enough although the wired Internet connection on the desk didn't seem to work. I was also unable to connect more than two devices to the Internet, which was mildly annoying as I usually connect 3 devices and update them all (data roaming charges when not on wifi are ridiculous when coming from the USA). So overall my room was excellent for a London hotel (and from what I can tell, well above the typical room others have experienced). However, I had no heat in my room and I awoke at 6am feeling chilled (it turns out I had caught a cold that would linger on through the next two weeks into my vacation). When I called to reception to ask about the heating I was told an engineer would be right up. Then the front desk called back to say the engineer said the heat was off in the hotel because the day before had been warm (even though the heat was working on my towel rail?). I was offered a portable heater which I was told would be sent up immediately. So I waited, feeling cold, for my heater to arrive, not wanting to take a shower before the heater arrived. After 30 minutes I gave up waiting and took a hot shower. At 7am I went down to reception to formerly complain. By the time I returned from breakfast the heater had arrived ... Just before I checked out.  Overall my experience of the service at this hotel was perhaps the worst I have ever had at an SPG hotel. The staff were not well trained in how to create a positive service experience for customers. They lacked basic courtesies such as welcoming guests and offering to help with luggage (I walked from the Green Park entrance through the Palm Court to reception with two cases, up and down two sets of steps, and walked past two staff members who simply ignored me). When I had a complaint, and took it to the manager on duty, I felt I was treated as if it was me who was in the wrong - when I suggested perhaps I should be given breakfast, I was told that would not be appropriate (this after receiving a personal letter from the hotel manager welcoming me to the hotel and asking me to let him know if anything at all was wrong with my stay). Frankly, had the staff been better trained and experienced in making customers welcome and happy, and had my heating worked, this would have been a great stay. But a string of bad customer expereinces made up for a dissapointing stay - and that was just one night!  By contrast, I stayed the following night at Le Meridien in Frankfurt (SPG hotel) and the service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Snowflakesnsun
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel is the location- opposite green park and close to Hyde park for the runners/walkers. Bucking ham is nearby as is lots of shopping. Have stayed in hotel numerous times and rooms vary widely from large rooms with view to tiny single bed rooms with outdated bathroom. Fast wireless Internet connection but tiny business center. Limited space for informal business meetings with colleagues - many of the tables in the bar restaurant tend to be reserved! I keep going back for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: miami p
Reviews.Content: the room was not ready for cheek in on time, every guest at the front desk was unhappy, although I complained to the manager she did nothing to help. corporate should send someone to inspect this hotel. despite I am a gold spy member, as f that matters here, they made me get on a long line just to ask if my room was ready although I had checked in 3 hours earlier and did the line. This otel is not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: mauronr
Reviews.Content: The top positive thing is the location. It's less than 5 minutes walk from Green Park tube (subway) station (Piccadilly line) and about 10 minutes walk from Buckingham palace. My room was the last in the aisle (#655) and from the map on the back of the door, it seems it was smaller than the rest. It wasn't a problem at all for me, but from comments I've seen in other websites, people from other countries like US may consider it a bit claustrophobic if compared to the average room size in US (I'm Brazilian). The bathroom is pretty large, compared to the bedroom. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were very clean everyday. One funny thing was my experience with the shower faucet. It has 2 knobs, one on top of the other, and I first thought it was the usual hot and cold water. It turns out the top one controls the amount of water and the lower one the temperature. As it was the first time I saw this kind of faucet, I kept scratching my head for a couple of minutes trying to figure it out. After I got it, it was really practical, as I adjusted temperature on the lower one and didn't touch it anymore. Every shower I just had to turn the top one and after a few seconds it was exactly in the temperature I like. The lowest point was the in-room dining. I ordered a steak and I've had better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Review for SPG Members - Find Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: 27RachelP
Reviews.Content: As a very loyal SPG member, I've stayed at the Park Lane Sheraton twice in order to stay in the 'SPG family' on trips to London (and when Le Meridien / W are booked or too expensive). Each time I've stayed at the Park Lane I've been sorely disappointed. It is NOT up to the standard one would expect from a Sheraton or for any hotel of that price. If staying at a hotel outside the SPG brand is totally anathema and you must stay at the Park Lane, a few things to be aware of: 1) Rooms are all different because it's a really old hotel. Insist on looking at the room plan before you're put in a room and get the largest room possible. Some of the smaller club rooms are TINY. You can barely move. The check-in desk has a hotel room plan that you can look at if you ask. 2) All club rooms (non-executive rooms) have hand-held showers only. Super annoying, so just be aware. 3) Don't get a room near the elevators. As it's an old building, it's pretty loud and you can hear the elevators going all night. 4) Hotel staff (e.g., bellhop, concierge) are pretty disappointing / dismal. Don't expect much help or assistance from them in any way shape or form and you'll be fine. 5) No coffee / tea makers in room. Just be prepared for that. 6) Cell phone reception in hotel is very spotty and no free internet, even in lobby (which most Sheratons have...) It's all about managing expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy staying at the Park Lane”
Reviews.Author: Bigapplebarbara
Reviews.Content: I am a very loyal SPG member. Had my choice of Starwood Hotels. Was intially hesitant in booking here due to all the negative reviews. Took a chance, am a runner and wanted to be near Hyde park. Am so happy I ignored the negative reviews. I have a lovely room, very clean and of course the amazing beds. Very convenient location and from the time I have arrived staff have been courteous and pleasant. Looking forward to coming back in the future"

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: After booking my stay at this hotel, I saw some rather negative reviews on TripAdvisor and had serious second thoughts. However, since the reviews seemed to be specific to certain types of rooms (perhaps some have been renovated and others not), I decided to leave my arrangements in place. I am very happy I did so. My room was large and well appointed, the bed was comfortable (always a Sheraton strong point) and the staff welcoming, warm and helpful. In addition, the location of the hotel is extremely good. I would not hesitate to book the Park Lane in the future and would strongly recommend it to anyone needing comfortable accommodation in the heart of London.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful stay in a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mia049
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent the weekend staying at the Park Lane Hotel - I had read some not so good reviews and am pleased to say I ignored them - the Hotel is immaculate , the Tea Room and Bar stunning - the bed was sooo comfortable that I struggled to get up. All the staff we found to be friendly and helpful - particularly on reception and in the Bar - the hotel is a stroll from the beautiful Hyde Park and the same from the Palace , we cannot wait to return Thankyou to the Park Lane Sheraton London

Reviews.Title: “Poor 2* masquerading as 5*”
Reviews.Author: Retnerin
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a short notice overnight stay in a good location in London and selected this via late rooms. What a disappointment - the only reasonable part of the room was the bed which was clean and comfortable - though we have had clean and comfortable beds in unrated hotels. The heat in the room meant we had to leave the windows open, which could not be locked to provide secure ventilation, and the outside noise meant we hardly had any sleep overnight which completely ruined our London stay. There was a large floor standing airconditioner in the room, taking up a lot of space, but its noise prevented its use. The room and bathroom echoed to the noise of occupants in adjoining rooms using their bathroom facilities. The paint/plastic on the windows was peeling and the sealant around the windows, bath and sink was unkempt and grubby. There was mould and goo in the sink overflow and the general hygiene and cleanliness of the facilities was worse than many 1 and 2 star hotels we have stayed in. The hotel brochure noted that complimentary coffee would be provided if we contacted reception, so we ordered coffee for two and when it arrived were asked to pay £15. That said, the service was good and the staff were really helpful and courteous. Would we visit again? probably not. Would we suggest the hotel to others - no. Positive comments - relieved we hadn't booked more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ian_M_T
Reviews.Content: This place is tired. One of the strangest hotel bars I know, and odd public spaces. The rooms are very stylistically dated, and could do with a total refresh. And yet I stay the every time I am in town. Why? It's a great location close to everywhere I want to go, the staff are nice, and I get my SPG points. If you're going to spend lots of time in your hotel go elsewhere, but if you want a decent Starwood property to sleep in when you're in town doing stuff from early till late, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Slept beautifully”
Reviews.Author: CAB1972
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in this typically worn out London hotel. Like many old grand London hotels, it needs millions spent on it to restore its former glory. However, that said, it is clean and maintained and with a lovely grand hall. The 8th, no view, room I had was spacious and really comfortable. Mini bar and in-room dining competitively priced. Will happily return and lovely to stroll through the parks.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmcg1980
Reviews.Content: tired communal areas, battered bedroom and bathrooms with mould. This hotel is a shocker and I've no idea how it maintains its 5 stars. In addition they charged my credit card for something I certainly did not use. This place is seriously to be avoided

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much better...”
Reviews.Author: cheshiremackat
Reviews.Content: Overall, I want to temper my review with the knowledge that this hotel isn't as terrible as some of the reviews have outlined, however, it could also be much, much better. I stayed for a weekend in March. As I said in my title, the hotel is not terrible - but it could *easily* be so much better. This hotel is supposedly rated 5-star, but in my mind to earn a rating like that requires much more attention to detail than found at this property. To begin - there are two entrances to this hotel. One off of Piccadilly and one off the street behind the hotel. The 'back' street entrance is the actual entrance, even though the hotel fronts onto Piccadilly. What is strange is that there are no staff posted to the entrance on Piccadilly - so if you want assistance with your bags (if you took the tube like I did) you have to walk through the hotel to the reception desk at the rear. Furthermore - you need to walk with your bags through the elegant Palm Court! I would have hated to pay for an expensive afternoon tea in the Palm Court to watch people walk through pulling their luggage all afternoon! The room itself was nothing special. The bed was comfortable, and quite clean - but really, for this price - is it worth mentioning? (only when everything else is so disappointing). I my room, the hairdryer was pathetic, and totally inadequate, and possibly 20 years old. Again, not up to standard. While our room did in fact have a tub - it was inoperable as the tub stopper would not seal, and the faucet only allowed water to flow through the handle - not the faucet itself. Again - poor upkeep. Surely if someone is paying for a room like this - everything should be in working order. Again, the little things matter. The music playing at the reception was totally inappropriate. As a 90's child - I appreciate alternative rock as my taste, but nirvana playing on check in? I saw more than a few raised eyebrows... Overall - this hotel could be so much more - it is just disappointing. If you are planning a visit to London, I would not seek this hotel out - but if you are booked to stay here, it will be satisfactory (just) but nothing at all special - which is a shame as it could very easily be.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rumbers
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room through the Lastminute.com 'secret hotel' deal recently, and paid approximately £110 (room only). The location of the hotel is great for anyone staying in London - right between Hyde Park Corner and Piccadilly Circus, opposite Green Park. Very close to the tube, and a short walk from the buzz of the West End. However, I have to say that the experience wasn't really worth £110 (thank goodness I didn't pay the full £200+ price or I'd have been furious). Firstly, reception didn't have a record of my booking - apparently the Last Minute.com booking reference didn't match theirs. After a 10 minute wait, they eventually went through the manual records and found it on the system. The room itself was fairly small, which was no problem, but definitely didn't live up to a 5* experience as billed. So, the good points. Decent flat screen TV, safe, comfortable bed, wi-fi (though at a cost, and only 1 bar of reception). The bad points. The bathroom was VERY outdated and in need of refurbishment. Old cracked marble tiles, old taps, an annoying 'clingy' shower curtain round the bath...it just looked and felt old and tired. The shower pressure was fine, but overall, not great. No kettle or tea and coffee making facilities, let alone a complimentary bottle of water. The minibar was secured with a tag, so I didn't even bother looking in it - I suspect it would have been prohibitively expensive. Poor climate control - the room was far too hot, and the old dials seemed to do nothing useful. So, all in all, great location, old and tired rooms. I think there are probably better, refurbished 'executive' rooms, which were offered to me for an additional £48, but as we were only there one night for a stop-over while seeing a show, it didn't seem worth it. Really not sure how it can be rated as 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Never a 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: jade o
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in March 2011. Not an awful hotel, but never a 5 star, more like a 3 star. In need of vast improvements! Very aged and worn around the edges. Also a very small room. Polite staff though!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel with Three Star Effort”
Reviews.Author: r_smith640
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a London Theatre Break and stayed one night at the Sheraton Park Lane Hotel. Initial reaction was good. Although the Hotel is old it's charm still seeps through the tiredness of some of the hotel fabric. We decided to book an executive double as some of the Trip Advisor Reviews suggested that the standard double rooms were somewhat disappointing in many respects. Our room (601) was spacious, clean and quite acceptable considering the age of the Hotel. The room which was supposed to be a double was in fact a twin. Not really a problem but the receptionist offered to have "Housekeeping" convert the beds to a double whilst we were out at the Theatre. We decided to eat our evening meal in the Hotel Restaurant and were advised by Reception to book a table via the Consierge as, being a Saturday, availability of a table for dinner could not be guaranteed unless booked in advance. On returning from the Theatre during early evening we went up to our room to change for dinner only to find that the beds had not been converted to a double as promised. Not that much of a problem really so we let it pass. At about 8pm we went down to the restaurant for dinner only to find that the Consierge had apparently failed to book a table for us for dinner. The Restaurant Manager's attitude was somewhat disappointing as he considered that it was not his problem and went off to see if he could find a vacant table. He duly returned with the announcement that he had solved "our problem" and escorted us to a table. My wife and I chose our meals and the Restaurant Manager recommended that my wife's order should be accompanied by a side dish of vegetables. Our meals duly arrived and we reminded the waiter that he had forgotten to bring the vegetable side dish. Thinking that the vegetables would arrive propmptly, we started to eat our meals. Some time later, after we had virtually finished our main courses, a waitress appeared with the vegetable side dish. We explained that it was too late for the vegetables and instructed her to remove the item from our bill. The waitress insisted that we accept the vegetables without charge and it was becoming embarrassing that she would not take the side dish away. We asked to see the Restaurant Manager who aplogised for the error and told us that he would discuss the matter with the chef. I explained to him that we had specifically chosen to stay at the Sheraton Park Hotel and also to eat in the Restaurant as it was a special occasion and so far we were less than impressed with the experience at the Hotel and its restaurant. After our meal I asked to see the Duty Manager and was met by Roman Husock who attempted to excuse all of the events experienced so far. It was at that point in time that Mr Husock told me that the Sheraton Park Lane Hotel is a Five Star Hotel. I explained to him that if the Hotel is in fact Five Star, the management should inform the Hotel Staff of what is expected at such a level. A degree of intensive training perhaps or just a reduction in the Hotel's Star Rating may be the best solution.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location .. Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: altmanderson
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my five night stay .. upgraded to a one bedroom suite overlooking Green Park using my new Platinum "suites nights" awards. The Sheraton sweet sleeper bed was so comfortable and we loved the renovated marble bathroom .. modernized yet true to its art deco origins. Had a sumptuous breakfast in Bracewell's each morning .. the staff were very attentive and the coffee was strong and flavourful.. Concierge and front desk staff were very helpful .. special mention to Roman at the reception for his photography tips and Jesse at the Palm Court Bar for concocting the ultimate cocktail .. Piccadilly 112 with fresh ginger, Midori, gin, lemon juice .. went very well with the artisan cheese plate and wasabi crackers. This would be a five-star review except for occasional trouble with one of the lifts and the need to renovate the room carpets. Everything else was fine and I would repeat !

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: Wimster
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Not too pricey, except the breakfast (bad coffee, not worth the 25 pounds!). The great sheraton beds. Unfortunately I was staying next to the service elevators and all day full carts of trays with food were next left and took 45 minutes every time I called to have them removed... Would go back as everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Much better this time”
Reviews.Author: udaypilani
Reviews.Content: Park Lane Sheraton has excellent location if you want to be in a 5 star at Central London. The shopping district is close and so are other attractions. The problem last time was the smaller room, this time I stayed at a room on the 8th floor ( executive floor ) and the room was much bigger ( compared to UK standards ) and hence comfortable. The food is good and service prompt. Price wise, comparatively the hotel also scores on its neighbors and contemprories.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else but here”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep613
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Park Lane Sheraton on the 7th floor in a suite and an executive room (with a view of the park). The best part of our stay was the view, and as a returning native Londoner (now living in Cambridge) I enjoyed being able to see the London Eye, Big Ben, etc from the window. Everything else about the hotel was absolutely awful. We arrived at 3 in the afternoon and our room wasn't ready until 4.30, which is beyond the advertised check-in time---and the women at reception were incredibly unhelpful and rude. Our room was refurbished but still shabby for a suite, with carpet stains and a very very weak shower pressure among other things (like a suspiciously dirty and smelly 'hot box' in which our in-room breakfasts arrived---shudder). It just seems like the whole hotel is understaffed and that the staff don't communicate with each other at all---in what appears to be poor management. Then our first morning we discovered that there wasn't any hot water---a massive inconvenience to our plans---and then when we attempted to check into our second room after the first night for a guest that had joined us, the very inexperienced receptionist, Kia, was incredibly rude and declared that our reservation had been cancelled to the whole reception area, and couldn't seem to grasp that we had TWO reservations for separate rooms and insinuated that the four of us were attempting to stay in the same room! Her insipid and unbelievably snobby tone made the whole experience utterly degrading. As a Starwood member I've never been treated with such incompetence and impertinence. Never, ever, ever, will I stay at this hotel again. I've stayed in many hotels in London and all over the world and never seen such a pathetic and absurd display.

Reviews.Title: “nice & central... hotel in need of renovation...!”
Reviews.Author: Girlofluxury
Reviews.Content: Well my experience at the sheraton park lane was not a good 1 & me & my fiance can say we wont be back...!!! overly priced for the rooms we got...! breakfast fantastic.... plain room, bathroom was horrendous & seriously overdated...! the shower was a complete joke...! you had to spend at least 10 minutes every morning & night trying to make sure the water was just right or it was either freezing cold or far too hot and to make it worse it wasnt even a proper shower it was a stupid old fashioned one thats joined to the taps...! there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room...! the cleanliness i will say was xcellent in the room...!! bed was comfy & nice & peaceful yes... but my in-laws to be room well.... their bathroom was the same...my father in law to be had to use a face cloth to stuff the sink closed so he could shave as there was no plug for the sink...! my mother in law to be one morning decided to run the taps of the bath for there to be BROWN WATER coming from them...!!!!! for 3 nights for 2 rooms we paid £1200 a year in advanced...! so not worth it absolutely disgusted with it...when we checked out my finace told the receptionist about the state of our bathrooms & well he mite aswel never of bothered all she said was oh sorry bout that..!! WHAT We dont mind paying good money for things that are worth it but this defiantely was not & we wont be reccomending this hotel & for future visits to london we will be looking for somewhere else to stay...!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing on most levels.”
Reviews.Author: Geoff L
Reviews.Content: Dated hotel in need of serious refurbishment. Only smoking rooms available in spite of non-smoking specified.

Reviews.Title: “sad old hotel, w/ no hot water”
Reviews.Author: LuxOnlyTrav
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here, and only had adequate hot water in the evening. It is a sad, faded hotel that needs LOTs of renovation.... Staff is nice and helpful. But just painful otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great management and staff”
Reviews.Author: Nairobiexpat
Reviews.Content: I booked via Priceline, so it was a gamble as to which "5" star hotel I would get in the area. After I found out it was The Park Lane I went to check out the reviews on Trip Advisor, and boy was I shocked and more than a little disappointed as to what Priceline was getting me into. As a result of the poor reviews I decided I would take Mr. Paul Dumphy (the hotels GM) up on his offer to contact him and asked if it would be possible if I could request a refurbished room. Mr Dumphy quickly responded and passed my request on to a duty manager who also sent me an EM stating that they were aware of the challenges the hotel was facing due to it's age, but that they were in discussions with Sheraton regarding financing for a major overhaul of the entire hotel - which we all can agree it needs. When I checked-in I was very happy to find I had been upgraded to a 6th floor park view executive room, which was very spacious and comfortable, even if a little old school. I must say that all my contact with the hotel staff during my 4 day stay was first rate - they are what allow this hotel to claim a 5 star rating - first rate. Also during my stay there were a couple of issues which seemed to get resolved very quickly. The first was the funky smell in the grand Palm Court. I noticed it on my first day, as I was going down to the gym (unfortunately you have to go through the elegant Palm Court in your work-out clothes in order to get to the gym in the basement - however the gym is nice, and reasonably well equipped). By the time I checked out the issue had been fixed. The second issue was the East wing elevator - on my third morning as I was leaving for the day, I got into the elevator, the doors closed but the car didn't move. I kept my finger on the lobby floor button and eventually the car moved down. Unfortunately when I got to the lobby floor the doors wouldn't automatically open, so I pressed the "door open" button and the doors opened. I immediately reported the problem to the bell hop. Later that afternoon I returned to the hotel, and sure enough the elevator was posted with an "out of service sign". By early evening when I returned again to the hotel the elevator was back in service. In conclusion, I would recommend that if you want to experience the best this hotel has to offer you contact Mr Dumphy (sorry Paul!) and request a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: An3G
Reviews.Content: First time to London and we stayed here with Starwood points and were treated like royalty. The bathroom could do with a revamp. The room was spacious and the bed was lovely after the long trip. Close to the bus and train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, best thing would be the location”
Reviews.Author: virgovim
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights. Got an upgraded room due to my status, so the room was fairly large (about 50sqm). Although clean and net, the room was old ("faded grandeur" as someone else put it), as was the rest of the hotel. It's supposed to be in art deco style, not that you get that from the room. The bathroom was tiled - so I suppose that was in line with the art deco style...and maybe it's just me, but I don't like white, square-tiled bathrooms. The bathtub was generous, but since I didn't take a bath and only showers, I can tell you without a doubt the following: the fittings for the shower head and taps were on the side wall and given the curtain behind you, there's very little space to shower in comfort...very narrow. In terms of sleep quality, bed etc was comfortable but the a/c in the room blew lukewarm air. So I spent a few mins in a warm room before I opened the window to let in the cooler air. Anyway, the bar/tea room downstairs was truly art deco, with big band music sometimes playing, interspersed with music from Cafe Del Mar. (The strange thing is if you enter from Park Lane, you have to walk through this bar/tea room to get to the lobby). I used the gym (open 24hrs and accessible by key card) and it was ok. Also ate at Citrus, their in-house italian restaurant, which was pretty good. I had a starter portion of the bass fish which was big enough for me not to have a main. The spaghetti was done al dente and quite authentic. Even in the upgraded room, the internet was GBP6 pr hour or GBP17 for 24hrs. So I had to pay, but at least it was fast and it did not drop at all. Finally, it's about a 15-20min walk to Piccadilly and a few mins more to Leicester Square...and to get to the hotel from "Heafrow", take the Piccadilly line and get off at Green Park (not Hyde Park Corner) which is a little closer to the hotel. For me the nice thing was that it was about 10 minutes to Hyde Park as well. So options are good if you wanna take a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: hohumMaui
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this building is NOT new, but your in LONDON, a very old city, and you really feel the classic style and feel in this hotel. I can not figure out why people don't just LOVE this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star. Not even close.”
Reviews.Author: AdamGBUK
Reviews.Content: I booked via a last minute Top Secret hotels deal for a 5* hotel near Green Park. I didn't spend the time working out which hotel I was getting, and unfortunately I got this hotel. Once you're past the lobby the style is more faded grandeur than art deco and guests walking through the tea room to get to the lobby must be annoying for those having afternoon tea. The Classic (i.e. cheapest) rooms are very varied. My expectations were set having read Trip Advisor before checkin but my first room was still terrible for a "5 star" hotel -- not enough space to walk around both sides the bed, no space to put the tea tray down, no plugs in useful so we had to boil the kettle on the floor from a multi block they left trailing along one wall, loads of bits of card and an umbrella for me to buy cluttering the tiny desk etc The room we were moved to was better, but still not as nice as typical 4 star rooms. The shower was unable to keep a constant temperature and varied from scalding to freezing without many help from me. Service wasn't great with the gentleman who delivered the tea/coffee tray hanging around for a long time seemingly wanting a tip and a spare bed being inexplicably delivered to our new room when what we asked for was a second bathrobe (apparently only one is standard) and tea tray. The location is good, but I'd rather pay more for some certainly to getting a reasonable room first time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: cplsw16
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night last week for my wife's birthday. Having read other reviews here upgraded to executive room - just over £200 room only - fair value for central London. Huge room & bathroom, very big, comfortable bed. Furnishings & decor a bit tired. Did not eat in hotel - went for breakfast at nearby coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterPenelope
Reviews.Content: We booked a rail hotel and show package.(Mama Mia) Hotel location excellent close to Green Park Tube so we could get back to Euston for a third the price of a taxi ! Our room was No.242 the bedroom was nicely decorated with a king size bed. Large flat screen tv. Tea and coffee making facilities (but you had to ask reception for these,no charge). Bathroom was horrible,very dated with the old fashioned yellow tiles you know the type and the shower head kept slipping down.Also there was no extractor in the bathroom so it got quite steamy. Our breakfasts were good plenty of everything,we filled up and this kept us going till the evening. We had a drink in the lounge one evening , x2 gin and tonics £21.... Staff very nice and helpful. Shame the hotel needs a really good overhaul. We really enjoyed a trip to Harrods Food Hall,you can be very decadent and eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: RogerRolfRoger
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Sheraton for my business travels to London since five years and I always like to come back. The Hotel is at a nice location, rooms are friendly and the staff always very helpful. I specially like the breakfast buffet, there I really can find all I like for a nice start in my day. Will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great location - over rated - living in the past”
Reviews.Author: jmuk51
Reviews.Content: Dont spend the money - better hotels in the area. Spent one night at the Hilton Double Tree West End the week before and it was superior in every way - Don't stay here -

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: sarahmac1983
Reviews.Content: As part of my mums visits to London we've been trying out afternoon tea at London hotels. after a great experience at Browns we decided to try the Sheraton as the Palm Court room looked fantastic and we were tempted bybthe art deco design and harpist. Whilst thenlounge is beautiful you can't get away from the fact that the rest of the hotel looks tired particularly the bathrooms which we barely 2 star. The lounge itself is beautiful and very relaxing having the harpist playing although once you're out the door it's back into mayhem! The quantities are not as generous as Browns and the service whilst prompt was not as knowledgeable about the tea. The art deco tea service used was beautiful. The sandwiches and scones were good qualitynbut not great although the jams , clotted cream and curd were fantasic. Where it came into it's own were the cakesmwhich looked stunning and also tasted delicious although there were restrictions on how many you could have. For the price I'd saynit was OK but there are better afternoon teas in London.

Reviews.Title: “Rate 4/5* ..Proper rating should be 1/2* Very very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mackam123
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton on Park Lane for our 68th birthday treat. From the outside it looks wonderful in a great location 3 min's walk from Green Park tube station. The entrance to the hotel you walk through the 'tea room to the check in desk 'this room looks very tired and in need of a make over When we arrived at reception alarm bells started to ring the young lady on the desk asked if we would like to up grade to a room with a shower for a further £25.... wife said it was £50 ? and no help with our luggage in 4/5 star hotel Room 135 was teeny tiny and Very VERY awful, grubby carpet with thick dust marks around the edges of the room. The bathroom was a disgrace shower was a joke tile grout was grey (should have be white) and dirty. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, this. Rooms were very hot, had large mobile air con units in them !!! When i stay at a so called good Hotel I always go for a cooked breakfast. The Breakfast at this hotel is a disgrace, the scrambled egg were a sloppy mess, the mushrooms stone cold and hard. the Hash browns the bacon cold and the sausages under cooked. ........ on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give this breakfast 1 One of the most disappointing birthday presents we have ever received the hotel is soulless and in need of refurbishing and its not CHEAP £22.00 3 drinks. All in the hotel is more like a 2 star and not 5/4 star I would love a response to this e mail Paul Regards David and Ruth Liddle I am still waiting for a responce to my e mail

Reviews.Title: “Much Better This Trip; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. It was much better than first visit. They upgraded us (I am Starwood Platinum) to a great “studio suite” which was on a top floor and overlooked Green Park. Great View! Room was a large single room (not really a suite) but with large bedroom and living room/desk areas. The bed was a very comfortable king sized bed with great pillows & linens. The bathroom was a huge old fashioned one with a shower stall on one end and a tub with hand held shower on other. The bathroom and main rooms both had great natural lighting ( too great for my wife who prefers dim lighting for make-up application-not possible near a mirror even with drapes in living room closed.) I loved the shower with a high volume shower head located at (quite high) ceiling level. I really loved the room and the way they treated a Platinum guest. I found electric outlets a bit strange at first…all I could find unused near desk were “Italian style” for which neither the hotel nor I had an adaptor….but eventually solved problem by finding some unused, normal UK sockets in bedroom part of room and by concierge supplying me with a multi-plug strip so I could plug lamps etc in at same time as my computer. Room had WI-FI (free for Platinums). Restaurant still was very pricy, but we really did not consider using it. The Prêt A Manger carry out place a couple of blocks away had great breakfast food (including great freshly squeezed OJ) and was reasonable priced. We were smart enough to have Taxi drop us off at right entrance (not the one on Piccadilly)this time. Location is great! My wife was still turned off by shower and lighting. My “stars” review reflects only my opinion

Reviews.Title: “one night in London”
Reviews.Author: Filmguy7
Reviews.Content: Here on business, and had one night at the Park Lane. The room was very comfortable, and the bathroom elegant. the high tea was a must, but service was just a bit so so. my only complaint was not having a lounge. the location though really makes up for it. if you go just outside the hotel (back entrance) turn left you will find one of the best most vibrant tapas restaurants in all of London!

Reviews.Title: “Park Lane property not so posh...”
Reviews.Author: easterndixie
Reviews.Content: While in an excellent location, this property could definitely use some work! It is an older hotel, but 5-star prices should feel like 5-stars. The cost of wi-fi is outrageous, but couldn't be avoided as the stay was for a week-long business trip. Breakfast was average, but for above-average prices. In-room and gym amenities seem as dated as the rest of the hotel. All-in-all, a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sheraton 5 star standards.”
Reviews.Author: Alybaba786
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dingy, worn and overpriced even by London standards. Breakfast is terrible. Only redeeming feature of this hotel is the Citrus restaurant which serves Italian at a reasonable price, and has friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Maya34
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for pleasure for 2 nights. Actually the reviews here were a little bit frightening. We had to choose this hotel due to our agency's mistake. So our expectations were quite low. We stayed in an executive room which was comf, warm and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is located in a very nice and selective neighbourhood. Yet, it needs total refurbishment as it OLD. There is a strange smell of mould in the hotel lobby. It was interesting to see people having their drinks there on a Saturday afternoon under this heavy and unpleasant smell. The corridors, the breakfat hall and the rooms also have an old, outdated look. Breakfast is good, offering a good variety. Yet, they could offer more cheese types for their international customers. All in all, having stayed in an executive room which was quite nice and acceptable, we had a pleasant stay in Sheraton Park Lane.

Reviews.Title: “wedding anniversary ruined”
Reviews.Author: xanadublackpool
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at this hotel for wedding anniversary was promised an upgrade got put on side of hotel overlookig a run down old building then the assistant manager said how do you like your park view room what park he didnt even know the layout of where his rooms were and what they overlooked very poor response from management. Then during the night groups of guys shouting and running up and down the corridors knocking on peoples rooms when you ask them to stop you get threatened by them and a mouth full of abuse try and ring reception and get no answer eventually they go to bed after this has gone on for about an hour. Then in the morning because of the mess up with what room we were in the chambermaid came into our room at eight am with no knocking on the door or anything else this must have been a shock for her as well as me and my wife who were both naked no apoligy given just oops and closed the door, when this brought to management attention they said it didnt happen oh my i must have dreamt the whole thing in fact i may have dreamt the whole weekend if i did it was the worst nightmare i have ever had and to insult us even more offered to let us join there spg and give us 2000 points to get us started wot a joke eventually offered full refund but this never happened and they still owe us £48 pounds and now dont bother to answer e mails or phonecalls.MY SUGGESTION TO ALL POTENTAL CUSTOMERS IS GO SOMEWHERE ELSE NOT HERE

Reviews.Title: “The old lady needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker2008_7
Reviews.Content: It's a great location, takes you back in time but it could really use a facelift. The staff is friendly but frankly the hotel has outageous Internet costs and there is a limit of 2 devices. Talk about expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet the SPG high standards”
Reviews.Author: NNei
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in SPG hotels around the world and earned my platinum status I decided to risk the Park Lane Sheraton and maximise my benefits like free Internet access, room upgrade. etc. I must admit the service was excellent, especially for London - the check-in lady was polite, greeted and welcomed me, and shortly after arrival to my room was presented with a half-bottle of champagne, shortbread and strawberries. However, as other reviewers have pointed out, the entire hotel is in bad need of refurbishment. Clearly this will cost a lot of money, but in these days of tough competition, especially from boutique and no-frill hotels, this is a no-brainer. I can and did pay the same amount for a very nice boutique hotel in central London. Put it differently, a no-frills hotel, also in the centre of London would be equally comfortable, at a third the cost. An enlightened architect and design team can refurbish the old dame Sheraton and still keep the same charm.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location- If you need anything else -look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: I did notice the negative comments but chose to stay here on a short trip last week as a SPG member because of the location. Easy walk to most places or the tube station is nearby. However the hotel is a dump behind that impressive facade and a nice restaurant with excellent scones and tea in the afternoon. Its probably works well for SPG members burning up points on a vacation, but if you are looking for a business hotel with value- probably need to look somewhere else. The rooms are tired, early 80's carpet, plywood single beds put together- you get the picture. Internet is spotty and breakfast is a soggy mass of what else -chain hotel breakfast fare. The staff are pleasant, helpful, try hard to work with what they have and try to please.

Reviews.Title: “Never 4 star let alone 5 star! This is often on secret hotels last minute.com”
Reviews.Author: 4orange4
Reviews.Content: This often on last minute.cpm secret hotels, " overlooking green park etc".... And the location is very good, and to be fair the prices are good on last minute, sat £ 100-120 per night. But how a hotel can claim to be 5 star with such awful old bathrooms I will never know. The rooms are ok, nothing special,but the bathrooms are at least 20 years out of date! Use if you want a place to sleep centrally, but don't expect a great room!

Reviews.Title: “in need of updating but pick the right room and...”
Reviews.Author: glutenfreeswede
Reviews.Content: I have actually stayed here before and I was so disappointed I changed hotels... However, I thought I should try it again and this time it was a completely different story. It turns out that there are some rooms that are excellent. This time I stayed in an executive room with a park view and it was lovely. Yes the decor was not modern but it was nice and clean and the room was massive. The bathroom was lovely and looked like it had been very recently renovated and both a bathtub and a walk-in shower. Room service was great and they are well aware of food allergies and adapt to them without a problem. The reception was efficient but then again I checked in late and checked out very early. Concierge was friendly and efficient. The location is central. I do however agree that internet access should be free, in particular considering it is free in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-our room had seen better days,maybe”
Reviews.Author: ruthL36
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay. Arrived late-check in was very efficient. Our room was on the first floor,although we had requested a high floor. Not major-it was at least quiet. It was a very spacious room with plenty of storage space! The room was,however, a little cool with quite a draught from the window,that the plush curtains did stop. However,the bathroom was COLD. Really cold. It was a cold spell but with no heating in the bathroom,we really felt it. The palm court bar was very nice. The breakfast was good with a lot of choice. Overall, a good hotel but maybe didn't meet all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dirty, poor value”
Reviews.Author: JamieHerts
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in an SPG hotel during this trip to London as we just joined the programme, we've stayed in a number of Hiltons and other chains but thought we'd change brands this time. The location, as everyone says, is great. The entrance into the hotel is quite nice in an old world kind of way and check in went ok, thankfully we were no where near the lift which can disturb our sleep so that was a good start. Unfortunately it was down hill from there, the room size was fine after all we went to London to do other things than sit in a hotel room. The carpet had a 4 - 6 inch band of black grime/dust running around the room which looked like it hadn't been cleaned for years (I'll be sending photos to SPG customer services). The shower head drooped so much the water ran down the wall so we had a bath which was a bit more time consuming, we had shirts we wanted to keep hung in the wardrobe but they had to hang them outside as there was only a small space to hang items. Why put the safe half way up the wardrobe and fill the remaining gap with an ironing board and robe? In the morning, after getting to sleep at 4am because of the uncomfortable mattress which sagged in the middle of the bed the cable in the back of the phone fell out causing the phone to ring and wake us up about 7am. Craving a cup of tea we had to order tea and coffee, for the hassle it would have been good if it was fresh coffee but after ringing twice and waiting 40 minutes we got the tea/coffee tray most hotels provide in the room as standard. There are much better options in London and this was way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: nasher1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for new year an had to change rooms 3 times. They were all disgusting, mouldy and smelly. The hotel needs completely refurbishing can't believe I paid £500 for 2 nights when it was not even worth a £5! Had it not of been new year we would have walked out. DO NOT STAY HERE you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in dire need of updating”
Reviews.Author: David&Buster
Reviews.Content: There are many great, old hotels in London. However, this is certainly not one I would choose to stay in again. The hotel has some good qualities: The location is great, and the neighborhood is one of my favorites. There is a lot to do in the area, and the property is right by several parks (which were terrific for running). Furthermore, the property looks great - from the outside. It also has a bar/tea area that is one of the areas you would walk through when entering the hotel. This area is definitely the nicest area of the hotel. The bad: The hotel needs to be unpdated becuase it did not feel clean, and parts of my room felt run down. While I will admit that I prefer modern over traditional design, I don't mind traditional when it is well maintained. This hotel isn't. Futhermore, the lobby itself is very understated. I will also admit that I was concerned about the cleanliness of the room and sheets, because there were some stains on the sheets (not large, but still a little disconcerting for me). The lobby staff was not friendly but not rude either. I'd describe their attentiveness as average to below average. However, the concierge was helpful. I probably would have given this hotel a three star rating just because I liked the location as well as the look of the exterior. However, the booking site I used classified this as a 5 star property, but it has the look and upkeep of a 3 or even a 2.5 star property. I would recommend looking elsewhere. If I had booked this hotel in the U.S., I wouldn't have cared as much because I travel within the U.S. all the time. The only concern I would have had was about whether the room was sanitary. Because I am not in London often, I considered just loosing my money and going to a different hotel. I ended up staying, but I noticed a hotel that had comparable rates for the time I was staying, and I wish I had stayed there. If you want this location and like modern design, I would strongly recommend the Metropolitan London hotel over this one. Sorry Starwood, this one is a miss.

Reviews.Title: “5 star 4 star 3 star??? great location poor room”
Reviews.Author: dave u
Reviews.Content: booked through thomas cook as 5 star, actual 4 star, more lok 3 star. reception nice breakfast very good, room like premier inn, air com didnt work, bath taps leaked no tea or coffee, location great, if you could get the room for under £100 would be vale for money rooms need a good update,

Reviews.Title: “Superb Executive Rooms in great location opposite Green Park”
Reviews.Author: test_opener
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Room for two nights on Starwood Points redemption. The room was superb, one of the most spacious we have ever stayed in. Even with a very comfortable king size bed and double sofa bed for our young children, there was still ample room for all the family. The furnishings also had a modern luxurious touch whilst still in keeping with the traditional style of the hotel. The marble bathroom was also very luxurious, and was almost the size of a small room itself! Our room was a corner room on the 7th floor, not overlooking Green Park, but we were told it was one of the bigger Executive Rooms to accommodate the double sofa bed for our children. The location of the hotel is outstanding for exploring central London, within comfortable walking distance to Green Park tube station, Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly, Bond Street/Oxford Street and Knightsbridge. The staff were also very friendly and courteous, with only the occasional delay from housekeeping in accommodating our requests. The only negative I could find are the very high rates charged for wifi access. Overall a very enjoyable stay in a great location in central London.

Reviews.Title: “'Art Deco' afternoon tea...”
Reviews.Author: StuartSW4
Reviews.Content: We had the 'art deco' afternnon tea (which means a glass of champagne was included at £39) in the main lounge on a Saturday afternoon. Whereas other 'fancier' hotels in London offer 'top end' experiences this was a more relaxed affair. The harpiest, good quality teas and fresh sandwiches, scones and cakes served leisurely rather than break neck speed made for a lovely afternoon. I would recommend anyone visiting the hotel to check out the art deco entrance to the ball room, a msaterpiece of art deco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location..”
Reviews.Author: andyccpc
Reviews.Content: My wife made a "Secret Hotel" booking via Lastminute.com and once the identity had been revealed we were a bit disappointed to read some of the negative comments about the hotel in view of the fact that she was making the reservation in order to celebrate a friend's special birthday. We noted that one of the managers of the hotel generally took time to respond to the reviews and decided to email him for assurance that we would not be disappointed. We received an almost immediate reply from another manager rightly pointing out that there were also many positive reviews which was a point well made. It was acknowledged that the hotel was "challenged" in certain areas and that investment was being made in refurbishment where appropriate. The reply went on to assure us that they would take care of our booking and make certain that is was a memorable experience. We needn't have worried - we were all delighted with the room allocations on the 8th floor and our friend was particularly pleased with the fantastic view across Green Park from their windows. Check in was friendly and efficient, the rooms were large enough with very comfortable king sized beds and ours had the best shower I have ever experienced in a hotel. The location is superb with easy access to Green Park and the wonders of Mayfair and comfortable stroll to Covent Garden. We had breakfast on Sunday morning and took advantage of the 20% discount ticket offered at reception. This reduced the price from £25 to £20 and overall considered to be reasonable value for money with a very good selection of hot and cold food items on the buffet. Thank you to all for ensuring that we had a lovely weekend break and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Park Lane”
Reviews.Author: Roger D
Reviews.Content: My second home. One of the best in the world in terms of service from all of the staff. I would not bother staying anywhere else in London.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and grubby, 4 star - no way”
Reviews.Author: kimawe
Reviews.Content: Booked through Lastminute.com one of those 'secret location' deals for 2 x standard rooms. New from description it was The Park Lane, Sheraton Hotel, so from looking at their website I knew what to except (or so I thought !!!) Room was VERY tired, grubby carpet with thick dust marks around the edges of the room. All bathroom tile grout was grey (was white) and dirty. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, had to ask for it to be sent to our rooms (maid had forgotton) no iron, but an ironing board !!! again had to ring for this. Rooms were very hot, had large mobile air con units in them !!! Spoke to receptionists about our dissapointment when we checked out and she said & I quote "yes our standard/classic rooms are in need of some attention, in fact the hotel is being refurbished soon" Won't be going back there, normally stay at The Cumberland, thought we'd try somewhere different, never again....... very dissapointed. Especially as this was a treat and family get together for our son's 30th Birthday

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet in London”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, with many quality features not found in modern buildings. A haven of peace and quiet just off Piccadilly, in central London. One of the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At the Park Lane Hotel London”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: FIrst off i would like to thank Assistant GM Andrew Wooton. Over the top job by Andrew and his team. Customer service, Room and Location was all outstanding. The Park lane Hotel is a traditional london Hotel. We stayed in the Executive Room which was tremendous and Clean with Marble Bathrooms. Easy Access to the Undergrown and walking distance to Buckingham Palace. My Wife and another couple who was with us will definitely stay here again. Thanks again!!! Charlie

Reviews.Title: “Dont have the cooked Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bertibasset
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say the hotel is in a great spot, but when i stay at a so called good Hotel i always go for a cooked breakfast. The Breakfast at this hotel is a disgrace, the scrambe egg was slopy mess, the mushrooms stone cold and hard. the Hashbrowns sogy the bacon cold and the sausages lightly cooked all in all 1 out of 10 the coffee was good

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position in central London”
Reviews.Author: MartynKelly9662
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as was seeing a show. Good size rooms, but ask for a refurbished one. Comfy beds and a fantastic breakfast. Brilliant position with Buckingham Palace right across the park and Piccardilly Circus 5 minutes walk. Friendly staff and hotel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Used rewards points, otherwise overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CityPrep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on two separate nights of our trip. We used our Starwoods Rewards Points, so it worked out excellent for us. The hotel is nice, the staff is friendly, I like the upscale traditional decor. We got upgraded both nights on the room we stayed in. The room was spacious, much larger than most hotels rooms that one would find in Europe. You could tell the hotel was making upgrades as the walls were being painted in the hallway while we were there, and the carpet in the room smelled and looked brand new. The furniture in the room was nice, but was a bit scuffed up. So the rooms could have used either new furniture, or some re-finishing. The bathrooms were nice, ours contained a tub and a stand-up shower. They did look like they were last renovated in the 90s though, so they could use some updating; although, everything was clean and in working order. If I had more time I would have loved to have high tea in their Palm Court, the tea looked very nice and the room is beautiful. There was a harpist playing there when we went. The food also looked good. I don't think the tea was cheap though. I want to say it was something like 36 pounds a person or close to $60 USD. You had to pay extra for wi-fi and the price was exorbitant; however, depending on which room you stay in, you could pick up the free wi-fi from the other hotel next door... Overall, our stay was nice, the hotel was nice, but I if I didn't stay free with our Starwoods Points, then its not worth paying the price to stay here - very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “old glamour and EXCELLENT customer service”
Reviews.Author: Vernon G
Reviews.Content: we recently decided to do a quick shopping trip , birthday celebration and relaxation vacation in UK . it took us a while to decide upon what hotel to book and we stumbeled upon this hotel , the Park Lane Sheraton. After reading many reviews of this hotel on various travel sites and remarks what fellow travellers have made, did my husband decide to contact the manager prior to our trip and ask for an early check in and possible upgrade of room. We were very very happy with the fast and effecient service that we received prior to the trip and was thrilled with the excellent service we received! A very big thank you to mr.Roman Husock- what a lovely gentleman he his - he personally took care of my husband and I and was always interested in what restaurants we were going to and even just a little chat. The concierge service is top notch and a great great management team that ensures the smooth running of your vacation . I truly was stunned by this hotels' delivery of service! We upgraded our room to the execitove rooms and had a lovely view towards Green Park and the gorgeous London Eye .. ( room 736) . Lovely comfortable bed , gorgeous bathroom and fresh linen and towels every day and even on turnaround. Mr .Dunphy the manager sent to our room a lovely bottle wine and canapes and we were touched by this kind and genuine gesture . thank you so much - we felt really happy staying with your hotel ! the Palm Court is a lovey old school lounge where harp music in the afternoon fill you with thoughts of a country hotel - such charm and gorgeous furniture ! We had to do the ultimate test and requested the fabulous cosmo , drink! Wow a pale pink sumptious cosmo made with utter elegance and to found out that the junior bartender wants to be an actor . Once again we felt that the client is transported back to home with all the amnenities of our house! Great service , great hotel and awesome smoked salmon and croissants for breakfast ! Thank you to the management especially for your fast and awesome service and Mr . Roman Husock - you are the new generation of customer service in this era - we look forward to shake your hand again and exchange holiday chats ! Wearing fur gets you anything ,everything and a cheeky smile from the staff! 10 out of 10 !

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: darren s
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel as the mystery choice on lastminute.com described by them as an " Unbelievable offer at a Hotel in Piccadilly - 5* " How right these words are as this is an unbelievable offer an unbelievable 5 * Hotel with unbelievable levels of neglect, decay and underinvestment. A very poor advertisment for the well know and respected Sheraton brand.. If lastminute . com had revealed the name I think from all the other poor reviews (that only seem to be able to credit the hotel with a good position,) I would never have booked. Please do not expect a 5* nothing, the rooms, the food or the staff deserve this award. You only have to be at checkout to hear number of complaints to realise this is trading on false pretence. Come on sheraton do the wise thing and down grade to 3* and people will know what to expect ( And charge 3* prices) What should have been a special 50th Birthday treat durned into a big dissapointment. The rooms look like they have received no investment in over 30 years. Air con that doesnt work , odd furnituure, dated and broken bathrooms, lots of noise from pipes, floors and other guests who like me are not able to silence very old dated doors that only seem to slam. Hospitality trays lad lack any sende of hospitality " cheap coffee and 4 tea bags that has seen better days The management seem indifferent to this travesty of a 5* hotel My advice save your money a travellodge would be better and not so expensive

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, only compliments”
Reviews.Author: melaniecohen
Reviews.Content: We are a Starwood owner and well travelled. We planned to take our 13 year old granddaughter to London to celebrate a special occasion. Checking for Starwood properties we came upon The Park Lane and booked before we read trip advisor reviews. When we did read them we were somewhat concerned and contacted the general manager to share our concern. He immediately responded and assured us that he would take care of us. I had noticed on trip advisor how responsive he had been to each review posting. We further contacted the concierge, Sahil, to assist in getting theater tickets. Even tho we chose the hottest show in London he was able to get us tickets and was completely responsive. We knew our flight arrived at 5:30am in London and hoped for an early check-in. No problem. The Assistant Manager, Andrew Wooten was there to assist us. Now to the review. Everyone in this lovely, wonderfully located hotel was wonderful. The room was quite large, had been refurbished and accommodated us perfectly. Our granddaughter had a wonderful trip and we noticed other families there. The hotel is very family friendly. The Palm Court available for breakfast, tea and cocktails is beautiful. We will definitely return to this hotel. No complaint, only compliments.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: minnowlam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated a 5 star and I would say our 2 star in Mykonos was better. The only thing going for this hotel is it's location. We followed another reviewer's advice and got a corner room and it was bigger with a couch and table for a little sitting area. This was helpful as we travelled with a 1yr old so there was room for her to move around. The bathroom phone I'm sure was from the early 80's when I'm assuming being able to talk on the phone in your bathroom was a must? We used cash and points so I guess we didn't feel ripped off but if I paid full price then I would have stayed somewhere else. There is a nearby pub which serves great fish and chips - ask the concierge for their recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in london!”
Reviews.Author: Va2Broadway
Reviews.Content: The Park Lane Hotel may not suit all, but for people who are interested in having a hotel in a prime location, with good service, and excellent rooms then it is the right hotel for you. Yes, it may not be new with modern decor and all, but it has it's own classic classiness that I was definitely pleased with. The bathroomm in our room, which overlooked piccadilly, was amazing with an extra large shower and tub. The hotel staff is for the most part very friendly and accomodating, I will definitely stay there again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC92
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton on Park Lane as a twixmas break. From the outisde it looks lovely and is in a great location. The 'tea room' as you walk through looks great too - but thats where it ends. We had only booked a classic room so I was not expecting too much but we were very disappointed. The room, whilst clean, was in dire need of decoration and was very small. The bed filled about 70% of the room and with a 1980's chair squashed in the corner and an unecessary table, it was difficult to move around the room without bumping into the furniture. There was a free-standing air-con unit which was unusable at night it was so loud and the bathroom looked about 25 years old, with a bath tap that constantly dripped. It wasn't cheap and we will definitely not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, somewhat dated and expensive”
Reviews.Author: wclodfel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location on Piccadilly, directly across the street from the park and walking distance to Hyde Park, Regent Street and the heart of London. Unfortunately it's in need of updating (though construction appears to be ongoing). While London is always expensive, this hotel has prices that are on par with others in the area that are nicer and in equally wonderful locations.

Reviews.Title: “location is only good thing awful hotel not 5*”
Reviews.Author: carinabird
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on new years eve for my birthday. reception staff were ok but not over friendly. ok as always will be truthfull we were given a room that was certainly not 5*. with dents in doors, a cracked toilet, missing tiles in toilet, a 1980s air con unit, a ripped head board and scratched furniture. when u enter the hotel reception you think its going to be the same in the room but they really need to spend money on the rooms not reception. its like two different hotels. after phoning to complain to a very put out rude duty manager we were moved to a junior suit. lol this was in need of renovation also just a lot bigger than the original cupboard room. keep in mind if you get the room by the lift on floor 2 you constantly hear the lift. we also got woken up by the broken air con at 2 in the morning banging very loud. the best things about this hotel are the staff in the breakfast room and its location. if the gm should read this please spend more money on room renovation you cannot rely on its location. you should be a 4* at most when was the last time you were aa inspected and what room warranted 5* status because we never got it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by the Park Lane Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler19
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel, I was apprehensive about our stay. On entering our room, we were pleasantly surprised. The executive room was large and contained a desk, seating area in front of the TV, and a large, well-lit closet. The room was nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. My son did complain that his rollaway bed was hard but he seemed to sleep well. The bathroom was large and even had a wall-mounted makeup mirror. Everything was clean. The hotel has charm and character. You know you are in London, not simply a generic, nondescript hotel room that could be anywhere in the world . The room faced a small street with buildings so there was no view to speak of. Nonetheless, the hotel is comfortable and pleasant and the location is excellent. Renovations are in progress, the day we left, they were painting the hallway outside our room.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Simons Island, Georgia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Give These Guys A Break!”
Reviews.Author: Herdlinger
Reviews.Content: I stay at SPG properties all over the world and have grown accustomed to the many benefits of being a platinum member. Several times I have been upgraded to a $3000 a night Presidential Suite after only paying less than $200 a night for the room. However, that is not my expectation each and every time I check into a hotel. Yes, this is an older hotel and it has a great location. Every cab driver commented on how nice the location was. We were not upgraded upon arrival. There was a large wedding party that night (we saw the bride). They offered an upgrade to a suite for our remaining 3 nights, but we declined. The room was fine and the housekeeping was outstanding! I told the person checking us in to give the upgrade to one of the cranky folks on TripAdvisor. His smile told me he had read the reviews! Before arriving in London, we had spent Christmas in in Rome. From there, I wrote a note to the hotel asking them to make a dinner reservation for us and to have some large bottles of water in our room. The Concierge, Sahil, responded within the hour that the 2 requests had been honored. The restaurant he selected for us was perfect. His service to us during our stay was the best offered by any Concierge we have EVER met. The other thing I liked about this property was their spirit of giving back. They certainly do a lot of that. Their Executive Chef and Food & Beverage Manager, Andrew Bennett has been with them since 1994. Chef Andrew has been presented with an MBE by the Queen. He received the honor for his “exceptional services to the hospitality industry”. As well as running the food and beverage operation at the Park Lane hotel, Chef Andrew spends his time attracting young people into the hospitality industry. Over the past decade he has built up a network of schools and colleges which he works with on a regular basis to offer work placements to students. This is a hotel that honors its guests and its community. We will return there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Brow1
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims to be a 5* but it is the worst 5* hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel is very shabby and has not been touched for years. The bathroom was tiny and had clearly not been refurbished for decades. The Reception staff were very unpleasant and were rude to a young couple trying to book a room. Stay here at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “Park Lane Sheraton hotel cannot rely on the location forever”
Reviews.Author: jacc76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights this week. I booked through priceline but it was not cheap. When I read previous reviews I was a bit apprehensive but was more than happy with the location. The hotel is in Piccadilly and walking distance to all the main London locations and Green Park tube which is a great tube to get to the rest of London attractions. I agree with other reviews that taxis come and go from the back entrance in a back street but most people happily walk to and from the front door which means walking through where people are eating afternoon tea. We did have afternoon tea there ourselves and the flow of people did not distract, in fact made the people watching interesting! Overall the staff were helpful and the common areas were luxurious as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. We had requested a twin room and that was no problem for them. Check in and out was easy. All good so far. My issue with this as a 5 star hotel is that the bedrooms are old and tired with bland decore. Definately needed a paint job. There was some sort of air conditioning machine in the room which wouldn't have been out of place in a 1950s American motel. The bathroom was definately substandard as well with a mixer shower tap over an old bath. It was quite a art to shower without a scolding or being frozen! Come on Starwood hotel group I think you need a serious upgrade of the bedrooms and bathrooms to compete with other 5 star hotels. The worse issue they need to address is that customers should not have to ask for coffee and tea making facilities. They should be supplied as a matter of course!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and overall it was a great experience. For starters the hotel is on the Piccadilly Line, so you can take an inexpensive ride from London Heathrow to Green Park Tube Station, and take an easy walk to the hotel which is just down the street. We arrived early Friday morning and a room was available so we were able to check in around 9:00 get a shower and head out for the day without missing a beat. The hotel, besides being in a great neighborhood is pretty cushy and the rooms are fairly good size for a European hotel. We found our bed to be extremely comfortable and the linens were very nice. There was a couple of glitches with the shower, but the hotel staff was very responsive to our requests and sent a maintenance man up right away. The continental breakfast in the hotel dining room ( 18 pounds) is very good and the hotel also offers a sort of destination tea experience. The only other negative is the concierge desk seems a little inexperienced compared to other more sophisticated hotels we have stayed at. The hotel seems to be pretty consistently busy with lots of couples and families staying there during the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Dismall and filthy”
Reviews.Author: TownInn
Reviews.Content: This hotel requires a complete overhaul. The carpets are filthy. There are no wall coverings and the walls are filthy have not been painted in years. The furniture is tired and old. The washrooms are disgusting with old stained toilet seats and showers that don't work. What a disappointment resulting in an immediate checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,spacious tired rooms, far from luxurious”
Reviews.Author: BestSoprano
Reviews.Content: The location was super -across from the park, walk to most top shopping! The hotel is charming and rooms are well sized but tired old carpeting and the old simple furniture don't fit the level level of the hotel. I'd stay there again for convenience and relative value, but it's not exactly romantic or luxurious! If they spruced it up, it would be a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced with what you don't get”
Reviews.Author: Coleen K
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed at this hotel, my friend was a SPG Platinum member. The room was spacious with a huge marble bathroom. Although the view was less to be desired(looked at the side of an aptartment building) we were delighted with the location. Being across Green Park and easy access to the Tube, we were comfortable. What I didn't like was there was no coffee set up in the room. You had to ask for it and it was not a coffee pot. The staff on that stay was very helpful and friendly. On my return this past October, I found a different situation. Because I was not traveling with my SPG platinum friend, my husband and I were put in a very ordinary room with a king side bed taking up most of the space.
