The rooms were very drab and the shower head never worked correctly. The hand held piece kept slipping down the pole it was to be attached to and the tub was very slippery. The toilet never flushed properly. The room had a stuffy odor and was never ventilated properly. Although the room service this time was very good and we always came back to a clean room, the staff at the front desk was not hospitable. We really love the location and the Hotel. Behind the hotel are some great local pubs. With the price of what we paid a night, we expected more of a 5 star quality. That hotel is in great need of a facelift and new decor. Not sure if I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “over-rated, over-priced,”
Reviews.Author: s s
Reviews.Content: Great location but that's all. Tired, aged decor, long delay before room ready:bathroom design potentially hazardous (I nearly slipped in the bath:the surface had been painted and no anti slipmat provided). No tea/coffee making facilities in room:you had to specifically request via room service which we did however it never materialised:breakfast was of poor quality and luke warm (just like the attitude of some of the staff). Went with others for a Birthday Theatre Break, enjoyed the show but this hotel wouldn't win any awards from me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: I had read quite a few negative reviews about this hotel so was a bit reluctant to make a reservation. I'm happy to report that the hotel is quite nice. I was very happy with my room and received wonderful recognition as a SPG Platinum member (received the polar opposite treatment with sister property down the street...Le Meridien...which was dismal). Anyway, on with the positives. My room was spacious and overlooked the fall foliage in Green Park. Comfortable bed. Stylish and roomy marble bath. Rather decent fitness facility that meets the needs of a traveller. I really liked the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Far from 5 star”
Reviews.Author: rous123
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute which i always use for booking hotels when on business. The first time that last minute got it wrong. Although the staff are very accommodating and very helpful the hotel is far from five star and there is a sense that it is trading on its history and location! The room we stayed in was very tired and the facilities were very poor! In my opinion reflected very poor value for money and definitely not five star!

Reviews.Title: “Aging but great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Qaiser K
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Park Lane Sheraton in London for over 10 years. Its convenient location, friendly staff (though frequently changing) with its closeness to tourist sites as well convenient centre city location makes it ideal. It is also close the two of the Great London Parks to provide the option for walks. The back of the hotel leads to Mayfair with its great shops, restaurants and landmark stores and clubs. Qaiser K.

Reviews.Title: “When will it go for refurbishment and real hotel staff?”
Reviews.Author: partagas92
Reviews.Content: My last stay in this hotel has been quite disapointing. Let's start by the positive point: Location is good, convenient. The Palm where afternoon tea is serve, and drinks in the evening, is a nice cozy place. Now, let's move to the rest, unfortunately... Rooms are old, decoration is from last century (I would refer to pre WWI!), service is optional, beside few too rare real professionals. Even the uniforms seem to be tired at the front desk. It is not the first time I have bad experience in this hotel. I won't even loose time commenting the bathroom. It definitively needs to total refurbushing. Last but not least, place a Platinum memeber close by a room that is going under work isn't the smartest think to do. I am sorry to write my first bad comment on a Starwood hotel, which remain for me the best hotel chain in the world. Need immediate remedies.

Reviews.Title: “A little outdated, but high 'service oriented' hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MattRobNL
Reviews.Content: My wif and I stayed here last weekend, and while we understand some of the criticism, this is in our view a great hotel. The hotel seemed to be fully booked or at least really busy. People were all over the place, restaurants were busy; that must be a good signal. As a Gold SPG member, we received an upgraded (Executive ?) room, which was close to the elevators (but not noisy) and relatively large with a seperate sitting corner with couch and chair. The king bed was great and the shower was one of the best we had compared to recent hotels. We really loved the room. The service was really great, concierge helped us out great, Guest services was there for us, as they made us feel. I asked for a late check out and I felt like I could ask for anything and we could stay until 4pm. When calling for checking out, front desk again was so friendly, warm and nice, that I really wanted to let people know this by my review. Although we must admit that this hotel must really be updated to current standard, it still has a sense of 'the grand'. And also, this is hotel has one of the best locations in London, within easy reach of Bond Street, Regent Street, Oxford Street, Piccadilly, Hyde Park, etc. We realy loved our room, the location and the service here.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Lady, but still elegant!!”
Reviews.Author: bobwood
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the recent reviews about the Park Lane Sheraton I feel it is time to give my opinion again about this fine, but admittedly ageing hotel. I have stayed a number of times since I last reviewed it in 2006, most recently this weekend, and while I can see justification for some of the criticism, there is still much to be admired about the Park Lane. The first thing that I will admit is that I am amazed that it is still open as a Sheraton, as it was thought a major refit was only just around the corner. That has obviously not yet happened, and during my stay the hotel was very busy, my first reaction therefore would be that poor hotels are not usually fully booked. The best points are the food, the 'Palm Court', the beds, (try to get a refreshed room) and the friendly staff. The hotel restaurant, 'Citrus', is a quality restaurant, the food is excellent and well presented, again full during my visit: breakfasts are taken in Bracewells and are as much as you want to set yourself up for the day...eggs benedict is highly rated by my wife!! Palm Court is a wonderful place to sit and watch life go by, the afternoon tea service is rated as one of the best in London. The bedrooms are variable, the refreshed ones are fine espcially on the SPG floor, the beds are excellent and the wide screen TV's have a wide range of channels. It still irks me in this day and age having to pay £16 a day to use 'wifi' in the bedroom...but then the Park Lane is not alone in this policy. Some of the rooms are 'tired' and you will have to see what you can do if you really object to one of these rooms. Overall the hotel still has a sense of the grand about it, but I would hazard that a major job must be done on it in the not too distant future...but I bet that will be after the Jubilee and the Olympics have passed. It still has to be one of the best locations in London, within 10 to 15 minutes walk of Piccadilly, Hyde Park, The Palace etc and it still gives me a sense of occasion for all its faults.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FIVE STAR”
Reviews.Author: QX56
Reviews.Content: We rented 3 rooms for our family of seven, Aug 24, 2011 to Aug 27, 2011. I find it very annoying to be misrepresented. The hotel is very old and needs a renovation. It actually reeks of mold in certain areas. I've have stayed in 3 star hotels which are in much better condition. After a lengthy debate, the management agreed to include free breakfast for our entire family. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel needs a major overhaul (including the owners) but, not the front desk staff. They seem to cope as best they can given the product they have to work with. In cases such as the it is the upper management( ie: owners) that are fleecing and misrepresenting their clients. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few different hotels in the London area, this being the first fancier one. Based on that, very nice front desk staff (even tho another guest was being *ahem* difficult), they handled her well & weren't short with me as a result. The room was very nice, large. The bathroom was also nice - but confusing. The shower door is only a half door, so water sprayed quite a bit & it took some getting used to, to figure out how to use the bath/shower controls (and I'm pretty quick). The beds are very comfy - the location is great. For the price however (and I used points - so it cost me nothing) I would sooner stay at one of the 2 lower grade hotels in Earls Court. Great location tho! And again, super comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oliverwoods1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend and we got a suite back in April. We had pre booked and were heading out in London for a meal and drinks. Although the price is expensive it is worth every penny, the King Size Bed was huge, the location was perfect, the car park was great, the service was again amazing and the decor in the ball room was fantastic... Worth Every Penny!

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea At Palm Court...Better Off In Marks & Spencers!”
Reviews.Author: pcmaczone
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife were really looking forward to this Afternoon Tea at The Palm Court but were left feeling pretty disappointed with the whole experience. First up, the supposed dress code? There isn't one! We dressed quite smartly for the occasion but it seemed you could wear what you wanted. Saw one guy with a bright green puffer jacket, jeans, trainers and a bobble hat. Perhaps that is what they meant by "smart/casual" ? Staff, all of whom seemed to be from Eastern Europe, were very pleasant and efficient. Our coats were taken to the lobby for us and we were seated right next to the harpist who did a sterling job playing throughout the afternoon. We were asked if we wanted drinks but since Champagne was included in our menu we just ordered sparking water which arrived promptly. The waitress opened the bottle and poured the water for us. A slice of fresh lemon had been added to the glass which was nice and something we both like with our sparkling water. Following this we were brought two glasses of Taittinger Brut Prestige Rose Champagne, which I believe is a blend of different Champagnes? I'm not a connoisseur but it was very nice so no complaints there. After about ten minutes another waitress came and asked what tea we would prefer. My wife chose Jasmin and I went for the Moroccan Mint as I wanted to compare it with the tea we have at home. The tea's arrived in good time and our cups were filled by the waitress. So, first big let down, the tea. Not great. Although they clearly used full mint leaves for my tea it hardly tasted of anything at all. In comparison the Dragonfly Organic Moroccan Mint I have at home tastes far superior and that comes in a bag! My wife's Jasmin didn't fair any better....it looked nice but that was about all. Next up came the finger sandwiches. There were five in all. Coronation Smoked Chicken, Roast Beef with Wasabi, Roasted and Smoked Salmon on Pesto Bread, Grated Egg Creme Fraiche and Cress on Carrot & Herb bread and finally White and Brown crab meat with cucumber on brown bread. All sounds very nice? Very bland would be a better description. Honestly I have had tastier sandwiches in a Costa Coffee shop! There seemed to be little if any seasoning and you would have been hard pressed to notice the different types of bread if indeed they were different. Moving on, next to arrive were the scones. I think there were two fruit and two plain along with two types of clotted cream and two preserves. These at least were well made and the preserves and cream were very tasty indeed. Last up were what they call the "Fine French Pastries". I think the French would be appalled to have their country's name tacked on to these. They "looked" the part but were disappointingly tasteless. Someone else mentioned the traffic through the middle of the tea room and I have to agree. Having people wandering through with their cases and shopping on the way to their rooms just cheapens the whole affair and pretty much turns it into nothing more than a premium price cafe. We had no complaints about the staff. All were friendly, in an efficient sort of way and did their job superbly. The decor is nice and were it not for the constant stream of people walking through it would have probably left us with a much nicer impression. The big let down for us though was the food. It doesn't matter how nice your decor is or if you have a harpist playing beautiful music in the background, if the food doesn't taste good then the whole exercise is no more than smoke and mirrors. We are not expert food critics but we do know good food when we taste it and this definitely wasn't it! Honestly we could have spent a third of the price and gone to our local Marks & Spencers super store where they have an excellent restaurant. Ok the surroundings are definitely not as nice and the staff often leave a lot to be desired but the food is ten times better and it would have cost a lot less....oh and we could have done our shopping at the same time :) I think we'll try The Ritz next. It's costs more and is not so easy to get a booking but at least they DO have a dress code and I heard the food is much better. Will report on that if it happens

Reviews.Title: “One more nice stay in Park Lane!!!”
Reviews.Author: antonella1985
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay and although hotel is a bit dated I find the rooms very comfortable. Beds are extremely soft. Executive room that we booked was spacious and very clean. Marble bathroom had a bath tub and a shower cabin. We were overlooking the Green Park and Big Ben through the trees. Hotel staff is proffesional. They welcomed us very warmly and hotel has an unbeatable location. I would always return to this hotel gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: mandub8
Reviews.Content: It's not a new hotel but therein lies a lot of its charm. Checked in on Friday - very pleasant experience. First room we were shown was a bit musty but we were immediately moved to a king Size room on the first floor. Great bed, nice size room for a city centre hotel. Not luxurious but perfectly adequate. Bathroom higher than it was wide and I have a personal aversion to shower curtains. The real star of the hotel though is the breakfast - which was included in our rate. Lovely friendly staff, the best granola ever and great self service pancakes. If you get a good rate you'd be much better off here than in a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: oldhousegirl
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at this hotel (3rd in the past 18 months). I was upgraded to an Executive Room, so my room was big and comfortable but the regular rooms are a bit on the small size for this category of hotel. My biggest complaint remains that the hotel is noisy. Not street noise, and wisely the layout is such that you do not hear the neighboring TV (the bathroom buffers that, which is great). However, the doors are very heavy, and they slam shut. So when others come or go on your floor, or the floor above, you know usually know about it. It was impossible to get rest without earplugs. A new experience during this stay was the screeching of the pipes from an adjacent room early in the morning. I asked my husband if it was a fire alarm. Luckily this didn't happen every morning, but when it did it was terrible and lasted as long as our neighbor's shower. The bed is very comfortable. The location is terrific, right across from Green Park and just a block from the Green Park Tube and walking distance to many sites. I have always found the staff was very nice and polite. The concierge at night was very kind and friendly. Because fog delayed our flight and we'd arrived at 2 a.m. I had phoned ahead and we we arrived all our paperwork was ready to go (we appreciated the speed since we were so exhausted). The prices for all hotel dining are outrageous, and why bother anyway with so many excellent options in walking distance. London hotel prices overall are overpriced, so while I think this hotel would be overpriced in any other city it is really a reasonable value by comparison. It is one of very few hotels I've experienced in the UK (where I have traveled extensively over the past 20 years) that doesn't have a total disaster of a shower situation -- i.e. they have managed to design a bath/shower that doesn't completely flood or wet the bathroom floor. That alone is surely worth a few extra pounds and worth a return visit. The closet is enormous and has a good safe, which is great if you're staying a few days. Probably the worst thing about this hotel is having to use the odd side street entrance, where nasty drivers are ready to run you over and taxis are always speeding along. The hotel frowns upon using the Palm Court entrance on Piccadilly, so usually guests are forced to take an unpleasant walk down the side street (whose street sign is torn down, are where one night revelers had vomited along the tiny sidewalk).

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Heathrow”
Reviews.Author: Durak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two days. We were a little annoyed that at check-in we had to wait an hour until 3pm until our room was ready, but otherwise the stay was enjoyable. Clean and comfortable. And the nicest aspect is that the hotel is near the Green Park tube station, a direct shot to Heathrow (5 pounds rather than 30 pounds in the express train or 100 pounds by taxi).

Reviews.Title: “The worst 5 star hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: marranello
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying here a few years ago and my secretary made the mistake of booking via last minute a 'secret extreme luxury hotel overlooking green park' having realised the hotel was in fact the Park lane i immediately rang the hotel directly to explain my last expereince with room quality was not good and could they try to provide something that would be better this time. I was goven room 636. A dirty room with black stains all round the carpet edge and a bathroom thats seen better years. I requested a change and was given a third floor smaller room overlooking the park, very noisy, bathroom was dirty as was the flooring. Although the bedding was clean it was one of those expereinces where i almost felt happier sleeping on top of the bed than in it. Reception - 'we aim to serve you' very helpful- I can only suggest if 'sir' isnt happy you pay £40/50 plus vat upgrade to get a better room. Its the first hotel ive ever been in that seems to offer this as an alternative to a decent clean room. the price was £135 on last minute and i felt robbed- looking on the website directly this room is £260!! There are many bad reviews about this hotel on this site, and occasionally a management response stating 'if you return - we hope to offer you an improved quality - or words to that effect. In this instance this hotel was goven a chance before my arrival- knowing the facts but chose to offer the same low rent rooms that are old dirty and tired. NEVER stay in this dreadful place.

Reviews.Title: “More like 3 Stars - Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Alastair R
Reviews.Content: Heathrow was closed due to fog and we had to find somewhere to stay fast. We thought we were going to stay in a top class London hotel - but as soon as we walked in we KNEW it was going to be dreadfull! This may have been a nice hotel in the 50's but it does not come close to modern standards. The bathroom was old fashioned, cold and uninviting. Room amenities were non existent - we had to ASK for a kettle/tea & coffee and when they arrived NO biscuits - how mean & miserable! We had no alternative that night or we would have checked out and found somewhere else. Staff tried their best but this hotel is in poor condition and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Khaled_D
Reviews.Content: There is no way that this is a 5-star hotel. The carpet is old and smelly. The bathroom is a disaster. This is by far the worst hotel that I have ever been. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Another Stay at the Sheraton, Not Much Better”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I'll actually do 3.5, if I could, but definitely not 4 stars. I just can't believe that the Starwood options in London are so poor. Yes, now they have the W Leicester Square, but it is sooo expensive, not sure it will ever be an option. I'm happy to report that service this time was much better than I've had in the past. I was checked in quickly, despite it being just 8am (and having just gotten off of a red-eye), I was definitely grateful. I had an upgraded room as part of Plantinum status, but it was still so dated, and not in the quaint British style. The carpet was threadbare and the bed was the typical 2 beds pushed together. I came back one day and the nightstand was pulled far from the wall (like perhaps they were trying to clean, but then never put it back?). The room set up was odd too, the TV was off to the side wall, instead of being straight forward. Actually, when I walked in from the hallway, there was an internal hallway with a closet and a door to the bathroom and then a door to the bedroom. Weird layout, but it was okay. There was a lovely bathtub in the bathroom and overall it was a huge bathroom with a window, so that was nice, high ceilings too. There is a safe in the room, which I used, and when I tried to open it one night, it was completely dead. I left it alone as I didn't need anything immediately and tried it again the next day, but still didn't work. I called down to maintenance and they had someone up pretty quickly, actually 2 people together, which was good practice, as it was later at night and I was a female traveling alone. Luckily since I had that weird hallway and the safe was in the closet, I could go back in my room for privacy. They worked on it for about 20 minutes with no luck, then said they would come back, they did a little while later and finally got it open. I didn't mind that it took so long, I thought they handled it well, were really apologetic and ultimately got the job down. Overall, I'm happy to say that service has improved here, but this place still really needs a facelift. I'm not a fan of the Le meridien there either as the rooms as quite rundown, so I've opted for the Sheraton as I am loyal to Starwood. But as it's a bit further walk to my office than i would prefer, and the rooms are not great, even if you do get a bigger one, I think I'm going to have to find a different hotel for my weeklong work trips to London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: This was or second visit to the Park Lane this year. Again a great stay -- it really makes London a special place to visit for me and my colleagues. First of all, the location is tremendous. Out the back door is the heart of Mayfair with great pubs and restaurants. Out the front door is quick access to Piccadilly, Covent Garden, Buckingham Palace and Westminster. My room was ready for an early arrival. King room with upgraded bath (be sure to ask for a new room!). Plenty of room, area for working and relaxing. No park view this time, but pleasant from up on the seventh floor. Finally, be sure to visit Nigel at the concierge desk. His recommendation and ability to get us into one of London's hottest gastro pubs on a Thursday night was impressive, appreciated and put a great end to a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Park Lane Hotel - Bathroom very poor”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: Booked a Kingsize bedroom three weeks before stayimg but was down-graded to a standard small room with a shabby bathroom with no bath plug and a shower that was impossible to use. Excuse given was " am sorry your bathroom needs refurbishment!". Yes I know I said, Great!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all impressed”
Reviews.Author: Henders65
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I stayed in the Park Lane Hotel on the night of Friday 11th November 2011, having decided to come into London and day earlier than planned. We were booked into The Savoy for the Saturday night, so thought we'd try a different hotel for the Friday. Big mistake. It was a bad experience from beginning to end. There's insufficient space for vehicles to pull in at the front of the hotel and what space there is gets taken up by taxis. The hotel has its own parking garage, which is a plus in London, but nobody really seems responsible for getting your car in there. Easier to do it yourself. Unload your own bags and take them into the hotel. Then get them to the room yourself. We'd booked a room online and were coerced into upgrading it at check-in. They then told us the room wasn't ready, despite this being around 7.30 in the evening. We were reasonably happy with the room, despite having to get our own bags up there. Thank God we'd booked dinner in the Windows restaurant at The Hilton, just round the corner, and there's a review of this elsewhere. Check out was no happy experience either, with a number of disputes on the bill. I managed to get them to pull my car in front of the hotel, so I could load our bags. Why isn't this a part of the service? I'm sure some of you readers are thinking, "what a pampered pooch", but I have to tell you that the whole Park Lane Hotel experience cost us more than The Savoy on the following night and just bears no comparison. Needless to say, they won't be seeing us there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another splendid stay”
Reviews.Author: LizzyPasta
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Park Lane for the night before the Royal Parks Half Marathon - and chose very well. We had a superbly appointed room on the 7th floor, it was peaceful, relaxing and everything you need before the 'big day. We dined at Citrus in the evening - a super meal with carb loading, and being on-site was just an added bonus. The staff there were excellent and attentive. The night's sleep was good, peaceful and the bed was of the usual Sheraton high standard. Breakfast was super - the whole family loved the spread...I however stuck to porridge and a banana and felt jealous of their full-cooked English! So ...off for the race, puff..pant...puff.....13.1 miles and a couple of hours later staggered back to the hotel, up for a lovely soak in the bath, room service lunch and a generally relax until taking afternoon tea in the Palm Court. Excellent spread, Champagne went down a treat and the sandwiches and cakes beautifully fresh and flavourful. Great selection of teas to suit every taste also. Car was lovely and safe in the garage that is well located to be very convenient, the staff there are also attentive and helpful, and no comments about me walking like John Wayne when collecting the car to go home. So - in short - we had a lovely stay, and I am used to staying in high class hotels around the world in the Starwood brand - this one never disappoints. Thankyou Sheraton Park Lane, see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea - not a stellar occasion”
Reviews.Author: JoolsCI
Reviews.Content: Palm Court Lounge was attractive as the ambiance was very afternoon-tea appropriate. Downhill from there. Champagne was so-so (i am not a Mumm fan and an alternative was not offered). The sandwiches were not particularly inspiring and, after a small plate of finger sandwiches, the two of us were were somewhat reluctantly offered another plate to split between us. Considering previous experiences elsewhere, and also starving ourselves for this occasion, we were were somewhat mortified by this proclamation! The scones were nice, the lemon curd very good indeed. Patisserie, we were advised, was a choice of two small desserts each off the tray. Tea was good, but one strainer between two meant that, for the purists amongst us, the tea leaves and the tea were mixed. Makes the point of ordering fine teas slightly moot. The water that we ordered never turned up and once pointed out, I had to argue that them bringing it five minutes before we left was not appropriate. When service did turn up (it was quite sparse and several times we were left with empty plates and glasses) we were in fact served by four different people, none of whom poured tea. Discretely asking to be pointed towards the facilities met with a blank stare and two louder and much less discrete efforts at "lavatory", then finally "toilet" met with results. The facilities were not the grandiose affair that I expected but were small and fairly worn looking and worst of all, I had to queue! There was a harpist. At least I think there was. In the hour that we were there she took three breaks and played for a total of about 10 minutes. Will I go again? Never! Much better value and service to be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “No improvement!!”
Reviews.Author: kerry h
Reviews.Content: its my second stay here! After being told that there were some renovations done,I expected a change so I booked here again. The carpets in the corridows and in the rooms are smelly and need urgent change.The checkin staff are great and the breakfast is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: RotaryRoamers
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location than the Park Lane. It's centrally located and very near to the Green Park tube station, which provides easy access to most London destinations, including easy access to and from Heathrow Airport. While not a new property, this hotel has plenty of history and comfort as well. Expect great service, comfortable rooms and only a 5 minute walk to Buckingham Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Renovation,Renovation, Renovation”
Reviews.Author: g-drako
Reviews.Content: First, they should empasize that the main entrance is from Brick St, so arrivals will not disturb people having tea or drinks at the bar, which is next to the Park Lane side (secondary) entrance. Poor amenities in the normal size room. No sound proof, so you can listen the ones walking outside your room, as they can listen to you. Good working desk and enough space at the executive rooms. Breakfast buffet just acceptable, while the "high tea" is a good one. Extra charge for the WiFi in the room is not nice. WiFi should be treated as the electricity. The hotel needs serious and complete renovation. Overall, below the expectations from a Sheraton property in such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews didn't do it justice!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: We went to the Park Lane in mid-October. The first time was for 3 or 4 days, the second for an overnight. Very nice experience -- great staff, great location, and the beds are sooo much better than the rest of the European hotels we've stayed at. Contrary to other reviews, not once did we have any problems with our rooms not being ready. The staff was wonderful, concierge very helpful. Our first room was on the fifth floor and it was huge. Basically seemed like they put two full mattresses together and even then there was ample space to move about. The bathroom was newly renovated, very nice shower/bath. Very striking. My in-laws were nearby and although they had a street view, their bathroom wasn't as nice. It wasn't horrible (especially to what we experienced in Spain) but it wasn't like our bathroom. By the second time we stayed at the Park Lane, we knew to ask for a non-smoking floor. We were put up on the top floor. The bed was HEAVEN (again, especially compared to other European hotels we've used) and the bathroom was well done too. Our room was very quaint with lots of character. Sloped ceilings, view of the river/Eye/park, etc etc. I never realized how important beds were to me before this trip but man, it really can shade your experience. Consequently, I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if they keep up with the renovations and updating of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: CorpoHook
Reviews.Content: Superb location, but that is where it ends. Staff at check in unhelpful, incompetent and arrogant. Room extremely poor and not exactly clean. Bathroom very dated, impossible to regulate temperature on shower and a filthy plastic shower curtain, which as we all know tends to stick to ones body. No tea or coffee making facilities. Air conditioning so loud that you can´t sleep and have it on at the same time and even more difficult to regulate. It would be generous to award 3 stars to this place, but someone must have been under the influence of something, to classify this place as a 5 star hotel! Never ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby overpriced disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Amylaub
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through last minute.com as a top secret hotel was very excited about staying in a 5 star hotel.....I was not impressed. Very dated, looked dirty in places room was small, bathroom so dated only good thing was location! Just had a nightmare though have booked a trip to London this weekend through last minute secret hotel and been given park lane again really not happy :( nothing I can do now though

Reviews.Title: “Platinum member”
Reviews.Author: JoseAlfredoOro
Reviews.Content: I've always had good experiences with Starwood and accumulated enough stays over the years to be a consistent platinum member. I think this has been the one of the worst stays though, room is small with no offer or explanation of why I was not upgraded. The toilet won't flush and having a hand held shower in a tub makes me dread bathing. I've stayed in the area before at other Starwood properties, I will go there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: pmctav
Reviews.Content: I booked on lastminute.com with an "Unbelievable offer for a hotel in Piccadilly"...well, yes, it really was unbelievable. You get what you pay for. The location is five star. The hotel most certainly isn't! The reception is dated and worn, with a big, very worn and stained rug that looks like it's 100 years old. First impressions last. We attempted to book in at 2.45 and were told that our room wasn't ready for at least an hour and a half. The receptionist was indifferent to us at best. She then tried to put us in a smoking room, without even asking if this was suitable. No, it wasn't!!! She gave us a code so I could access the wi-fi on my mobile to retrieve my booking reference and, quite helpfully, forgot to tell us that we would be charged £6 for it on check out. My expectations were already so low that the room lived up to them. Good points were that it was very clean, good tv, comfortable bed. But it was quite dated and small and with no glasses for water and you have to call for tea and coffee. Bathroom mediocre with a shower curtain and frosted window with no privacy! Combining the staff attitude and an average room, I would rather pay a extra to stay in a hotel with the 'wow factor' or go to a well known budget chain and get a warmer welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Guest Rooms Are Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: therightage
Reviews.Content: So, not to beat around the bush on the physical aspects of the hotel. Its a shame becasue it could be really good: -Hotel rooms horrible, old furniture (from the 60's I think), no Sheraton standards of water for free in the room, bathtub that is so small a normal woman or man cannot fit, lighting very bad, -Front Desk: tried to check in and room was not ready. No apologies even though I asked in advance. Bellman: Sloppy, not shaven and when he asked if I liked the room he said, "All rooms are this bad". Housekeeping: Barely say hello.....if any recognition. So sad....... The Good: -Concierge: excellent all the time -Citrus Restaurant: Excellent food and service Hard to image it is a Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: roomwithnoview
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here as we were attending a function in the hotel, and did not want to drive home until the next day. The actual function (a wedding) was really good, held in the lovely art deco rooms. The catering was performed by attentive staff and as far as we could see, went without a hitch. Unfortunately the room we were allocated (and the only one we saw) was just the most disappointing accomodation I have ever stayed in. It was so small that it was almost impossible for both of us to get ready for the wedding at the same time. The bathroom was like a corridor with a small sink. It felt terribly dated (but not in a good way). The shower was in the bath, with a musty shower curtain. It was impossible to produce a constant temperature, and I totally gave up trying after many minutes. The room furniture looked like it had been picked up at a charity shop. The worst thing was the overwhelming temperature which was impossible to control, even with the window open. No sleep was possible due to the feeling of being in a very small oven. For the first time in a hotel I wanted to leave in the middle of the night to escape the claustophobic atmosphere. Perhaps we were given the worst room (7th floor) in the whole hotel, but other guests reported similar disappointments. This is such a shame as the function room at the front of the hotel are so beautiful. All in all we felt that the hotel made the functions a priority and did not care about the rooms because tourists would arrive here regardless, due to its location. However we feel they are unlikely to get many repeat visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MVO747
Reviews.Content: Won the hotel on Priceline bidding for a five-star hotel. This is a three star hotel. Avoid the 6th floor !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Rates”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRocky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location twice and hotel is only a few blocks from Piccadily Circus on Piccadily Road so quite convinient to all the nearby attractions and walking areas. Hotel has the old world charm and they are famous for Afternoon High Tea in the Grand Room. Some rooms are quite outdated but second time we were treated with a Suite overlooking the Hyde Park which was quite nice and much appreciated as a SPG Platinum member. I would always consider staying here due to location, friendly staff and spacious rooms

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay....”
Reviews.Author: Vurv
Reviews.Content: This must be a tale of two hotels. Contrary to the majority of reviews here, we had a very enjoyable stay at the Park Lane Sheraton. There were three of us sharing a room, however, space wasn’t an issue as the room was huge. There was plenty of space for clothes with a walk-in wardrobe and two chests of draws. The bathroom was also large with a separate shower and bath. I’d agree that the interior of the rooms is a little dated but this just added to the charm – especially for my two American friends. We didn’t use many of the hotel facilities so can’t comment of the food etc. However, the gym is one of the best hotel gyms I’ve seen, with plenty of free weights and up-to-date cardio and weight machines. The location is excellent. A short walk will get you to Buckingham palace, Mayfair restaurants and bars and the choice of two tube stops. As for the other reviews, I can only assume that it’s the luck of the draw as to which room you end up with.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: wharthog521
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be much better but it's just not. It definitely feels run down and slightly depressing. We had a great room that overlooked the park with a nice bathroom, etc. but the rooms still felt like you were stuck back in the '80s. Awesome location though, really can't beat that. If I had a good rate I'd stay here again; otherwise take your $, pay a little more and go down the street to one of the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Unrenovated”
Reviews.Author: doctaraca
Reviews.Content: Old hotel in much need of repair and upgrading. Doormen at only one entrance. Rather disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Must have got a good room!”
Reviews.Author: Jess D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through lastminute.com with a friend as a package deal to go to a comedy night paid £170 for the entire package for 2. Hotel was fancier than my usual accommodation and was a bit dubious after reading some of the reviews on here as to what i would discover, however we were pleasantly surprised. the staff were polite and accommodating, there wasn't a long wait at reception, we were offered to upgrade but stuck to our original standard room. When we got into the room it was bright and clean. Beds were very comfortable. There were complimentary tea and coffee facilities available (you had to contact reception to get it delivered). The Bathroom had retained its original victorian tiles which was nice, and the bath was half sized but since i shower anyway it didn't bother me. The only issue i had with the room was that the shower head could do with updating (it would only aim straight down and you couldn't adjust this due to the shower head being too heavy for the hinge). I understand they want to retain the victorian style but lets be honest, most people would be happy to forego the style for usefulness. This upgrading seems to have been adapted in other aspects of the room since we didn't get a 'yellow box' hairdryer, we just got a normal one so please consider new shower heads to match. We didn't have food here as £26 for a breakfast seems a little overpriced so can't comment on that. Overall a very good stay and no problems encountered (apart from the shower). Would definatley stay here again, although perhaps wouldn't pay normal room fees, but if i was paying a similar price as this time, i would be happy to. One more thing to note, the manager needs to stop leaving generic comments on everybody's reviews as to me it appears he skimmed through and copy/pasted the reply. Can i suggest a less fake reply to the comments otherwise don't bother as it comes across as more insulting. Thankyou for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Caroline U
Reviews.Content: We thought we were booking a 5 star hotel - the rooms in this hotel were little better than a 3 star pension. In the first room they tried to pawn off on us, we couldn't even find the bathroom for 5 minutes as the door to was stuck. Once we did, the 1950s plumbing sealed the deal. Back we went to the reception where we were told that a better room had "just" opened up. Slightly bigger, with a bathroom that had at least been renovated in the 1980s, but with a plywood panelled closet that looked like it belonged in a cottage. With a 5 lb charge for 15 minutes of internet in the business centre, dreadful lighting, dingy and musty carpeting and peeling wallpaper throughout, this place was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: ngriff111
Reviews.Content: What a massive disappointment. The room was a decent size but extremely shabby on the verge of feeling dirty. The bathroom was a joke, I felt like I was going back to my student days not a 5 star hotel. Do not book this hotel under any circumstances, really awful. Whoever awards stars to hotels should reassess this hotel. They need an urgent refurbishment so that you don't have to shower with the shower curtain constantly touching you as there is so little room. Downstairs is decorated really well and lulls you into a false sense of security. Never, ever again!

Reviews.Title: “4 star experience”
Reviews.Author: boers
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Lane thru Priceline, and as many of you probably know it is like buying a pig in a poke. One doesn't know what you have purchased until your credit card has been debited, and no chance to change your mind.So we were most dismayed to learn that we had been booked into the Park Lane. The reason for our unhappiness was due to reading all the negative comments about the hotel in Tripadvisor. However,I must report that our stay at this hotel was first rate. The room was lovely and large, with clean modern bathroom..We had requested early check in, and when we arrived at 11am, no problem to check in.Of course, location is superb. Since nothing is perfect would mention that aircon not working during a hot spell, but it was fixed within one day.Finally, would like to thank Mr Roman Husock for making our stay so pleasant. Hope he doesn't mind my mentioning his name

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for your Credit Cards!”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto A
Reviews.Content: I was here on a pleasure/business trip last September, and was really looking forward to London in an extremely good weather condition. We got here and upon check-in everything was ok, we checked in 5 rooms and they requested a Credt-Card as a guarantee for all the rooms, just in case we had any additional expenses (As any hotel does). Little did we know that they "block" a total of 75 pounds per room, per night!! Just in case we spend some money!! With 6 nights to go and many things to do, we had a lot of issues that first day, since the credit card was our main expense tool. Overall, there are many other hotels in London that offer a much better experience at half the price. And I'm no cheap traveler, but I am someone that looks for the best experience while doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mikkitampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points, so I can't rate the room value. The price of the breakfast was outrageous. I think it was 25 pounds of more for a basic breakfast. There is a Starbucks and a Pret a Manger within 2 blocks. We were upgraded to room with a king bed and pullout sofa for the three of us. The room was on the 8th floor and it had some charm. The bathroom was huge with a large shower, double sinks, bidet, shelving for storing toiletries, separate tub and large windows. It is a short walk to the Green Park underground station. It is also an easy walk to Buckingham Palace and it sits in the upscale neighborhood of Mayfair. There was a bus stop in front of the hotel too. I would stay here again because of the location. The service was fine. We really didn't ask for anything. The concierge though did confirm our tours for us and explained the transportation options to/from Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “No value for money”
Reviews.Author: ValiMi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very centrally and for this reason it costs a lot. However the standard rooms are very small and poorly furnished. if you are not a SPG member and you can't upgrade you really don't see the value for the money you spent. Service and personnel are ok. The bathroom is ok even in standard room even if nothing special compared to the price. Breakfast is OK but very expensive and never included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not much else going for it”
Reviews.Author: queribus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com. The rate was 'cheap' so we didn't have great expectations, to be honest. Check-in was quick and polite. We were asked if we wanted the complimentary tea/coffee making facilities in our room. I have no idea why these had to be requested. Our room on the second floor was very dated (although it did have a huge bed). The furniture looked really cheap and the carpet was faded and stained. There was only one bathrobe and an ironing board, but no iron. The bathroom was terrible. Nasty yellow patterned tiles with bad plumbing - toilet flush didn't work properly and it was nearly impossible to regulate the temperature in the shower. The shower head was pathetic and the shower curtain wasn't long enough - therefore water all over the floor. The bathroom desperately needs renovating. Our tea making facilities were delivered whilst were out. The kettle had the shortest lead imaginable and there were no plugs where it would be safely plugged in. In the end we had to plug it in at skirting board level, but the carpet meant in wasn't level - or safe! We were only there for one night and didn't spend much time there, thankfully. Find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: mama2001
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking this hotel I had read many of the negative reviews. I must tell you that we had a very good experience. There were three of us travelling together and our room was nicely sized to accomodate all of us. The location was fantastic. It puts you within an easy walk to the subway which you can get almost anywhere, very central. I would have to say any staff I encountered was very pleasant and the management is on top of making sure your experience is very good. I would also like to mention that our room and bathroom were clean, beds comfortable - not too soft - not too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ella W
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at The Park Lane Sheraton. The room was large and clean, the original decor of my hotel room and the lounge area was lovely. The staff were friendly and attentive and although my room was not ready upon check in I was able to leave my bag and when I returned in the evening could go straight up with no delays. The location is so good for so many areas of London. Loved seeing a bad review about it saying that the bathroom hadn't been updated since the 1930's, it was of course beautifully Art Deco and untouched by standard bland hotel decorating, hopefully it will stay this way, and the other reviewer can stick to her beige!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Martin M
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at the Park Lane Sheraton and consider it my first choice whening staying in London. The hotel's location is fantasic for traveling to and from both City and Heathrow airports, offers easy accessability to London's West End and Oxford Street and is just a short journey by taxi or tube to the City. The public area's are relaxed and welcoming, perfect for business or leisure. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable especially the executive rooms and suites. It is however the service which makes the difference for me over other London hotels. Across the board the staff really do go out of their way to make every stay as pleasant as possible - always pleasant and accomodating they strive to treat you as an individual. It may not be the most modern central London hotels but its location and above all great service set it apart.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Raquel780
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com as a top secret hotel, so did not know which hotel it was until I received my booking confirmation. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived, not only was the location unbeatable, but we had been given an executive room, which was fantastic, it was lovely with a massive bathroom and great shower. We had a huge kingside bed, which was extremely comfortable, the room was quiet and dark which meant we had a great nights sleep. So all in all, we got great deal on the price and were very happy with the hotel and the service, would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic beauty in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanhattanNyc
Reviews.Content: I started to stay here because of the wonderful location between Hyde Park, Green Park and the West End theater district along with easy access to the City and Mayfair. I keep coming back because the staff is helpful, the value is good and the location can't be beat, plus tea in the Palm Court is a treat. (Plus, they took great care of me and others who were stranded there because of the Icelandic volcanic erruption a few years ago.) The rooms are quite large, which is unusual for London. The water pressure could be better, but trading the size of the room vs water pressure comes with staying in a great old hotel. I've always had a great bed to sleep in, and there are many types of pillows to choose from (which is fabulous especially if you like one and your boyfriend likes another). The staff remembers repeat guests and does a good job of providing SPG members with nice perks. The rooms generally have a lot of outlets, which is great since we have to charge so many things these days. My main complaint is with the bellmen and the people who answer the customer service line. They can be slow as molasses.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Park Lane Hotel London”
Reviews.Author: Tom T
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice room, excellent bathroom - huge! The Concierge's were great and found us eighth row tickets to Phantom at Her Majesty's Theater. We did a lot of walking (on purpose) and were 10 minutes from Buckingham Palace, maybe 25 from Big Ben and 30 from the Thames. Nice local restaurants a few blocks behind the hotel. Not touristy at all. If you've never been to London get a 2 day pass on one of the "hop-on, hop-off" busses. It's a great way to see the city and get oriented. The Tube is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: debbie k
Reviews.Content: The Park Lane is a grand London hotel---excellent location close to the Green Park tube stop, across from the park, and within walking distance to many attractions. The room was an outstanding size and well furnished. The bathroom was very large, with a shower and tub and double sink vanity. The staff was helpful, from the check-in to the concierge, housekeeping staff did a very good job cleaning the room. As a well-traveled person, I would definitely stay here again and feel that the Park Lane measures very well against its competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ed3463
Reviews.Content: We stayed on points-and cash through the SPG program. This hotel has a great location, friendly and pro-active staff and a concierge service that is truly helpful. Front staff were helpful and upgraded our room. Our driver from Southampton had difficulty finding the entrance - it is not on Park Lane, and the entrance is not atthe Civic addres on Picadilly, but at the rear on Brick Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly a four, almost a five”
Reviews.Author: SWN
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler and have stayed at the Park Lane a few times over the past five years years. I have also stayed at four or five other hotels in the London area during this same time, and the Park Lane remains my hotel of choice for the following reasons: 1) Location. An easy walk to Piccadilly, Soho, the West End and (in the other direction) Hyde Park and even Knightsbridge; 2) Staff. I personally have never had a bad experience here and for the last two times I would say the staff --- especially at the front desk --- were excellent; 3) Convenience. Green Park Tube is nearby, and Shepard Market with it's varied eateries and pubs is almost literally "just around the corner". While rooms vary in size, we've never had one that was not acceptable or dirty. Depending on where your room is ordered on the schedule for cleaning and the occupancy of the hotel, it can be mid-afternoon before the room is serviced --- but that's true of any large hotel. Word of warning: Although the Park Lane fronts on Piccadilly, the hotel is actually in Mayfair. This is important if you're booking a car from Heathrow or one of the other airports (we find the cost to be significantly less than a taxi) because to a Piccadilly location the fare can be upwards of 130 pounds, whereas to Mayfair 55 pounds. The diffenence, in large part, is because starting about where the Park Lane is located on Piccadilly heading towards the Circus, traffic snarls down to a crawl at almost all times of the day. Trust me when I say that you can almost always walk the ten or so blocks to Piccadilly Circus from the hotel faster than taking a cab or (better yet) a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 1girlintheworld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just concluded a 5 week stay at the Sheraton Park Lane Hotel. From the moment we arrived in our “upgraded” suite to find a dirty, dark hodgepodge of small connected rooms, that obviously hadn’t been renovated in the past 30 years, we were disappointed. This disappointment only deepened with each day of our stay. After sending an email to the guest contact that had arranged our extended stay stating we wanted to move to another SPG property, I was contacted by Roman, a front desk manager. He called at 10am stating we would be moved to a renovated room. After hastily packing up the entire room I then waited and waited and waited for him to call me back. After 5 hours I was finally shown a room. 7 hours after his initial phone call, we were moved into a new room. Roman assured me that this room would be allocated to us each week throughout our 5 week stay (we checked out on a few weekends to travel outside of London). He stated he wanted us to feel at home since we were staying so long and convinced me that the previous mistakes would be rectified so we chose to remain at the Park Lane. No follow up phone call or apology was ever sent to us. We checked out that weekend and arrived 2 nights later to be told our room wasn’t actually available. We were given a new room that was considerably smaller, had a bathroom half the size of the previous and we went from a king bed to a glorified full. Another email sent and we heard nothing for 3 days. When they finally contacted us they asked if we wanted to move again. Needless to say I refused to let them inconvenience me further with yet another move after having unpacked everything because we had heard nothing from them. Again, no apology or note was sent. Nicholas, another manager, assured me that he had allocated the original promised room for the rest of our stay and when we checked out and back in we would receive it. No apology or note was sent. We sent an email to the general manager. He sent a tiny 2£ bottle of cheap wine with one apple as his apology. 2 weeks later we check out again and upon return are yet again told our room was reallocated. We are put in a room so small we could barely fit our luggage inside. My spouse and I travel full-time because of her job and live almost exclusively in hotels throughout the year with an average of 200+ days in Starwood Properties. I tell you this because I want the average guest to bear this in mind when reading this review. If this is the customer service long-term guests with Platinum status receive, you can draw your own conclusions as to the level of service you should expect to receive at the Park Lane. We have stayed in hotels throughout the world and have never experienced such disregard from hotel management, especially at a Starwood Property. As you can imagine this attitude has trickled down to most of the staff as well. Aside from the shockingly apathetic management, the hotel is in dire need of a renovation with stained carpets, peeling wallpaper, ragged furniture and outdated fixtures throughout. The only good things I experienced in my 5 week stay were the breakfast and the location. If those 2 items are at the top of our priority list for a hotel then go with the Park Lane. If anything else is important to you I’d suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel with unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: ruffruff73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Lane for 6 nights booking the room thru Priceline. I was very skeptical of the winning bid after reading some of the reviews. I sent an email directly to the hotel to request a king size bed and provided my Starwood Gold member number. I received a kind response back indicating that they will put in my bed request and also updated the reservation with my Starwood number. Check-in was slightly delayed due to the room still being cleaned. This inconvenience worked out to my favor because as we were sitting in the lobby waiting for the room, the front desk realized I was a gold member. I was immediately upgraded to the executive floor and given a very large room with a remodeled bathroom. My biggest concern was dealing with an outdated bathroom after reading the reviews on Tripadisor. I'm happy to report that the remodeled bathrooms are very nice. Aside from the room, the best part of the hotel is the location. It is on Picadilly and a short walk to the Green Park tube station. Also, the hotel on the north side of Green Park, which means that Buckingham palace is a short walk thru the park. If you want some traditional pubs and restaurants, Shepards Park is right behind the hotel. Picadilly Circus is about a 15 minute walk or one tube stop away from Green Park. We enjoyed having a hotel close to all the action but not so close that you are constantly surrounded by tourist and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: yzanraf
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed here for 4 nights, and I joined them for 2 of those nights. The hotel staff was incredibly attentive. For example, my dad called reception to request a wake-up call and coffee for the following morning at 7 am; my parents got both the wake-up call and a knock on their door (for the coffee) at exactly 7 am. The hotel staff were also very accommodating and flexible with me joining my parents. I originally planned to stay just 1 night but had no problem extending my stay. The room was spacious, and the water pressure in the shower was beyond anything I've experienced. Plus, the hotel is located across the street from Green Park and down the street from Hyde Park! The location is perfect. There was construction in the adjacent building, but it didn't affect our stay (we were out of the room most of the day). The construction is probably why we were able to get a good deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Traditional Hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: MarcLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 1 night at this hotel which I booked via LastMinute.com so it was at a reduced rate. We stayed here as it was convientient for the Natural History Museum were we were attending a party...5 min taxi ride. All staff were very accomodating, extremely poilte & friendly. Our room was very spacious and quiet....would definately recommend & stay here again. Marc

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Dated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAULOCF
Reviews.Content: Concur with most reviews, hotel in good location but the standard rooms are dated and in urgent need of renovation. On entering my room I immediately noticed a musky smell, the walls were stained and it just had a feeling of 'not clean' I was offered an upgrade to an executive room £48 per night more, which I accepted, the room was bright clean and spacious with elegant modern bathroom. 2 single beds were stored outside the room overnight ! and the noise from the service lift and guest lift made sleeping really difficult, on checking out the staff told me that this was a problem with that room. A disappointing stay

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a rip-off, rooms tired - never again”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with high expectations. Arrived and had to wait 10 mins at recpetion as there was only one receptionist on the desk. Finally got checked in and was given key to room. The room was very dated and tired. Old bath with a shower attachment - difficult to get water tempreture right. Next moring went down for breakfast thinking it was included in room rate. Just as I was finishing I was presented a bill for £25. Nothing special at all usual buffet style. This was absolutely daylight robbery! Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service % location”
Reviews.Author: boracay_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days pre-cruise and had to change reservation for my post cruise accommodations at another Sheraton hotel by the airport.It started to get complicated on getting a refund but the front desk peaple went out of thair way by making several phone call and worked it out for me. there is also a small convenience store (Texco) just down the street where we were easily able to get soda and snacks without having to use the room mini bar ;-}. Starbucks was also a short walk for our morning coffee.Additionally, the tube was also a short walk.along with several tourist attraction such as the Queen's Garden and Buckingham Palace among others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Excellent Showers”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker1309
Reviews.Content: Old English Grand Style Hotel, that not a compliment, by the way ! If you get a special rate, its worh it. Because its old it does not implement watersaving features yet! Therefore brilliant shower pressure: you literally have to hold on not to be blown away. Standard 3star rooms, but excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in a bad condition....”
Reviews.Author: r_vaswani
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com and were really looking forward to staying there to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The main hotel areas are great and the bar service was good too, but there was great disappointment with the room. I have never seen a five star hotel with rooms in this condition. Our bathroom was the oldest of it's kind I have ever seen. Having worked in hotels for several years I could not believe a Sheraton hotel would have these kind of rooms. The room itself was average, it had had a lick of paint and new curtains but was not great. Our views, were non existent and the TV did not work properly. Really I would not reccomend anyone to stay here unless you get an upgrade as per other reviews below.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic”
Reviews.Author: jesmas
Reviews.Content: Advised hotel we were there to celebrate anniversary and were upgraded to a huge suite which made us feel special. Staff advised us on show and the location was fantastic. Also good communication with hotel before arrival. Bathroom was bigger than some hotel rooms we've stayed in! Overall fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Traveling Should Be!”
Reviews.Author: JHuante
Reviews.Content: Like everyone says, location, location, location. I was on a personal/business trip and brought my Aunt and Uncle, who had never traveled abroad before. They were nervous, so it was important to me that they have an outstanding experience, so that they'd be inclined to travel abroad again. Trip Advisor, I've found, can be more of a place to vent the negative rather than tout the positive. This hotel was everything a hotel should be. Of course it's old, all of London is, but it's not outdated. The facade is, but the inside is maintained beautifully, and well above a lot of surrounding hotels. I know, I looked after I arrived. The staff was very attentive, and went out of their way at times to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We stayed there for 11 nights, which, in my opinion, is a long time. Certainly long enough to find serious flaws, which we did not. Our rooms were on the 8th floor and very spacious. Far more spacious than most standard European accommodations. The concierge, who was very busy at times, always made us feel like we were the only ones he was helping. The same goes for the front desk and lounge employees. We had short walks to Buckingham Palace, just across the street through the park, the Tube Station, just two blocks up Picadilly, and even shorter walks to some of the best restaurants, just behind the hotel. Would I stay here again? You bet. Hands down. I'm returning next summer, and I wouldn't stay any place else in London. You can't beat the neighborhood, it's one of London's finest.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - comfy bed - rest of room needs update”
Reviews.Author: CCFCfan
Reviews.Content: Situated on the road named Piccaddilly and opposite Green Park. We arrived via tube and walked along Piccadilly road (less than a minute's walk), we entered hotel via doors on Piccadilly and became disorientated as we could not find Reception - which is actually at "the back" of the hotel as there is also an entrance on Brick Lane which is where a taxi drops off passengers. Staff on Reception very helpful and seemd to speak various languages as there was a queue when we arrived and I could hear them talking with other guests - I was offered an upgrade from our Standard Room to an Executive Room for an additional 40 pounds per night. I had made our booking via LateRooms.com and took a chance on their 5* Mystery Hotel - I'm pleased I did as I feel we got a good deal and didn't need the upgrade as our Standard Room was large enough in size with very comfy beds so we didn't bother with the upgrade. Apart from the bed, the rest of the furniture does need updating though as does the bathroom which really isn't 4* standard, but as we weren't staying in the room much it didn't bother us. Strangely you have to request the tea/coffee making facilities and iron from Reception (I've never known this in any hotel I've stayed in?)Getting around London from the hotel is easy as you can buy a one day or one week Travel Ticket and use the tubes and buses all day. The hotel is easy walking to Piccadilly though and Leicester Square is just a minute walk further on so China Town, Soho, Trafalgar Square, Covent Garden all easy to get to on foot if you are reasonably fit. However if like us you feel you have walked miles all day long (we went to Portabello Road Market on the Saturday which is huge - so we bought a Travel Ticket as you have to get there by tube) and right outside of the hotel just to the right on Piccadilly is a bus stop which takes you right through the West End to ease those aching feet. The only problem we had in the hotel is that on the second night, the same-sex guests next door arrived back around 2.50 a.m. and woke me up with their laughing and talking and then you can guess what came next - for a couple of hours these women didn't bother about anyone else trying to sleep! so noise between rooms was a problem and then to top it all off at 5 am the TV set in our room came on of it's own accord - no idea why as it hadn't happened on our first night. Inconsiderate guests are not the fault of the hotel though and as they hadn't disturbed my husband who slept through the whole episode I didn't call Reception to ask them to assist in getting our noisy neighbours to shut up. I would stay at this hotel again - I have stayed in several in central London and this room size for a Standard is good, but not 5*. One tip I have for theatre tickets is to check out directly with the theatre in advance before you go to the so-called 50% off ticket shops and booths around and online. I wanted to see Les Miserables and checked all of the on-line ticket agencies and was surprised to find out that buying direct from the theatre was the cheapest as you get them face value. The ticket agencies all wanted between 20-30 pounds per ticket on top of face value - hope this tip helps you and the show was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Service trumps it...”
Reviews.Author: leo-chan
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Park Lane Hotel for a 3N stay end September. Will not elaborate much on the location which has been widely reported in previous reviews of this property. My thoughts on the stay: Arrival: Rooms were not ready when we arrived (it was 12’ish in the afternoon) and was offered luggage storage while we went out to catch some lunch. Accommodation: The room assigned was spacious by London standards, and the bathroom was absolutely delightful. The room had large windows that provided fantastic natural lighting. Admittedly a little tired, but well maintained and dignified nonetheless (at least the room that I had). Bathroom: My only gripe was the lack of floor mats made the bathroom a little hazardous when wet (polished marble flooring). Loved the separated shower and tub. Staff: Professional and prompt, pleasant yet not too informal. Very good. F&B Had a business discussion in the tea room, was impressed with the beautifully appointed tea room and its highly professional and understated service. Conclusion: Solid stay but the hotel is well overdue for a total refurbishment to bring back the shine. Fantastic location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhs13
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood points to spend 3 nights in London at the end of a Mediterranean cruise. When we arrived at 4 p.m., I asked for an upgrade because we have Elite status and I was told it would be at least 90 minutes before they would have anything? When we finally got the upgrade, the room was large and the bathroom was all marble with a separate tub and shower. The shower leaked and we had to be careful not to slip on the wet floor. The sink was also cracked. One of the bed pillows wreaked of sweat, but I had housekeeping exchange it the next morning. I asked for an electrical converter and they gave me one that didn't work. Then, they delivered this large box and said it was the correct converter. It blew up my husband's electric razor. We didn't even tell the front desk because we didn't want to waste our time filling out forms. The prices in the hotel restaurant are ridiculous and the only people eating in there seemed to be on the"corporate" dollar. There is a Starbucks a few blocks away and a mini-mart around the corner so you can get breakfast. Bottom Line: This is not a 5 star hotel and Starwood should be ashamed of charging 12000 points to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BookbuyerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a little on the old and worn side but the location and friendliness of the staff largely make up for it. You are next door to hide park and an easy walk away from Piccadilly Circus and all the museums near there. There are plenty of pubs and restaurants in the area which should satisfy most tastes. The hotel is overpriced when considering the vintage of the fit out but given that they were sold out on both nights that I was there I guess I can understand why they charge what they do. The rooms are beautifully quiet despite the constant noise that goes on outside. I would happily recommend this hotel if budget is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Blessing”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: This 5 star Sheraton property has much to offer. This gracious old building is brilliantly located... ...a short walk to the Green Park tube make all of London within easy reach. A 10 minute walk brings you to Regent Street and Piccadilly Circus. The lounge is beautifully appointed in a period style, and is most comfortable and welcoming. Most evenings a harpist added to the relaxing mood. The real gem in the hotel is the Chief Concierge, Nigel Bowen. He is gracious, friendly and a wizard at helping solve problems...theatre tickets no one has appear in a trice; restaurants that are fully booked suddenly find a table after a word from him. On the other hand, on check we were greeted as loyal Starwood members and offered a free upgrade. We also learned that in room Internet cost 50 pounds for seven days for each device. So with a MacBook and an Ipad, we were up for 100 pounds, which seemed quite excessive. The room we were shown (115) was a shocker! Two single beds, each made up for one person were pushed together to make one bed. The furniture was extremely tired...a small lamp sat with the shade askew, and the shower was an old fashioned bath tub with a shower curtain. I don't know what the non-upgradre room would have been. I spoke with the Duty Manager, Daniel, who offered us room 126 instead. This had a king sized bed and a comfortable large modern bathroom, though with no shower cap, one bar of soap and one bottle of shampoo. A walk in closet offered plenty of space. The room also had a completely mismatched table and desk, one comfortable wing chair and a mismatching office chair on wheels at one table with no room for a seat at the desk, which had a very noticeable chip on the corner. It seemed as if a bunch of leftover, random furniture was pushed together into one room. To plug in a hairdryer or computer I had to crawl under one table to find a powerpoint. The room had no facilities for making tea and coffee, one bathrobe for two people, and an ironing board with no iron. All of these were promptly provided after a word with Nigel. I've stayed in many Sheraton 5 star properties in various parts of the world. None had rooms that looked anything like these two. After the second room my wife and I gave up and accepted 126. I chose this property first because it was a Sheraton 5 Star and second because of the price of 290 pounds, which was attractive compared to other 5 star London properties. On check out I was reminded of the VAT which added 20% to the price. Would I stay again? Maybe, though I would expect a room that reflected a 5 star hotel rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to London. I chose this hotel because I had Starwood Points that would pay for the 6-night stay without cash out-of-pocket. Prior to leaving for London, I read several reviews of the hotel on this sight and was second-guessing the reservation. Once there, I was thrilled with the hotel. Our room wasn't going to be ready until 3pm so we were able to walk to Buckingham Palace. When we did check-in and arrived in our room, I was releaved to see that the reviews were wrong. There was no ancient hair dryer in the room, rather a new one. The room was lovely, the beds were super comfortable, the room was cleaned very well every single day, the concierge was beyond fabulous, and the shower ran hot, strong water! What was not to love? If I had to pay in the future, I would still stay at this hotel. I enjoyed my stay at Park Lane! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good bones, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgordon11
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is in a GREAT location and they charge for it. Walk to everything from here. HOWEVER, the hotel itself is very tired and in real need of a renovation. The lovely reception lobby is marred by tacky Lucite SHARATON signs that ruin the old world feel .Its very 80's. We arrived early and were told our rooms were not ready, ok fine. But when we returned at 4 and one room was still not ready...not fine, and the front desk clerk could not have cared less. My room was a king as advertised and large enough but the furnishings were hostel like quality and the bathroom ancient, and not in a good way. old, 70's plastic lighting that was yellowed and bulbs that flickered on and off. Nice walk in closet though. Old worn carpeting. The second room we booked, when our daughter finally got it, was NOT the king we paid for but a double slammed up against a wall with a bathroom with formica counter tops. We complained and then they gave her a SUITE! What? Her room was very nice, but we wonder about the incongruency of the rooms! BE SURE TO ASK FOR THEIR BEST ROOM IF YOU STAY HERE AND ASK FOR ANOTHER IF YOU DONT LKE WHAT YOU GET. The bar/restaurant is lovely, marred slightly by plug in air fans throughout for the hot weather. The bartender makes an incredible martini. Breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good deal !”
