Reviews.Author: mikeandpete
Reviews.Content: We booked this overnight stay thru Last Minute.com as we were seeing a show . It was advertised as a greatly reduced , excellent value rate at £198.00 for the night, room only. Reception staff were excellent (we didnt encounter any others) but were extremely busy; we heard them saying - many times - that there were no other rooms available to those who were asking. We had joked that we would probably get a broom cupboard for that price in a 5* hotel - and to be frank it wasnt much better than that ! we were given a dingy room at the back with the double bed squashed against the wall and window. It wasnt dirty , but very much in need of new decoration, and the carpet had signs of wear and dirty stained edges. No slippers provided so you wouldnt want to walk in bare feet ! The bathroom was very tired and outdated ; the shower attachment over the bath had to be held in place WHILE you were showering , otherwise it just fell ! The woodwork/windows definitely needed painting. We couldnt draw the curtains open as we looked straight at other windows directly opposite approx 15' away. We didnt have time to reorganise - but we had already heard that nothing else was available. We were going to complain on checkout , but they were so busy we would have held up the queue behind us. We then complained to Last Minute .com AND the Hotel itself, but received no answer. When we tried to complain to The Sheraton group the site failed to accept it ! Wonder why !? NEVER AGAIN ! DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE 5* RATING - IT ONLY APPLIES TO SOME OF THE ROOMS !

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for one night”
Reviews.Author: paroncider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this central hotel one night before an early flight the next morning. It's perfectly situated on Piccadilly, a short walk from Green Park tube. The entrance we took from Piccadilly wasn't the best with suitcases as we had to go up and down stairs and roll our bags though the hotel bar. Our room didn't have a view, but that wasn't important to us. The room was a good size, with high ceilings and had a comfy bed. The bathroom was small, but very clean, with a large tub and typical Victorian black and white tiles. We ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant, Citrus. The meal was delicious and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Harvey S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Park Lane. This was our 3rd visit there. The service continues to be great and they really seem to appreciate guests. The assistant manager, Roman, was very appreciative of our return to the Park Lane. It seems they tend to keep their staff, since the concierge told us he was there for over 20 years. As other have said, the location is great for walking tours. We walked across Green Park to the Palace in about 5 minutes. Rooms are kept clean and no surprises. I have no hesitation recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Make This Hotel Work For You”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Traveler-888
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews on this site my partner and I booked this hotel for a London visit to celebrate his birthday. Because of the high cost of London hotels we booked using Starwood points. A few days later I received an email from the hotel that offered an upgrade for 40 pounds a nights. This gave us a nice room on the front of the hotel overlooking Green Park and a very nice remodeled bathroom with terrific shower. The room had a wonderful kings size bed and great climate control. There is a new internet option of one hour for six pounds and the staff overall was very helpful. If it's in your budget, book the upgraded room. There were still some minor irritants: No drawers for clothing No working lamp or desk light Our room was not serviced on Sunday Only one small bar of soap for both the basin and shower The great location and easy access via the underground to Heathrow offset most of the shabby elements of the property that are in need of a good upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!.”
Reviews.Author: dondenext
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that The Park Lane Hotel is in a nice location, opposite Green Park (oddly the Hotel is nowhere near Park Lane). The reason for reviewers opinions - some good, some extremely negative is very clear to me. For some trips to London, I have stayed at the Park Lane (4 or 5 stays there over the last 6 years.) It is astonishing how the standard of the rooms within the same category vary so outrageously. Sometimes we've had the type of room you would expect from a Hotel of this standard. Other times we have been given a room more akin to a 3rd rate B & B (trust me I am not exaggerating - you just need to look at reviewers photos) On my last stay We were given a room so awful, it felt as if we'd checked into a filthy squat. Unfortunately, and even though my Husband and I hated the room. We made the decision not to complain due to the fact that a Family member had paid for this as a treat and they were also staying at the Hotel with us. The Park lane has only one saving grace - The stunning Palm Court. This at least remains a great place to come for afternoon tea. The bar is also beautiful. But, Girls.........Take a seat well away from the bar. In fact, do not sit near the bar on any account. We made this mistake and a man passed me a folded paper napkin with his room number on it. I had no idea until later on - but at this Hotel apparently, a Lady who sits by the bar is no Lady... if you get what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely old hotel, and 5-star fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: BubbleBerry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via priceline, and was genuinely concerned when I read the reviews. So much so, that I contacted the management in advance of travelling. I expected to be told that there was little that could be done seeing as I booked at a reasonably low rate. However, the management (in particular Roman), dealt with my concerns patiently, and treated me like I would expect to be treated in a 5-star hotel (even though I was paying a significantly discounted rate). Make no mistake - this is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The palm court room is stunning - something you would never see in some of the sterile, modern hotels. We were upgraded to an executive room and it was spacious and quiet. The bathroom was lovely (I was expecting broken tiles and fixtures). The staff were charming and incredibly helpful. All in all, a surprisingly enjoyable stay. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The problem here is one of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Johnb8
Reviews.Content: To be honest, overall, this isn't a bad hotel. The only problem is that it is not a five star hotel, but is sold as one. If you were advised that it's a four star property (and charged accordingly) you'd be perfectly happy here. The problem is that there is a lot of money needing to be spent at the property. Carpets, both in the rooms and common areas, are older and in some cases in fairly poor condition. Fittings and fixtures in the rooms are a long way from being 5 star in quality and condition. Having said all that, the service here is, for the most part, 5 star. Superb room service staff and food.....and at realistic prices, which is not always the case these days. Very helpful lobby staff. If not for the condition of the rooms, you could just about call this a legitimate 5 star property. But the rooms are what they are, despite the excellent efforts of the manager of the property (who in all fairness has no control over whether the owners spend millions upgrading the rooms or not) to compensate for the slightly shaky room quality through great service. I've only seen the executive rooms, which are apparently much nicer than the standard rooms. If so, you do not want a standard room. The Exec rooms are only "pretty good"....and will set you back over £300 after VAT is applied. You can stay at the Ritz across the road for just another £150 or so, and the Ritz is in a different universe. So the bottom line is that if you can get a room at the Park Lane at 4 star prices...i.e., £125 a night or so......it's a good deal, and good value for money...and you'll be quite happy. Between Tripadvisor's "Top Secret" hotels, which often features the Park Lane, and Priceline, you should be able to get in at that sort of price. But if you're paying full whack.....you are most definitely NOT getting good value for your money. Paying 5 star prices for a 4 star hotel is no fun. So compliments to the hotel manager for doing everything HE can do to make the experience a pleasant one. And shame on the owners, for not spending enough money to make the hotel what they claim it is.....a 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: MOB_Tampa
Reviews.Content: I just checked in for a business conference. When I checked in, it took the front desk clerk over 15 minutes just to find my reservations. nThe WiFi signal is so terrible that I can't pick it up on my iPad, the closet door swings shut by itself because the hinge is messed up, the carpet and paint look like it's left over from a 1970s, the ironing board and luggage rack fill the closet so there is no room for clothes and the bathroom hasn't been updated since the 1970's. This place should be shut down and overhauled. I can't believe Sheraton would allow their name to be associated with such a lousy property.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels are made of people as well as bricks and mortar”
Reviews.Author: MEAK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on location and online price. After doing so, however, I had serious second doubts after reading the reviews. So here is the bottom line: this is not a typical American 5 star hotel, but it is a lovely (albeit slightly faded) European grande dame with character and charm in an unbeatable location. The reception staff were warm and gracious. The concierge helpful. The housekeeping staff had smiles and hellos for the guests. There were 2 managers in particular that bear mention: Roman Husock and especially Paul Dunphy who personally made a special effort to make our stay most enjoyable. There is no doubt that Sheraton Inc desperately needs to spend some money in the building on certain ongoing cometic upgrades, but until that happens, the people are making this hotel enjoyable.....and you cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for all rounder to London! Ask for room 605!”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on points and were upgraded upon arrival. Large room with double sink and comfortable amenities. Entrance hidden (we lugged our luggage through the bar). We loved the location especially the locals at Sheppards Market. You can't go wrong with this hotel if you get the right room. Ps use GReen Park instead of Hyde Park tube.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again A Marvel!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanbyHeart
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have stayed at the Park Lane. Again I received a warm welcome, a beautiful room and great food. As always, the location is perfect. There is nothing like waking up and looking out of the window at Green Park. It is absolutely beautiful. I will make my reservations for November soon! I would not think of staying anywhere else in London!

Reviews.Title: “It's a disgrace to Sheraton name!”
Reviews.Author: camelliaway
Reviews.Content: One of the worst experiences we gathered while I along with my family stayed there from 8-15 august, 2011. Followings : 1) We had reservation for two rooms 2 adults and 2 children. While booking on the phone I had to agree 2 rooms as 1 room can't allow 4 people despite one is really minor aged 3. No issue on that. On arrival the 2 rooms we were given not inter connected, however, 2nd room took 2 hours to get ready. Sill no issue. But both the rooms were tiny and some one can't even properly stretch. Rooms were not equipped with any basic amenities ie mini refrigerator, hair dryer etc. The rooms were not centrally air-conditioned and one of the room the standing cooling system was not working. So we had no choice but to upgrade ourselves to suit which can accommodate 4 people, (however, when I was booking online I have been told several time that no room even the suit can hold 4 people including minor as per the UK regulations) superior, larger, spacious at a cost of additional 200 GBP per night means 2 rooms price that we booked originally plus GBP 200 per night. However, no one could tell us properly what is the room called or named. 2) The suit we got finally was spacious, however none of the doors inside the suits were working. The room was old and not sure when last carpet was cleaned. They said it is a refurbished room. 3) When you travel with 3 years old child you don't expect to order hotel food, kids burger every time. So one evening we bought food from outside for kids and requested for extra plates and spoons and in reply room service informed us per extra plate will be charged GBP 3 and the funny thing is they are confused themselves. Looks like adhoc basis decision. No Sheraton where I stayed in most of the Asia ever asked for 3 GBP extra plate charges. How could you ask some one for extra plate charges who is paying GBP 450 plus per night (excluding vat) for 8 days staying. This is unprofessional and mis selling. Even the gentleman Who served the plates were very much disappointed with his boss's decision . 4) Internet GBP 6 per hour but You can avail package GBP 50 per week. Hotel business decision and I fully respect that but I will expect service. I got a package for 7 days and we need 3 handheld to be connected to the WIFI system. Unfortunately, we get connected to 1, while enquiring and reply from hotel was each additional device has to pay GBP 50 pound each. For what and why, you can get multiple wifi connection from same source and all of our homes connections are such. Is it a additional money making ways for Sheraton park lane? I think the entire place lacks management leadership and directions. I will not request any one to stay there. It is situated at best possible locations. From front you go to green park and got to see buckingham palace in 5 mins walk from back end you are linked to park lane And slight walk will take you to HYDE park. Property is doing injustice to it's competitive advantage. Sheraton global management should look into with immediate effects because similar kind of reviews I have just seen in trip advisor. Sheraton global management should take the full advantages of location by not charging per plate 3 GBP but by providing best quality service at cost of high room charges. Let's not be penny wise, pound foolish! Please try to make more money than 3 GBP for additional plates. Best regards,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-tiny outdated room”
Reviews.Author: EilishZagreb_Croatia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as five star howvere it is a tired four star or three star at best. Check in was very slow, over a half an hour waiting and staff were not very friednly. However, we were given a room earlier than usual at 1pm.We were given room 104 on first floor which had almost no daylight, as it overlooked air conditionning units/extractor fans etc. Room was so depressing we were happy we only spent about 6 hours there altogether (just to sleep) Standard rooms are very small.The bathrooms are also very small and dated. Although there were two of us in the room, only 1 set of products(which are actually very nice) was provided. We saw dirty room service trays in the corridor. Concierge service poor, unable to tell us about train runnings etc for Gawtick (ie. look up on internet) Wrote to manager follwoing stay with numerous grievances and they got back immediately offering upgrade on next stay. Unfortunate that no management seemed to be present during stay. Entrance to hotel is often confusingly through restanurant/tea room from piccadilly where taxi will let you off. More signs to indicate recpetion would be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Starwood hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: I was in London in July for business. As I am a Starwood Platinum member, I usually try to stay at Starwood hotels. Unfortunately, my favorite in London (the Belgravia Sheraton) switched ownerships. So on this trip I tried both the Park Lane (where I had stayed previously) and Le Meridien. The Park Lane is a beautiful hotel -- but many of the rooms leave a lot to be desired if one is using North American standards. Also, I found the staff to be rather abrupt. There was confusion over a coupon for breakfast (I thought they were offering a free breakfast because I was a Platinum member -- no it was simply a discount on an already exorbitant price). In contrast Le Meridien was delightful. The rooms are smaller at Le Meridien but the staff and ambience are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Your Experience will Depend On Your Expectations - Better than the Reviews Indicate”
Reviews.Author: RedRover123
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before I went on my trip and was prepared for the worst but the hotel wasn't as bad as the reviews indicate. During the trip I realized the biggest issue was one of expectations. This is a 5 star UK hotel. It isn't a 5 star AMERICAN hotel. If you are expecting it to be a 5 star US hotel you will be disappointed. I would say it ranks as a 3 star American hotel. For London, this hotel is considered quite posh and impressive. Several people from the UK asked me where I was staying and all 3 were visibly impressed when I told them. Yes, this is an older hotel and yes it isn't a 5 star by American standards but the hotel isn't in America. It's in London and for there it's considered 5 star. It's in a great location and has a great reputation. It's also just a few short blocks from the Ritz. Some of the reviews like the staff and others didn't like the staff. The staff are all very polite and helpful. They are not all "friendly" in the American sense but again they are British, not American. Unlike Americans not all of the staff pretend to care and they don't 'kiss up' to the guests. That's just how the British seem to be. Again, that doesn't mean they aren't helpful and polite as they all were. Some were just friendlier and cared more than others. The biggest plus with the hotel was the location. It was very centrally located and I took the tube everywhere. From what I could gather from some of the other tourists I met on my journey this hotel is a lot better than most in London.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars masquerading as 5.”
Reviews.Author: Overeasyplease
Reviews.Content: Sheraton - come on, this hotel is doing your brand no favours at all. Refurb and remodel please. Clean sheets but otherwise depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: AJWW4764
Reviews.Content: A great price so no real complaints - you get what you pay for, and the location is second to none. the guestroom was tiny! but i was there to sleep, not admire the room good welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Crticalone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 5 star hotel, and was sold to me with that expectation. As they say, expectation is everything. This is not even close to a 5 star property. Everything in this hotel is old and outdated, beginning with its lobby and front desk, which is inadequate to handle their guest load. It took 30 minutes to get checked in becaues the line was so long and it appeared to be that way many times during my stay. The HVAC system is a bit of a joke. It's either on hot or on cold. There is no in between. To balance things out, they put two space heaters in my room. 5 star? To be fair, the staff geniunely tried to make me happy, but there is no question I would have changed hotels were it not for the fact that it was prepaid through a travel agent and it was noncellable.

Reviews.Title: “Believe me”
Reviews.Author: Jackoffinland
Reviews.Content: I´m hosting the most popular prime-time travel-show in my country, spending 200 nights a year in different hotels around the world. "Anonymous", of course. Every now and then I book a room through these exciting and trendy "top secret" -offers, with which you only know the room-rate, location and the rating of the hotel. This far it´s been fun and worth it. Believe me... If you´re checkin in (if you ever even have a chance to get the room you booked) to The Park Lane Sheraton Hotel in London, be ready to face the ugly truth. The only 5-star quality is the staff. I feel sorry for them, having to apologize all the time. I witnessed the long queue of customers complaining and waiting for the rooms to be ready. I got mine after 7 a´clock p.m. The 5-star-staff is running a hotel merely worth of 3. For the first time in my career I do agree with the bad reviews here in Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this terrible hotel at all costs, noisy and shabby rooms, it's vile'”
Reviews.Author: rebalance
Reviews.Content: I wish I had never booked a cheap room through secret hotel rooms based on location, as I ended up here. I had the worst night's sleep in a frightful noisy room with a dirty bathroom both in need of complete refurbishment. When the fire alarm went I cheered up as it seemed as if the hotel might burn down. It's just not worth staying here at any price, however convenient the location is. The hotel knows about the things that are wrong and trades on its position. If you must stay here, only insist on an executive upgraded room and inspect it before payment. The only guests I saw were clearly foreign, poor things. I hope they don't judge the rest of the hotel industry in UK on this one.

Reviews.Title: “great location, needs to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: mervenadir
Reviews.Content: good sized room, great location but the decor is so out dated, needs an urgent refurbishment. it turned out to be below my expectations for a Park Lane Hotel. Reception personnel very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing even on a priceline rate - couldn't imagine paying full price.”
Reviews.Author: sjh2311
Reviews.Content: Half way through our stay in this hotel that has clearly seen better days. You enter through the plush Palm Court and it is downhill from there. Checkin was an ordeal, before in terms of the length of wait, the challenge of getting a nonsmoking room and the difficulty of penetrating the English of the person checking us in. Our room was dingy (lights had to be on even during the day), the bathroom prehistoric with chipped tiles which were at the edges partially overpainted in a slapdash paint job. We were woken at 0830 on a Saturday morning by an insistent chambermaid (our own fault for not using the do not disturb sign) and, as we turned her away, when we returned after 5pm the room was untouched. Another long wait at reception was required to get fresh towels. I assume when the economy is better this hotel (which has a great location) will get a makeover but until then don't let anyone pretend it is five star.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the old world charm and spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: sparkareno
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Starwood points so my stay was free. Having stayed in London many times in closet sized rooms, I wasn't expecting much. On the contrary..our room was huge and the bathroom was also huge. It was remodeled but still retained the look of an old European hotel especially the bathroom with black & white tiles and heated towel rack. There was a safe in the room which was nice. My only complaints would be that the TV was pretty small for the size of the room (wasn't impressed with channel selection either) and the lobby was meh. The staff was very nice. Location was perfect!!! Could walk through the park to Buckingham Palace, tube stop was about 3 blocks & easy walks to Trafalgar Square etc. I'd stay there again easily. Didn't like that they charged a lot to use computers so went to internet cafe which was much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Austerity Plan on the customers”
Reviews.Author: BebeDragon
Reviews.Content: Look at those three photos, they are self-explanatory. In case you are too young to understand what is the yellow box in one of the photos, that is a very old fashioned hose hair dryer. I am lucky to bring my own MUJI mini hair dryer to travel. In another photo, you will see a silver cylinder, that is a umbrella, but if you don't read the seal carefully before you breal it, you will be charged. I must say this management is very shabby and looking for every chances to charge their guests. Concierge and luggage boys are friendly and helpful, front office is friendly too, but very disorganized. Service business is people's business, guests and staff should be both happy. I don't think staff will be happy to apologize to their guests every three minutes for their hotel's poor condition and I don't think unhappy staff will serve their guests happily. I will not recommend this place until they fully renovate it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel! Awesome location, good service, nice room - would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNewlywed
Reviews.Content: - Terrific location, central to everything and close to metro - Professional, courteous service - Big, clean room - Nice bar/lounge We had a great experience and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in London”
Reviews.Author: brian_horwell
Reviews.Content: I really cannot believe the Sheraton is willing to put their name to such a dump. I read these reviews on Hotels and when some are really bad I assume the person must have just had a bad experience or is very difficult, but believe me, my review on this one is just a case of true disbelief how bad the hotel is. In fairness, because of its location and the attractiveness of the common parts, maybe your expectations are too high, however, nothing can prepare you for quite how bad this hotel really is once you are beyond reception. Dossers stay in better accomodation. 1) None of the furniuture matched in the room 2) All of the furniture looked as though it have been picked up off the street 3) None of the facilities that they claimed to be in the rooms were available 4) The room was so small that the double bed only just fitted and my wife needed to get into bed first as I was getting up earlier and if I had not been on the outside I would have had to climb over the bed to get out 5) the bathroom has not been updated since the 1930's 6) I had a bath and the bottom of the bath was like sand paper and filthy 7) The towels must have been dumped by a decent hotel as no longer acceptable for human use I can only assume Sheraton are ruuning this hotel down whilst they await the time to refurbish it but 50 years is a long time to run down a hotel awaiting refurbishment. For their own reputation I would close this hotel as soon as possible. If it is entirely necessary to stay I would not pay more than £75 just for the location but I would seriously look as somewhere else if you can possibly help it.

Reviews.Title: “massively overpriced”
Reviews.Author: craignloz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our anniversary for one night, booked 2 tickets inclusive to watch the wizard of oz at the palladium, which was excellent,cost me in excess of £450 for an executive double with breakfast, we arrived at the hotel at about 15.15 checkin they said was 1500 but was told we wouldn,t have a room for another couple of hours when we returned 2 hours later they tried to palm us off with a classic room, when we eventually got our executive it was very nice lots of space lovely big bed bed and large bathroom, not quite the view of green park as advertised, we had rooftops. Breakfast was a dissapointment to although there was lots to choose from what we had was cold. So to wrap up its a posh hotel where you pay for the name, no way is it worth that kind of money

Reviews.Title: “Dated and worn out.”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel. It is worn out and dated. I had a suite and it reminded me of being in a low rent apartment. Awful. The suite was dim and dingy. It is just too depressing to write about. I did not get my room through price line etc so I paid a lot. Lots of better hotels in the area. Well not many but not many worse than this

Reviews.Title: “Nah...”
Reviews.Author: A_Traveler_from_Ca
Reviews.Content: Ok. I got the room on priceline for $155. Really good for central london. But.... It's just nah.... Really not Sheraton worthy, especially overseas. The lobby area is tiny, with 2 chairs squashed to the side. The room was extremely bland, one little picture over the bed. It was supposed to be a non-smoking room, which obviously meant that they took the ash trays out before we went it - somebody definitely had smoked in there that same day. The bathroom was quaint. Long and narrow. The flushing on the toilet was not sufficient - I'm not going to go into details. And the shower curtain was hung kind of in the middle of the tub, so that it clings to you when you turn the shower on. And then they charged 15 Quid for the internet. Not going back. Have stayed at better 2 star hotels in London. Only reason they got 2 points is that the bed was good. Stinking of smoke but comfy.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: kelly_3399
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during an England/Wales vacation. The hotel is in a great location right across from Green Park which meant a 10-15 minute walk to Buckingham Palace. Piccadilly Circus was 10 minutes down the strret. Shepherd's Market with lots of pubs and shops was a bock behind. The hotel had character and charm and very decent size rooms. The beds were comfy, rooms clean, TV reception very good and extremely friendly and efficient staff. Would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel - good room size - centrally located”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelergirl29
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Centrally located. I used to live in London and use this hotel when I'm in town visiting friends. The rooms are spacious, it's centrally located. It has a great bar. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff but had to demand a good room and really awful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandsnowlover
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Park Lane, Picadilly  Great location and excellent staff in all areas of the hotel from reception to the bar staff. Pluses- Location, quality of service from staff, large bedroom (our friends weren't so lucky as they had a small bedroom, had a wardrobe but no drawers to store clothes and did not have a full size bath). Negatives - last minute.com so wasn't sure what room would be like. Were told we were allocated a smoking room which we refused. We were then reallocated a room but it wasn't ready so we finished our check in process  later that night. The English breakfast was awful and extremely expensive and had to wait ages! Hot buffet £24, a la carte £10.95 plus drinks on top. Food dry and over cooked had to send it back. Did not go back for breakfast the second morning. Found a nicer cafe round the corner in Shepherds Street slightly cheaper but cooked to perfection. Would we go back?  - only if a really cheap deal and nothing else was available! Would we recommend - no (unless you are happy to miss breakfast and demand a better room).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with charm and warmth.”
Reviews.Author: kat29rn2cu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for a 3 night London trip. Booked on Priceline. Was not sure what to expect due to some of the reviews here. We were greeted by very pleasurable staff and the concierge Richard was extermely helpful with organinzing our trips. Richard gave us great directions to some out of the way museums. We travel frequently and this is not our first time to London. We have higher standards for hotels and this one did not disappoint. It has all the charm that you could need in a hotel in London. Hotel was rated as a 5 star on Pricelien and I agree that it is quite close. The hotel has a very classy Palm Court bar/lounge and has won several awards for the afternoon tea. I did not try the tea, but it did look quite elegant and good. The room was always reserved, so book tea early. We had a "classic" room with a king size bed that was quite spacious with chair and ottoman. The rooms have traditional charming English style. Some tiles were cracked on the floor in bathroom, but this does not bother me, I think it adds to the English charm. The bathroom was very clean and so were the sheets/bed/floors. Staff in the Lobby always looking to assist or direct you and offer advice. Upon check in, quickly accomodated our room with a child's cot, which really meant alot to us. We were traveling with a 2 year old. Appreciated the free wifi in the Palm Court, just ask for an access code at the bar. Hotel is directly on Piccadily and 5 minute walk to Green Park tube which gives direct access to Heathrow for like 5 pounds. There is a Starbucks, Prez on the way to tube for coffee. Also, stop at Henry bar/cafe accross from the Green park tube stop. Full English Breakfast there is 8.75 pounds and quite good. Also nice for drinks after a day of touring. If you have 1 bag of luggage and a small carry on, take the tube to the hotel. It is so much cheaper than a 80 pound taxi. We took the tube back to heathrow. It takes about 45 minutes. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Aged Elegance, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: rojamg
Reviews.Content: Used points to book rooms at The Park Lane Hotel for four day family vacation in London. This is a well maintained older hotel conveniently located across Green Park for Buckingham Palace. This places it within walking distance of Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, and Parliament. The Green Park station of the underground is nearby. This is on the Piccadilly line that goes directly to Heathrow airport. Harrods is about 0.5 miles West. The Palm Court lounge at the Hotel is a historic meeting place for breakfast, lunch, and afternoon tea. We used it nightly for late night cocktails and ice cream for the kids. Arab Sheikhs doing business during the day, casual late at night. Nice coffee house next door, Starbucks on the way to Green Park station if your addicted. Several nice restaurants in Mayfair district behind Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDanS
Reviews.Content: Their insults, and general inattention to detail made the stay a real disappointment. Here's a smattering. * Dingy brown rooms with dirty carpet and minimal decor. * $USD10/hour internet in the room that didn't work properly and required a service call; further, once paid, it's only good for one computer - a phone or second computer costs double * Door between rooms in a suite wouldn't shut * Inattentive doormen; you have to walk the length of the building to find someone to help you with your bags, leaving them alone on the street * No lock available on the minibar The worst experience was that we made a reservation for a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 children that would each require a crib. When we arrived, they claimed it was a reservation for only 2, although they still had the note about the two cribs. Evidently they thought the babies would be in a room by themselves? They refused to honor the reservation unless we spent another $USD1000 on a room upgrade to a suite. It'd be unfair not to mention the good parts: the engineer who came to fix the internet was fast, and as surprised and upset as I was when he discovered that internet for the room was usable on only one device. And the concierge who brought up our bags was very nice. Update: I tweeted out a link to this and Starwood got in touch. They connected me with the manager of the property who apologized on behalf of the hotel and waived the extra fee. I appreciate the extra effort they put in; it was clear they were genuine about wanting to make the situation right.

Reviews.Title: “Check In Experience Ruined our only trip to London”
Reviews.Author: vivetsandys
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much to say other than I was amazed at how many people were at the front desk complaining and how the front desk staff, to include the on duty manager, were always polite but were never willing to take care of the customer. I've never seen anything like it. This is definitely not an establishment where the customer is right - just read all the responses from the manager on this site and you see he doesn't address the unbelievable volume of negative reviews. I'm a gold member with starwood and have been for over a decade - this is the first time that this meant absolutely nothing to the staff - I guess that is a good thing, they treat eveyone the same. Check in got our family vacation off to a bad start but then we switched hotels and started to enjoy our holiday. The hotel entrance is actually in the rear on Brick Street. Location is good. Rooms were fine, concierge was very helpful but a long wait, could definitely use extra staff in the morning at this point.

Reviews.Title: “As stated definitely not a 5 star hotel but does the job”
Reviews.Author: beauD1986
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel early morning to be told we could not check in for a few hours, this was fine as we knew check in wasn't until 2pm. They did end up checking us in at 12pm which was nice after such a long flight. The Hotel itself is not in the best shape but I guess this comes with such an old hotel. We were put on the first floor, it was one of the smallest rooms i have ever been in, the cleaning was done very well though. It also needed a good paint and the air con was very LOUD! The Entrance (piccadilly side) is grand and the high tea they have looks amazing, this is until the heat hits you as there is no air conditioning at all. We ate at the hotel restaurant called Citrus, it was an odd and awkward experience and the were rude, the food was okay however. The Hotel is in an awesome location and within walking distance to the top attractions and close to the underground station green park and hyde park corner which is on the piccadilly line, we caught the train from the airport which was a direct line and it took about 40 minutes, only costing 5 pounds. The hotel is not perfect and as stated in other reviews is hardly a 5 star hotel but it is comfortable, clean and the shower was not bad!!

Reviews.Title: “worst experience in years”
Reviews.Author: dfutransky
Reviews.Content: This was not London, but an example of gulag life in the old Soviet Union. the first room we were shown was supposed to be an upgrade, but may have been the most depressing room I have ever seen. The walls were scared the carpet torn and the furniture worn out. The bathroom was so narrow only a scrawny 10 year old could use it. The second room was not much better and the insult was they wanted to charge more for it. The bar of soap was something out of a Dickens version of a poor house - not big enough for two of us to use to wash our faces. Most disappointing starwood property ever

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Sheraton Park Lane and will be back in March”
Reviews.Author: NolensvilleMom2three
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite with 3 adults. The hotel provided a roll away bed that was just as comfortable as the Heavenly Bed. Our room was spacious and even the bathroom was the right size for 3 women. We had plenty of room to sit and rest comfortably. Our only complaint was the cost of internet access in the rooms. Way too expensive. You did get 2 hours free in the lobby if you purchased a drink. I believe my hot tea was 5 pounds. The 3 conceirges we worked with during our week were all extremely helpful. Location was great too - across the park from Buckingham Palace and two blocks from the Green Park Tube Station. My husband and son will stay here in March during their visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Historic building, central location”
Reviews.Author: CAHoya
Reviews.Content: My husband had been in London for a week of work, and then we cashed in some Starpoints for me to join him here for a long weekend. I took the tube from Heathrow, and found the hotel to be a very convenient walk from the Green Park station. The entrance from the Park side is a little wonky - you walk through a beautiful tea area/restaurant, then up a second set of stairs into the lobby. Our room was fine - loved the high ceilings and comfortable bed. The bathroom was huge, with a great soaking tub. The shower featured a great rain can showerhead. The room was small in comparison to rooms in the US, but was fine for our purposes. We walked almost everywhere that weekend, and I never felt like the hotel was out of the way. On the plus side, I didn't feel like it was crazy full of tourists, either - a good mix. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For travellers who like old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenFussylady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of historic hotels in England and when I book them, I have an idea of what I am getting. I was not surprised that although the exterior of the hotel is impressive and some of the public spaces, like the Palm Court, were spacious, the room and the bathroom were small and could not be called luxurious. The rooms are clean, have all the amenities one desires including, a bathrobe and a free bottle of water. I liked the bathroom with its fixtures from by-gone days and window. The furniture and overall decor of the room is a bit boring but the bed was firm and I got a good nights sleep. The tea they serve in the elegant Palm Court is good. Some of the streets in the neighborhood were charming. There is a tube stop nearby as well as restaurants and cafes and of, course a park across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn out”
Reviews.Author: R0ckyMtnHigh
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to staying at this hotel. Our first time in London and thought it was a great location. Checked in and went up to our room. I looked at my wife and said I can't stay in this room. She agreed. It smelled worse than the inside of a old tennis shoe that had mildewed for about 45 years. To the front desk's credit they did move us to another room that was not as bad, but this is a hundred year old hotel with a lot of paint on it. The bathrooms are ancient. We looked at a few rooms before settling on one and all the bathrooms in all of them looked like they were from the 40's-not the 50's or 60's, the 40's. They even had these old yellow boxes on the wall that were the first hair dyers ever invented and were no longer working. These were in every bathroom we saw (why not take them out?) The air conditioning in our room was one of those portable units with a hose out the window. We had a second room for our kids and they complained that the room was really hot at night. Come to find out the air conditioning water supply for that room had been turned off for some reason. They did fix that promptly though. Bottom line is they could not pay me to stay in this place. We did stop at Le Meridian further east on Piccadilly and although we didn't see any rooms it looked much nicer and should we get back to London that is where we would stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: c4clair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in August, using Sheraton Points. Whilst the location of the hotel is fantastic, and the size of the room more than adequate, for anyone who is expecting the sort of modern, purpose built type of hotel usually associated with a chain like Sheraton, this is probably not the hotel for you. The room we were given was pleasant, however the bathroom was not of a standard we would usually expect from a hotel of this quality - it was small, in need of renovation, and the only shower was connected to the bath mixer tap. Whilst we were offered the opportunity to upgrade at a cost of £40, which would then have included a renovated bathroom, we felt that it wasn't worth it as we were there to sightsee rather than enjoy the hotel facilities. Also, given the cost of a standard room (had we not been using points) , we felt that the bathroom should have been of a higher standard without upgrading. The staff were very friendly, and the hotel itself was good, however anyone considering a stay here would need to ensure that they were choosing for location and convenience rather than quality of the hotel itself. Central London is expensive, however we did feel that there is better value accommodation on offer elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very plain and average”
Reviews.Author: laura c
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dated and tired, The room was so small the bed was pushed up against the wall and thebathroom was old and had mildew. The room had no fridge, mini bar or fridge. very poor quality. 3 star at the very most.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the visit And will be back but........”
Reviews.Author: gidoc3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a beautiful suite with a park view for a week. This hotels proximity to the Tube is great. Nearly all the central London sites are within walking distance. It was a pleasure to walk to Buckingham palace through Green Park. A few cons, the "front" entrance on pica dilly rd is the back entrance. If taxi drops you off on that side there is no porter to help with luggage and it is a shlep to go through the palm court bar and restaurant and up stairs to the lobby. Would tell cabbie to drop off on brick street entrance. As a frequent traveler and SPG Gold member it is a travesty to be charged 50pounds for Internet wifi for the week, 6 pounds per hour and 16 pounds per day. When Starbucks down the street offers it for free. Other pet peeves are lack of free water bottles( usually a standard in SPG floors). One hint WiFi is free in the bar (palm court) for one hour with a minimum purchase of at least a soda. The concierge desk was very helpful and accommodating, I hope you have the pleasure to deal with Sahil or Stephanie both of whom went above and beyond to help with difficult to obtain reservations. Lastly the food at Citrus (Italian ) at the hotel was excellent. One suggestion to management the flavored water in lobby is a nice touch but requires more vigilance when they are empty to be refilled they were occasionally empty for hours. Late night returnees also seek to grab a glass.

Reviews.Title: “Really not worth the price. Go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: nancyinportland
Reviews.Content: We'd asked for upgrade as a Starwood Preferred guest and got a so-so room on the second floor. Asked for king, but got those two beds pushed together--but the beds were nice. Furniture was very old and bathroom barely adequate. This was after an email to the hotel prior to arriving. Very disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamesBChicago
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel almost five years ago and it did not change much since we last visited. The hotel has parts that are a bit dated, but the beds are comfortable and the staff was extremely helpful. Pros: - The hotel has a great location near two tube stops - The concierge was fantastic helping get us tickets to a sold out show and recommending restaurants - Bed and bathroom were great as expected. Cons: - The hotel decor is a bit dated - The main entrance is not on Park Lane which is odd if you are arriving via the tube. Overall, we really like the hotel as the staff is great and the location is so perfect. To expect a 5 star London experience is unrealistic, but if you go in expecting great service and a wonderful location, you will truly enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel needs a full renovation”
Reviews.Author: JWBayton
Reviews.Content: Got a secret room deal and was glad didn't pay full price. The rooms were quite small compared Hilton, holiday inn and park plaza. Also dated and the bathroom was very tired. A s hame as the location and building have potential but really needs a major renovation not just a lick of paint. Dont expect 5* more like 3.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not a 5*, but enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: schulean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 4 nights. As other reviews have stated, this really isn't a 5-star hotel, but if you can get a good deal on it or use Starwood points, it's a good choice. The location is good, convenient to the Green Park tube stop (the Piccadilly Line runs directly from here to the airport), easy walking distance to Buckingham Palace and a slightly more ambitious walk to Trafalgar Square. There is a Starbucks and a Pret a Manger right up the street, and Shepherd's Market, with several restaurants, is around the corner. The rooms are clean if a bit worn, and the shower in the bathroom was nice and powerful. The rooms aren't large, but are typical London size, and there is a closet with safe. We heard some minor noise from the hallways and other guests, but nothing unusual. There is air conditioning in the hotel. No free internet anywhere. The Palm Court does afternoon tea, which is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star??!”
Reviews.Author: ACYSIM
Reviews.Content: While checking out: Receptionist: Anything from the minibar? Me: There's nothing in the minibar! Receptionist: Oh, right, you are from the 6th floor... Yep. it seems if you are on the 6th floor, be sure to expect a 3 star room (ok, to be fair, 4 star room size for London) with an empty mini-bar (who use it anyway?) Plus: Decent bed, clean bathroom, big closet, courteous receptionist- hassle free check in and out, decent location- 5 min walk from Green Park station. Minus: No tea/coffee making facilities or free bottled water daily (unacceptable for 4-5 star hotel), air-condition unit sounded like a motorboat in the room (luckily warms days in London are far and few in between), old and cheap looking decor, exorbitant charges for WIFI. The entrance from Piccadilly street looks grand, almost to the standard of the other hotels in Park Lane (read Hilton, Four Seasons, intercontinental..:) ) but the look from the outside can be deceiving. The reception area has the feel of an old 3 star hotel. I have to admit I got the room from the 'secret 5*' hotel from Hotwire. But having stayed in the Crown Plaza (4*), various Hilton properties in London(4-5*), this hotel certainly do not deserve a 4/5 star. I have also stayed in few Sheraton properties in Asia and Germany, and this is by far the worse Sheraton I have ever stayed. If you have to spend more than GBP110 a night without breakfast, better spend it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “5* hotel 3* rooms”
Reviews.Author: MattyCOYS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. Was a special deal on lastminuet.com where they only said it was a 5* hotel on park lane. Was not expecting much for the price. 5* enterence and check in but def 3* rooms. Clean and comfortable bed, old bathroom with cracked floor tiles but great shower. Check out took a while as large que on Sunday morning, should have more staff available at busy times. Did not eat there but great location for London hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “Huge bed, everything else was average at best”
Reviews.Author: kellyonthebeach
Reviews.Content: The lobby is amazing, the whole communal area is really lovely. Seeing this I expected the rooms to be equally as impressive. I was hugely disappointed, we booked through lastminute.com and the rating of a 5* hotel is hugely overrated. The room was overtaken by a huge bed (which was easily the best thing about the hotel). Walking around this bed was a mission in itself and two people getting ready was bordering on the ridiculous! The bathroom was tiny and very dated, and not in a vintage way, more a very old school way.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Plasticchips
Reviews.Content: Location is great to walk to Buckingham Palace and grab taxi's. Not too much space in the rooms and also shower area. No mini bar available in the rooms. However, the Palm Court and bar area was unbelievable. Make sure to have tea! Breakfast area was great and service overall was good. Dinner was very good also in the Palm Court.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ebweng
Reviews.Content: Close to Green Park and Hyde Park. It is a great base for sight seeing in London. Other than that, the restaurant and cafe was decent. Free Wifi in lobby only. Entrance in the back was awkward, not every Cab driver knows how to get there. Probably will pick a more updated property for next trip

Reviews.Title: “This should be branded Holiday Inn or Bates Motel”
Reviews.Author: Muckypaws666
Reviews.Content: Don't let the fact that Lastminute.com classifies this hotel as either a 4 or 5 * hotel, or that it is on Londons Park Lane, or that it is a Sheraton Hotel fool you into thinking this is actually a good hotel.. in fact, I'm not sure the term 'Hotel' would even apply here, more like Bates Motel. If you walk in the front, its fairly impressive, and the dining areas are very elegant. Walking in the back (where most Taxi's will drop you off) is actually a fairly good indication of what you are about to find when you hop into one of the crap elevators. The rooms are small.. the bathroom is tiny, the decor is ancient, the mini bar is.. well empty.. the tea and coffee facilities.. well, there are none.. but they do provide you with a fine selection of glasses for the plentiful supply of tap water. A truly dreadful hotel, that has no right to have any star rating. How is this even part of the Starwood group?! The only positive was the fairly comfortable and large bed, which if you are only looking to spend a night for that, then you will do fine (might help coming back to the hotel drunk so you don't notice how rubbish it is), but don't expect a treat or a great experience staying in one of the nicer parts of London. One thing I did find funny was the concierge.. when approaching to speak to him he was busy looking at girls on the internet. Quality.. NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5*”
Reviews.Author: Poshjon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply old and tired. The staff were great but the common areas and my bedroom are in desperate need of a refurb. If I had booked this as a 3* I would have no complaints. To describe it as a 5* is, in my opinion, simply misleading.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a refurb but great location”
Reviews.Author: DecKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Saturday 23rd July having booked a Secret Hotel with LastMinute.Com. When we looked up reviews we were very concerned but actually it was OK for the price. it certainly is not 5 star but what a great central location. Our room was a good size with a large bathroom, all very clean but in need of a refurb. The room got very hot at night and the air con fan was very noisy but we put up with it to try and cool down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTourist7654
Reviews.Content: We had a blast on this vacation. Hotel was excellent! Staff was incredibly helpful in helping make our stay memorable as we were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary! The room was spacious and had a great view, they added complimentary champagne to help us celebrate, and lined up flowers and a card to surprise my wife! Hotel is in an amazing location very near Green and Hyde Parks as well as tube stations. Couldn't have asked for more and will definitely stay again should we find ourselves lucky enough to be back in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and well priced”
Reviews.Author: HRHFiBi
Reviews.Content: I got the Sheraton for £90 via a "mystery hotels" website, but to be honest by the location if you know Central London it was pretty obvious (not going to get the Intercontinental for £90). Very impressive hotel, good sized room with all the normal features, breakfast was included as was as good as anywhere I've eaten. The bar has a great atmosphere but not so kind to the wallet (£20 for a Gin and Tonic, which I was pretty much expecting) Great location though, easy for public transport and getting about town. I'd happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A property with great character and charm”
Reviews.Author: ggypsy5
Reviews.Content: For me this is undoubtedly Starwood's most charming London property: the lobby bar and the conference facilities are beautiful Art Deco examples that never cease to impress me whenever I stay there (several times a year). For me that charm outweighs the drawbacks, and there are some: The challenge,of course, is that it is hard to shoehorn standard room sizes, Wi-fi coverage, bathroom styles into an older building, and so it tends to be "luck of the draw" whether you get a really nice and airy mini-suite, or a small corner room with a cupboard for a bathroom (even with an SPG Platinum card). Service is generally friendly, though sometimes slow when asked for from the room, and definitely slow at reception. On the other hand, service is very good in the lobby bar and the breakfast room (and the breakfasts are very good themselves).

Reviews.Title: “Love or Hate...”
Reviews.Author: starfighter56
Reviews.Content: Again conflicting reports here on TA. I do agree though with both sides. I stay at this tired old hotel whenever in London. The location is great, the rooms are really large and the bathrooms are usually in terrific shape. Old cranky A.C. units, probably the shabbiest elevator I have ever travelled in. Boring, fdark hotel corridors, but I like the rooms and that's why I stay here every month or so. I admit that having having a Starwood card and always getting upgraded makes things much nicer... Reception staff can be surly, which is a shame. The bar is very nice, concierge is pretty useless. I do though recommend this hotel if you know London well and need to be centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Class act”
Reviews.Author: IndecisiveOttaman
Reviews.Content: Booked a room via Lastminute.com for a Sunday night stay. On arrival we were offered an upgrade for a reasonable amount which we accepted. Room was spacious, bed large and very comfortable, bathroom huge, all marble with walk in shower, bath and his and hers washbasins. We asked for tea making and a tray with kettle, cups and tea and coffee arrived within minutes. We didn't eat at the hotel but the restaraunt and bar area looked very nice. Area behind the hotel is very buzzy with several good pubs and restaurants. Checkout was seamless, all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have every stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Ashley159
Reviews.Content: tiny room, old bathroom, strange smell, terrible value for money

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but great location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in July 2011. I was on Starwood points so for me it's a great value. They upgraded me to a "huge" room with what felt like an oversize King bed (Of course I spent the night before in a Hilton room that rivaled the Yotel so...) Room had a nice bathroom with seperate shower and tub. Did not have a garden view, but room was fine! Checked in at 8 AM and they had my room ready! Everyone I came into contact with was great! Yes, the floors creak, but I found that kind of charming and it didn't bother me at all

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: trudydubai
Reviews.Content: Rooms, we had 2 very outdated rooms. Beds very comfy. No coffee/ tea amenities in the rooms. We had to ask for water, mind you we had an executive room.Overall pleasant stay but not 5 star. 3 Star would suffice for this hotel. We will not book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Sligthly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jtkJakarta
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights for sightseeing. On the plus side: As SPG Platinum, got an executive room, which was very spacious. Location of the hotel is very central, within walking distance to Buckingham Palace, Hyde Park and other sights. A subway station is close by. On the minus side: Hotels needs a renovation. No executive lounge, very basic room without coffee maker or water kettle. So if you want to have a simple cup of coffee in the morning, your choices are room service or the breakfast buffet for 19 pounds. We ended up walking a few meters to the next two coffee shops on the same street. No free internet, if you use the business center to check in online for your next flight, 15 minutes cost you 5 pounds. Both check in and check out took a very long time, since front desk seems to be understaffed. To make it worse, front desk staff working at desks in the back seem to be very reluctant to assist. Overall, in terms of amenities and service, the hotel falls way short of expectations and usual Sheraton standards. In summary: If you are looking for a basic room only in a good location, you may consider this hotel. If you are looking for service and amenities in line with other hotels in this price range, you may want to consider other properties.

Reviews.Title: “spectacularly Average”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: I have to say the rooms are not anything like what the web site states: "Tastefully decorated and well appointed, each of our 303 guest rooms and suites capture the essence of this art deco hotel's spirit." Art deco must mean cheap because they are. The hairdryers attached to walls remind me a howard johnsons in middle america. I called at 8:00 to request an early check in and a park view room however when I got to the hotel at 12:00 I was told it wouldnt be ready till 3:00. When checked back in at 2:30 I was then told my room wasnt going to be ready till 5:00; so I settled for a view of the wall of the building next door. Considering this hotel cost me 18000 starwood points I give it a thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Stayed in the Cheap Room”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer33
Reviews.Content: The star rating is on the hotel, not my room. Well, I can't mark the hotel down for their room, as I got it really cheap from a last minute website, but I think it used to be a closet. It seems every hotel has a room or two that they set aside for 'web deals'. I was only staying for one night and wanted a downtown hotel, so I didn't let the room bother me. Oddly enough, though, the bathroom was beautiful and larger than expected in proportion to the room. There was a portable heater in the room with a hose going out the 'window'. I was in an inside room on the 5th floor and the shades were drawn and I didn't even want to know how bad my view was so I didn't open the window. Like I say, I was only there for the night and was just glad I got a great location for a great price. As far as the rest of the hotel, it is beautiful! The address threw my cab driver off, and had a bit of trouble locating it. Once I got out, I felt silly lugging all my luggage down some stairs and through the swanky lounge - yes, everyone was looking at me. If I ever stay there again, I now know the little tiny side street secret entrance that brings you right to the registration desk/concierge/bag hold. The hotel is obviously very old but that's the charm. The location is great, directly across from the Green Park which is across from Buckingham Palace Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Park Lane Sheraton - Piccadilly”
Reviews.Author: X125
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1st trip to London - half business / half sightseeing The hotel is within walking distance and is an excellent location for Central London. My standard room was very good and had no issues. I was able to walk up the street to Piccadilly Circus and see the sights, then very close to Trafaglar square. I even walked one day to the British Museum (0nly a few miles away) There is a Starbucks, drug store and very Good Mark & Spencers Grocery store very close (very good sandwiches down in basement) Anyway a great stay with no issues. Suggest taking "Heathrow Express" train (low cost) to Paddinton Station, then take Taxi to hotel (a big cost saver over taking taxi direct)

Reviews.Title: “Location, character, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michael047
Reviews.Content: If you stay here it's for the location: across from Green Park, loads of restaurants, shops, attractions. The Palm Court and other public areas have loads of character. But don't expect great rooms. The standard Queen room was small and dark. Tiny bathtub/shower ran into a dark niche in the bathroom wall and made showering unpleasant. My booking was messed up - smoking instead of non-smoking, and someone else's private information on the form - but that may have been the central Sheraton booking office's fault. They did change the room, but to the the afore-mentioned tiny room. Citrus restaurant very good. But Bracewells restaurant was unable to produce eggs with runny yolks at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Sheraton Park Lane in London”
Reviews.Author: papakim
Reviews.Content: I brought my dad to the UK (London and Scotland) for 7 days from May 28 to June 3. He is 90 years old so I took great care to plan this trip with his comfort, convenience in mind. I wanted properties that offered comfort, value, amenities, with good service and great locations. We stayed at three Starwood properties using points from my SPG Gold account. I love the Starwood program and find tremendous value using this credit card and hotel program. It was a fantastic experience all around using the Park Lane, Edinburgh Resort and Spa and Heathrow Sheraton. Our first night was spent in London at the Sheraton Park Lane. After the long haul flight we were brought to our hotel by car service. The car dropped us off at the front door on Piccadilly which is not the door used for check-in. The revolving doors were tough with luggage and you then have to walk through a lounge and bar area to arrive at the front desk. The back door brings guest right the to front desk. When hotel staff saw us coming in the Piccadilly entrance, they immediately took our bags and directed us to the front desk. We arrived at 8am and we stored our luggage with the concierge. The front desk suggested Shepherd's Market for breakfast and we loved this marketplace of shops and bistros just a short stroll from the hotel. The front desk attendant called me on my cell phone during breakfast to let me know my room was ready. We so appreciated that kind attention and the early check-in. The service overall was outstanding. By 10am we were in our executive room and the king bed was split into two twins with one phone call. The room was very comfortable and quite spacious with a sofa, flat screen television, desk, bureau, credenza and mirror w hairdryer and walk-in closet. The bathroom was a large black and white ceramic oasis with a splendid footed tub (great for a hot soak with good hand-held shower), a glass shower stall, a window that actually opened (love that), lots of counter space and a heated towel bar. Two people had plenty of room to set up their toiletries and use this area as a changing room which we did for this father-daughter trip. The heavy drapes in the room totally blacked out any light and the beds were very comfy making it a great place for a nap and perfect for a good night of sleep. After a full day of touring we slept until our wake up call the next day. The Sheraton concierge was very helpful with phone chargers and advice for dining. But it's the location of the Sheraton that makes it so special. The hotel is in the heart of the best of central London and you need go no further than Shepherd's Market for a great array of dining choices: So quaint and lovely. We stayed at the Park Lane for one night and did not dine at the restaurant so I cannot comment on dining services. With so many great choices in London, I don't chose hotels for the food. We did see the gym and there is a lovely lounge where tea was served and cocktails can be ordered. The Park Lane facilities were all very nice and I appreciated that the hotel had a boutique feel about it. This is not a flashy, modern hotel and the Park Lane does not have a Club Lounge. But if you are looking for a hotel with good bones, great personal service in a fantastic location where you can have a great night of sleep- I don't think you need to look much further. The Sheraton Park Lane offered us a tremendous value and was the perfect start to a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kurple
Reviews.Content: What can I say. The best thing about this hotel was the parking. The garage was good value. We found our room to be small and pokey. Not what we expected. The bathroom was of really poor quality. I felt like I was in a hospital. Would not recommend, better places to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Super nice and accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl0681
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed over the New Years holiday. We arrived some hours before check-in, but they let us in a room. I asked for a high floor facing the park (since most of the room windows face each other or other buildings, but they didn't have one available yet so we just took what they had. The standard room had plenty of space according to European standards. There is a large closet and good size bathroom. There was a guy training at the front counter who couldn't answer a ton of questions and was really slow at the computer and even told me he couldn't find the reservation. After a minor freak out the supervisor came over and found it. It was a little annoying after the overnight travel, but it happens, didn't affect our stay at all. It is a little weird how the front street entrance brings you through the restaurant and lounge. It takes some figuring out to walk through or walk around to the "alley" technically. The lounge, restaurant and everything about the hotel is simply lovely. Such great ambiance, live music most nights and nice people. Location-wise this place is perfection. It was our first time in London and it was ideal for getting everywhere. There are two tube stations a short five minute walk, plenty of shops, sights (Buckingham is literally less than a 10 minute stroll across Green Park), and restaurants. Sometimes at night we would just wander around and just be in awe. I would definitely recommend purchasing the breakfast package so you get it every morning. This makes it easy to cruise down to the nice room, read the paper, drink some of England's finest coffee and figure out where you're going for the day. Plus, there is a great selection and we found it delicious!! The server staff was also very nice and helpful. The bellman were also great and helped us figure out if we needed taxis and where we needed to go (although on staff member once didn't know where one of the most famour theaters was..kinda odd I thought). They'll charge you super expensive rates for wi-fi but I was able to pick up a free signal and use it throughout my trip. Bonus. Our rooms were cleaned to perfection everyday and overall it was a great experience. I would stay again. For the value, location and amenities it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Hamptons
Reviews.Content: Well, I've read many of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor ahead of our stay at this hotel, and so I wasn't quite sure what to expect, especially given that we used Starwood points for our 5 night stay there. We ended up chosing this hotel for its outstanding location - and we weren't disappointed! Yes, the hotel could spend some money on upgrades and refurbishments, especially of the guest rooms, but we were nonetheless blown away by our stay there. We arrived very early and the hotel had a beautiful room ready for us, even a very quiet one (toward the back), as we had requested. Reception and housekeeping were exceptional. We had a small problem with the air-conditioning and it was fixed in no-time. The room was incredibly spacious, especially the bathroom blew us away (I used to live in London, and I know how tiny rooms, especially bathrooms, often are in this city). All in all, we had a wonderful stay and all of this is even more remarkable given that we stayed there during what must have been the busiest week for hotels in London this year - the wedding of Will & Kate. So, many thanks to the great staff at the Sheraton Park Lane hotel, for making this such an amazing stay for us, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel in general”
Reviews.Author: JJCaruana
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located and is also on the main London Heathrow to Central London Piccadilly underground line. Easy walking distance to Piccadilly Circus, China Town, Trafalgar Square, Knightsbridge and more. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Do visit Camden Market. Certainly worth a visit for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for London business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Sidara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a mixture of business and some vacation days. Hotel has all facilities to cover both and is in a great location, less than 10 minutes walk in either direction will have you in the middle of main shopping areas, or the middle of the cultural and socail scene in London - and facing the Park and Buckingham Palace - so a really great location as a London base. Quiet rooms, dream beds, clean, comfortable, great lounge for coffee / drinks / snacks - wireless is good and the staff take care of everything with a smile and professional courtesy. One of the few hotels thats getting closer to the home away from home feel, but with better service & facilities and a great nights sleep. Will be back for sure. Hotel has its own taxi stand at the back of the hotel which is very handy and a short ride to the main train stations for the Heathrow & Gatwick express trains.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: crukkh
Reviews.Content: Redeemed SPG points to stay at this hotel for five nights while travelling to Europe with family and don't regret it at all, it was an excellent choice. The location of this property is absolutely unbeatable - across from Green Park, 5 minutes to the Green Park tube station, 20 minutes brisk walk to Victoria Station, 7 minutes stroll through Green Park to Buckingham Palace, and walking distance to SOHO. Lots of cafes and small stores nearby, it was always easy to grab a coffee and a bite in the morning (Starbucks and Pret-a-Manger are just 3 minutes away). Got a slight upgrade to a larger room at check-in as an SPG Plus member (asked for it) and it was generously sized, I expected something smaller for this part of London. Common areas in this hotel are "grand", our room was nice but definitely not 5* - but service made up for this, it was excellent for the most part and never below "very good". Overall, I think it's a solid 4-star based on the combination of factors. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive, we just grabbed our coffees and a bite nearby. Gym is modern although not large. All in all, an excellent choice for a points redemption if you are travelling to London for pleasure - just don't expect a freshly renovated room. Everything works as it should though, and we had very good luck with service at this hotel. It may be a good choice if you are paying cash, as well, but I'm not sure how reasonable their rates are.

Reviews.Title: “Prestigious - But the rooms, so-so”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGalxo
Reviews.Content: I cannot knock the amenities or decor of this hotel. All communal areas - the restaurants, the common rooms, reception - all immaculate and strewn in history. But the room .. oye. Quaint is being fair - but small, under-lit and an unaccommodating bathroom is what stands out in my head.. I know London hotels are expensive - and we treated ourselves for the weekend but only to get a room we didn't want to do more than sleep in. It was not one you could spend an hour or two with some TV or a cocktail. Drop your bags and go explore the city. Or go down stairs for tea (the canapés looked to die for .. ) you will be much more impressed. Reveling in the history and prestige of the city will let you appreciate the hotel itself. But it is a far cry from 'spacious' or 'new'. A referb is definitely needed. Luckily I had a wonderful weekend away and the beds they have we're very comfortable (even with only getting a queen after requesting a king) leaves me with a good impression of this hotel. Rich in history - low on space.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed. Would not rate as 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: J3nnifer36
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star hotel I had a very disappointing stay. Booked a classic double room through lastminute. Room on the small side. Smelly. Not much natural light. Terrible view. Bathroom dated and not clean. Had hair in the bath and sink. Door did not shut on bathroom. No trouser press in room. Room number 536. If you are going to stay at this hotel ask for a higher floor. I did not get much sleep as corridoors old and noisy and had guests running up and down. Also a big argument broke out just outside room at 1am. Hotel staff had to be called. I know this was not the hotels fault but it did ruin a good nights sleep. On the plus side it had a very large comfortable bed and staff were quick to bring me new pillows, because I'm allergic to any kinds of feathers. Some nice art deco features. I'm glad I only stayed one night. Totally overpriced and better places to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: STRADBROKE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab location. I would use this hotel again just for this. Rooms - I upgraded my room to executive in a new refurbished part of the hotel. To be honest it was average, maybe I was expecting more. We didn't have a view of London as the website says the executive hotels have so that was disappointing. The room is big though, a large comfortable bed, so you will definitely get a good nights sleep. The bathroom was tired looking, the bathroom was old looking and looked dirty, the shower floor seemed oily so i stood on a towel!! Reception - Was quick and the staff were polite. Parking - If you really want to pay £38 for 24hrs parking then go ahead, otherwise behind the hotel are small roads where you can park for free on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JamesR36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well maintained and is spotless. It is older but has lots of charm. Room service was delivered within 15 min and was really tasty. Best of all was the location,a quick walk thru the park and you were at Buckingham Palace in 5 minutes. The Green Park is lovely and a tube station is a few min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Explorer77
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Sheraton Park Lane and have recommended it to our friends. We had read numerous poor reviews on TripAdvisor, so we took the time to e-mail the manager about our concerns. We received an "out of office" reply stating he was away on holiday and therefore wondered what we would find when we arrived. ( But we noticed how he took the time to comment on every review in TripAdvisor - which impressed us- so we tried not to worry.) We were very pleased! The staff were always professional, cheerful and helpful during our entire stay. We received an upgrade to a recently renovated executive suite overlooking the park. It was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was invigorating.
