(Those were our top three requirements, so what more could we ask for? ) It has a superb location – walking distance to Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly, Trafalgar Square, Hyde Park, Victoria Station, Soho and the Green Park and Hyde Park Corner subway stations. (We used the the subway to get to/from the airport..very convenient..never had to change trains.) To top off our visit the weather was great. It never rained on us so we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our vacation. We hope to visit London again and will stay here again if rooms are available. You should check it out too....

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Piccadilly Gem”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: Yep, it does smell. Like an old hotel. Which is not necessarily a bad thing, it speaks to the character of the building! And it's only the hallways - any old-building smell has been eradicated from the rooms. Getting over the smell thing (work with me, people!), the Park Lane hotel is a lovely place. Prime-time elegant when you first walk into the foyer off Piccadilly, and when you sweep into the tea room to get to the elevators at the back of the hotel you feel a bit like you're doing a debutante walk - and unless you're sneaking off to or back from the fitness room, it feels a bit decadent. We had a room on the 8th floor and it was HUGE! And the bathroom, EVEN BIGGER! Wow - I was surprised and delighted at the sheer openness. The bed was typical amazing pillow-soft Sheraton comfort and the shower pressure was perfect - it was one of those big "rain" shower heads that are the size of a small dinner plate. Lovely! And (can you tell where my focus is here?) also in the bathroom, the large heated towel rack did great double-duty for our laundry as yes, we packed only carry-on and yes, we did need to do laundry a couple of times in our three weeks abroad. Bonus points to the Park Lane for being centrally located right near the Green Park tube stop and a Marks & Spencer grocery store, as well as right near Shepherd's Market.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room, but we ate at hotel next door!”
Reviews.Author: KatchCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, as part of a theatre trip. I emailed ahead to request earlier check-in, so when we arrived 2 hours early we were pleased to find our room was ready. The room was just a "classic" which was a good size and nicely decorated, thankfully it was on the sixth floor so we had a view across London, I fear a lower floor would have a very restricted view. Unfortunately the bathroom was apallingly worn; for Art-Deco read dated! The bath had clearly been re-enamelled at some point, but there were scuffs and chips in the enamel, the tile grout was cracking and had areas of black mould, there was no ventilation either. As we were only staying one night and had paid only £138 we tolerated this. The bed was two singles joined together and was comfortable. Sound insulation was poor, we could hear very clearly activities in the next room at 5.30am!! There was also a lot of noise in the corridor as people returned to rooms up until 2am; on that basis sleep quality was poor. We were very disappointed with the evening dinner menu so spent the evening at The Athenaeum Hotel next door , where we have previously stayed ,so we knew we would get an excellent meal tnd top service there. The next morning we deliberated over breakfast at The Park Lane or whether to go next door again to the Athenaeum. We decided to give The Park Lane another chance, but regretted it immediately! Service was slow, the buffet was basic and boring, very limited fresh fruit, orange juice only available on request!!! We didn't sample Afternoon Tea as we were at the theatre, however we did see others enjoying this on our return to the hotel, so this is clearly very popular. The Hotel is very well situated for Theatre, Shopping and Sightseeing. If you just want somewhere to sleep the night , it is ok, but we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: journeymaid48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older and the rooms are huge which for London is very nice. You can walk to Green Park Metro stop in about five minutes and connect to anywhere in the city. The staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “As bland as Yorkshire Pudding!”
Reviews.Author: Nats68
Reviews.Content: The room was uninspiring, and the staff were completely disinterested. Other than being conveniently located, there is absolutely no reason to book!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Park Lane. Begin with one of the best locations in London – walking distance to Piccadilly, Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Hyde Park, Victoria Station and Soho. For two days, didn’t even have to hop on the tube – though the hotel is convenient to both Green Park and Hyde Park Corner. The hotel staff could not have been more attentive. Every single need was taken care of immediately. I arrived from San Francisco early and was given an open room to shower while my upgraded park view was being cleaned. The room itself had recently been renovated and featured a spacious bath with all marble and high-end fixtures. The shower had high-pressure water and a heated towel bar – none of those hand-held showers that Americans struggle with. The view was of Green Park with Buckingham Palace and Parliament clearly in view. The breakfast buffet – include in my rate – was top notch. Great hot items and a very complete selection of cold items as well. Healthy and splurge items all were terrific. And if you need a shot of home, Starbuck is just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable older hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tshowalter1
Reviews.Content: I saw some reviews on Trip Advisor really trashing this hotel and was worried. I shouldn't have. This is an older hotel in a fantastic location - a short walk to Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly Square or the Wellington Arch. Numerous restaurants and cafes abound. There are two tube stations nearby as well as bus stops for all the routes. Yes, the standard rooms are not big like U.S. hotels but you are in Europe for Pete's sake! If you are looking for an reserved quality accommodation over flash, this is the hotel for you. If your package includes the breakfast buffet, you are getting a deal. I Also try their high tea in the lovely Palm Court. They had a harpist every day at 4 p.m. Their restaurant, Citrus, is a good value and has good food too. They also have a bar in their Palm Court and bar food from noon on. We returned from a late concert and were able to enjoy a delicious burger at 1a.m. The pubs close their food service long before that. We had a standard room on the 8th floor (this is the top floor) on the back hallway. The bathroom was1920's retro with a separate glassed-in shower and a long old-fashioned looking bath tub enclosed with a dark wood cabinet. We were offered an upgrade to a larger room (at an additional charge) upon our check-in but we declined because, after all, we weren't planning to spend our vacation in our hotel room! I would also note that the mattress was the most comfortable mattress I ever slept on. Their concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful with transportation tips. The room had ample drawers and roomy closet with a safe. The draw backs are the fees that are charged for internet and for movies. However, you can watch movies at home and go to a cafe with free internet. All in all, I'd give this hotel a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value in nicer London hotels”
Reviews.Author: JDK12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, 3 paid and 1 on starwood points. Pre-paid rate on sheraton.com was excellent and beat other competing luxury/nicer hotels in a central location. Definitely nice to find a relative "deal" with the british pound. We stayed 2 nights in standard room and 2 nights using points to upgrade to superior room. Standard room was 4 star experience, superior room was much nicer. Found the standard room a bit tight with suitcases, pack&play for our child, etc. Rather old looking bathroom in standard room but very clean and outstanding shower and hot water pressure. Superior room had view of big Ben across green park in the distance. Lots more space, good layout, nicer bathroom, etc. Didn't have any meals at hotel so can't comment on food. There are multiple breakfast and other food options just a quick walk away for anyone not interested in a big overpriced hotel breakfast. Beautiful hall area where high tea is served. We elected to have our tea at Ritz which was just down the street - probably a slightly fancier experience although certainly stuffier than what I witnessed at Park Lane. Entrance and reception area to hotel is somewhat counter-intuitive in location (to back, not on Picadilly). Obvious pedestrian entrance in front is not very accessible with stroller or with luggage. Overall great hotel, central location close enough to green park tube station and would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: KWG75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it had a great rate, and I know the location is perfect, Sheraton is a good brand. I, then read some very disturbing reviews on TripAdvisor, that made me decide to cancel most of the stay. When I walked into the hotel, it was an absolute pleasure. I must tell you that these negative reviews are not true at all. The rooms are big. Electic plugs are there, close to the study desk and in the bath. The bed is very comfy, the bath is spacious and offers shower separate to tab. The staff is very friendly. I would greatly advise staying in the hotel. The room was overlooking Green Park and provides a magnificant view on the park. As a conclusion, it was the greatest value for money for me in London

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mattwagstaff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking the hotel through lastminute.com as a "secret hotel". It was advertised as 5 star. The first room we were given was the worst hotel room I have ever seen. Hardly any natural daylight - it felt like we were in the basement. The carpet was stained and threadbare in places. The basin and tiles in the bathroom were chipped. The furniture and fittings were of very poor standard. There was no tea or coffee making facilities. How this hotel is rated as 5 star - I have no idea. It should be 2 star (maximum). We were moved to a better room but were told it was £40 per night extra. This actually turned out to be £48 per night as the receptionist failed to mention they would charge tax on top. In the new room the paintwork was peeling round the windows, the bathroom tiling and fitting were of poor standard, the curtains were good quality but let in lots of daylight as they did not fit properly (even after I altered the curtain hooks). Again no tea or coffee making facilities. They offer free tea and coffee making facilites that can be delivered to your room. Thats fine but as the internal phone system did not work on our phone we had to dial an outside line and speak to the receptionist to ask for tea. After 15 minutes it still had not arrived so phoned again. A further 10 mins went by and when it arrived we were given a dirty kettle, loose tea bags, cheap milk portions and no tea spoons - what a joke! We were offered a complimentary breakfast - but after taking up their offer - wish we hadn't bothered.......I could go on....but enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Wait ti Come Back, Again!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanbyHeart
Reviews.Content: We fell upon the Park Lane and feel incredibly fortunate. The staff, the rooms, the food and the location are all excellent. We have stayed at the Park Lane three different times and each time have a wonderful experience. I cannot decide if the staff or the location are better. It is a toss up! I would be remiss if I did not mention the tasty breakfast and of course, ending the day having a wonderful glass of wine in the exquisite bar area. A true gem!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Stay ...... As Always!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many London hotels but the Sheraton Park Lane continues to be a gem and always exceeds all my expectations. In the early 2000's, I spent approximately 300 nights at the Sheraton Park Lane, mostly for business, and enjoyed every minute. In the years since then, I have stayed numerous times for holiday whether it was alone, with friends or a loved one. Every time I stay at the Park Lane hotel I am reminded of the service excellence and attention to detail that only a few hotels in the world can deliver consistently. I have stayed at many of the top hotels in Europe, US, South America and Asia but none can compare to the Sheraton Park Lane. I would highly recommend the Sheraton Park Lane to anyone visiting London. Great location close to everything, impeccable service, remodeled rooms but tastefully retaining the classic british architecture & warm staff. You can't go wrong with this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute disgrace and huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sickofripoffs
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at this hotel for two nights recently. This hotel parades itself as a 5* hotel, but the only thing 5* about it is the location. If you appreciate a luxury room and attention to detail 5* service, then please do yourself a favour and book elsewhere. The May Fair hotel around the corner will not disappoint you in the way this hotel did us. The twin room I booked with my mother was cramped, dated and far from luxurious. The bathroom had cheap plastic fittings, a shower over the bath with a shower curtain that sticks to you when you shower and grubby marks in the bath from wear and tear. The toilet handle was lose when flushed. In the bedroom, there was a hole visible through the curtain lining, a freestanding lamp stood in a position where you had to wrestle with it to look in the dressing table mirror. The decor was grim, old fashioned and not at all pleasing to the eye. We had the impression the room was meant for one person, as there was only one robe in the wardrobe and one set of shampoo/shower gel etc. There were none of the extras you would expect in 5* bathroom such as shower cap, cotton buds etc. We had not been offered a wake up call or a morning newspaper on check-in, the staff member was pleasant enough, but lacked the extra effort you expect from a 5*. I complained to the reception and was told that the hotel was an old art deco building and so should expect everything to be old, which didn't really wash with us. I was also told that if I wanted a better room I would have to pay for it. We had paid £220 per night already for a classic room and weren't prepared to pay any more. Shame the prices weren't art deco too! Breakfast was also shocking. They have an old fashioned two tiered system where of you wanted to order off the menu, you would have to pay more. The May Fair hotel is far more flexible and superior on this score. We stuck with the buffet breakfast, which was quite unpleasant, hash browns were undercooked, bacon tasted odd and scrambled egg was tasteless. The coffee was awful and we had to take a trip to Starbucks down the road to make up for it! Overall I am at a loss as to why this hotel is 5*. I have stayed at the May Fair, Jumeirah Carlton and Swisshotel in London which were all of a certain standard, even if you had a standard room. Also to note, the pictures on the internet of the afternoon tea room are misleading, this was the only nice room in the building and does not reflect the standard of the accommodation at all. This Sheraton is appalling, book at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “great value if you can get rooms at 30% less than neighbouring 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: sunshinetravellers
Reviews.Content: I was also a little apprehensive after i booked the hotel and read all the reviews at trip advisor. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Although the layout of the hotel and the rooms are definitely dated, the staff really tries hard to please. If we are reasonable about our requests, they will make every effort to enhance the stay. I had a room with creaky floor and when I requested for a change of room, it was immediately done with apologies. The concierge was extremely attentive to the guests, the room is very clean and together with the location, I felt it was the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner Again-Our Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: Love vacation time
Reviews.Content: We had such a good experience last year that we couldn't wait to return for our vacation at the hotel staying from April 27, 2011 through May 1. We had a deluxe room on the sixth floor that was extremely comfortable. The bath room was about 72 square feet with a stall shower with overhead spray, tub, a double sink of about six feet, magnifying mirror, lots of counter space, heated towel bar. Room with two nightstands with lamps, flat panel t.v., mini bar, safe, chair, desk, small table near a lounge chair. All in all we were extremely comfortable. I guess it's the luck of the draw based on the number of compaints received from others. My wife and I found the maid service, concierge desk and front office to be excellent. The location is absolutely the best. So close to the metro......Green Park. Buy an Oyster Card if you plan on staying in London for close to 5 nights and you will save big bucks on your transfer from Heathrow to the hotel. The cost of the card is about the price of a one way transfer from the airport to the hotel by taxi. The metro is the best way to get around London. We travel with two overhead suitcases and a large camera bag plus my wife's large purse. You don't need much luggage these days.......jeans do the trick in any restaurant we visited. Ties are worn by some men, but they were coming from their office or having business meetings. Tourists dress just liked we do here. Restaurants we visited included (ratings on food, ambiance, & service)....Cost is for two persons for relatively light eaters having one glass of wine for the two of us: Bocca di Lupo 7/7/7 $76; Latium 5/8/8 $114; J Sheekey 7/8/9 $103; Haozhan 8/6/10 $79; Locanda Locatelli 7/9/10 $140. If I went back to London the only retaurant I would return to would be Haozhan.....located at 8 Gerrard Street. The expensive restaurants just weren't worth it. Had a wonderful shrimp dish at Haozhan as an entree and my wife had a vegetarian dish she loved. The fried rice was not great and neither were the egg rolls (too much oil), but the entrees were supurb. We enjoyed London Walks (Famous Square Mile, Old Hampstead....we loved this tour with the owner of London Walks). In addition, we took a train to York and enjoyed the free city walk offered by volunteers.....the train is expensive, but we thought it was worth it. We took a wonderful 1/2 day private tour with Wendy Hammerston (British Museum, Library and Bloomsbury). She can be reached at ----@----------.fsnet.co.uk We particulary enjoyed Starbucks for morning coffee and Pret a Manager for a quick bite (great soup and sandwiches). And finally, if you can get the type of room we had, I know you are going to enjoy your visit to London. Location, Location, Location.....Green Park for a quick morning stroll, great access to the metro....you're in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money, better deals are available”
Reviews.Author: udaypilani
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, creaky floors, very old building. No special charm. Not even on the Main shopping streets....there are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GillD1954
Reviews.Content: I booked the trip through lastminute.com as I usually do for short leisure trips to London. The hotel was graded as 5 star but I am pretty sure this must be self classified as the bedrooms are certainly not of 5 star standard. The beds are comfortable yes, but the decor is pretty dated and our bathroom was in need of some attention. To use the hairdryer I had to get on my hand and knees to plug it in under the desk and my daughter rang for room service on and off for an hour on Sunday morning with no answer. On our last night we moved to a very small twin room where it was impossible for two people to open their suitcases at the same time. As I had chosen to pay a little bit more than usual I was expecting something rather special. I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good night's sleep,”
Reviews.Author: silva02
Reviews.Content: I had booked this through last minute as a secret hotel, and when I looked at a the reviews I was horrified, however I had noticed that the manager had replied to each e-mail and e-mailed the hotel prior to my arrival. My e-mail was replied to promptly and courteously. On arrival i was upgraded and all staff at the front desk and at the concierge desk were polite and attentive. The hotel does need refurbishment, but my room was dated in decor but was scrupulously clean, large for London standards. The bathroom again clean and good bath and shower facilities with decent water pressure and also a powerful hair drier!! Kind touches included a half bottle of wine and a nibbles and a welcome note. So don't lose heart if you stay here service was excellent,and the quality of the sleep was excellent good quality mattress and quiet undisturbed sleep. So in all a good nights sleep and great service by all staff I came into contact with. Also tea and coffee facilities are easily arranged via he front desk at check -in. Well done staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great week in London”
Reviews.Author: GordCummings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the week of the Royal Wedding of William and Catherine. We had a great stay, which was helped along by the helpful staff of the hotel and its great central location. The Hotel is 10 minutes from Buckinham Palace and close to great shopping and restaurants, as well as Westminister Abbey and Cahedral. Right behind the hotel are some fine restaurants, which are only a 3 or so block walk. Our favorite is the Boudin Blanc, which is as the name suggests is a French Restaurant. The hotel is located between the Green Park and Hyde Park underground stations. We tended to buy day tickets and used the Green Park station more as it has three line running through it. On the second to last day of our stay we bought my wife more cloths than our custom limit woudl allow, and also that our luggage could hold. The hotel staff knew just were to go to get a bargan suit case, they were helpful and friendly throughout our stay..

Reviews.Title: “Terrible afternoon tea!”
Reviews.Author: Amyturtle1102292
Reviews.Content: Visited here for afternoon tea as a birthday present for my mother and was left very embarassed at my poor choice. Staff were useless- didn't know a thing about the teas or ingredients, and to make matters worse they didn't take the time to listen to my questions properly. IF I ever got an answer (most of the time they just grunted, snorted and plain ignored my question) it was wrong, leaving the only competent waitress there to rush over and correct them. We were never assigned a single waiter and were served by all of them, so I can definately say that all (but the one girl aforementioned) gave equally poor service. Various times I attempted to pour the tea and burnt my hand on the hot silver tea pot; the table next to me suffered the same problem. If they are choosing to serve tea in these pots they should really be attentive enough to pour it themselves, I nearly dropped the whole thing at one point it was so hot! The day I visited was quiet with plenty of staff so no excuses. Food was awful; bland sandwiches, cakes were dry and disgusting, we even had to ask them to bring the tea we'd ordered as they seemed to have forgotten! The harpist was very good and seemed to be enjoying herself which was a plus, and the decor was lovely but it was a shame to have so many guests walking up and down the hall all the time to get to the bar. Overall I felt reluctant to pay the £90 bill (They also seemed to have no problem explaining how to leave a tip on the chip and pin machine without me asking but serious issues with their knowledge on the teas!) I really wouldn't visit here again and definately wouldn't recommend it- I'd rather just wait a little longer and visit the Ritz instead.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dinosaur”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman16
Reviews.Content: This hotel thrives for one reason: location. Hard to imagine a better-situated hotel anywhere in London. Mayfair is out the back door, two Underground stops an easy five-minute walk, as is Buckingham Palace and Hyde Park. Picadilly Circus/Theater District is a pleasant 10-minute walk, etc. etc. I have stayed there four times, each for three to five nights, and I've had my fill. The hotel itself is outdated and serviced by a friendly but poorly trained/managed staff. The business center PCs could not accept my flash drive to print a file, and neither the evening concierge nor the front desk could open my emailed file because they didn't have the proper authorization to access email. The hotel locked me out of my room because I extended my stay by a day. The entire hotel is served by two tiny, slow elevators, either one of which seems to be out of service for maintenance. There are two steps - no ramp - from the tiny lobby floor up to the front-desk floor, thus luggage cannot be rolled up. Hotel rooms are the proverbial box of chocolates - some roomy, some cramped. I'm convinced that no two of the turn-of-the-century bathrooms are the same. Even in the winter, it's hot in the rooms - and they turn off the air conditioning in the winter, forcing one to open windows for relief, forcing you to pick your poison - cool with street noise or hot and quiet. In-room Internet is predictably expensive and not very fast. The lighting is dim. Once nice touch in every room is an assortment of magazines. The fitness center is adequate ... but to get back to your room, you have to walk through the center of the hotel's very elegant tea room (which has a resident harpist in the afternoon - very nice) in your sweaty clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BangBangYourDead
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Lane Hotel for a Long weekend in April with my wife and nine year old daughter. We had a King size executive room which was very spacious had a large bathroom with bath and separate shower the room was very comfortable and quiet despite being in Picadilly, the staff were very polite and helpful.The Hotel is very central with green park directly opposite and Regent Street a ten minute walk some people are critical of the old fashioned feel of the hotel but this is part of it's charm . I would recommend this Hotel the only negative would be lack of Tea/Coffee making facility in the rooms Dr Steven Mason BDS

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value for money”
Reviews.Author: alisonware
Reviews.Content: Initially we booked the previous day via discount website. £99.00 without knowing which hotel we would be allocated. It was the Park Lane Sheraton. Wow we got a bargain until we saw our room. Floor 7 and back to the 50's!!!! After the initial shock we decided OK .lts spacious, its super cheap, a king size bed, walk in wardrobe, big flat screen TV. This is alright we can live with the old bathroom. We had afternoon tea with finger sandwiches and cake which was to die for. The bed was so comfortable, staff amazing and the breakfast? The best egg and bacon ever although it was £18 each extra but worth it. The bacon actually tasted of pork? They have refurbished most of the rooms within the hotel and if its luxury and you can afford then you must insist on the better rooms and they charge accordingly. For £99.00 it was a bargain for an overnight stay in this lovely part of London and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I am thinking of taking this hotel to the Advertising Standards Authority”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr4business
Reviews.Content: Sometimes on TA I wonder if the reviews are rigged. And when I read the bad reviews for Sheraton Park Lane London, they were so bad, I was convinced it was the competition. Until I checked in for myself... On arrival, through the Piccadilly door of the hotel, I struggled with my case through the revolving door and once I gathered my senses after then, I felt a little bit like Paddington bear - lost. There was nobody remotely identifiable as hotel staff to welcome or even direct me to reception. And dear reader, since I had to struggle, so too will you... When I eventually arrived in reception (up some stairs and down some stairs with a suitcase is not much fun) there was KidPop musak playing so loudly that I asked the receptionist if anyone had taken the time to read the reviews here on TA. She nodded, clearly they were aware. I told her I was looking forward to being able to write a better review... "Musty" is the word that best describes my room - when I opened the windows onto a laneway, the noise from aircon and other electrical equipment was deafening. So the windows remained closed and hence the mustiness. The whole establishment is shabby and borderline dirty. A manager did call my room to see if everything was ok, but since the phone in my room was not working properly, it was only when i called the operator later that night that he gave me an access code to voicemails. On the website, it looks like a quintessentially British establishment - regrettably it is of an establishment that passed 30 years ago. This hotel is not a steward of the Sheraton brand, with which I am very familiar. Do not book here. Thankfully my colleagues and I had a wonderful dinner at Skylon restaurant in the Royal Festival Hall which saved the stay. I'm off to write that review next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WarwickMusicTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked via lastminute.com and got a good deal - just over £100 (Room only). We were clearly upgraded on arrival. Lovely setting. It was clearly very grand at one time and it has lost its lustre a little but nevertheless it was great. Fab room - large and spacious with a King Size Bed which was extremely comfortable. Wonderful bathroom with a large bath to die for. Good room service and an excellent experience at Recpetion on checking in and departing We didn't eat at the hotel but afternoon tea looked great

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea - really not worth it”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: Having had Afternoon tea at the Goring during one of my previous trips to London I expected something just as good at they also should be one of the best. But I must say that we found it to be a bit of a disappointment. The sandwiches were all fishy in the taste and smell – they might have used the same knife to cut all of them? The Scones were nice, but when the pastry trolley came. The first thing the young lady said was: You can choose 2 each – Not that I would have wanted more – but I felt like a child at some kind of school canteen – very weird and not very classy. The tea was nice, but I don’t know – Compared to the Goring it was just not measuring up. One more thing – The bathrooms downstairs was downright old and disgusting. Just because you put a sofa in the bathroom does not make it upscale

Reviews.Title: “Don't panic when you read the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: gnicol_au
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Lastminute.com's Top Secret Hotel option as it was 5 star and was reasonably priced for London. Once I found out what hotel I had signed up for I read the reviews and felt a little upset that I had been duped into getting an "unbeleviable deal" on a not so great hotel. I contacted Lastminute and explained to them that if the Hotel was as bad as some of the reviews said I would be photographing the hotel, staying elsewhere and disputing the transaction on my credit card. On arrival at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. I checked in by a courtious young woman and Basil Fawlty was nowhere to be seen. The Hotel is definitely old but I wouldn't say that it is in disrepair. It is clean and it is not musty. The hallways are wide and the floorboards creek when you walk down the hall. The bathroom in my room is clean, with a big bath (it is interesting to see the bath fittings have made in England on them which is not something you see every day). Is it a 5 star? I'm not sure if I could prove that it wasn't or that I even care all that much. So here's the scoop. I have a bit of an insight into this because I remember travelling to Manhattan when the $AU was half that of the $US. If you read most of the negative reviews they are from Americans who feel that the hotel is overpriced and that they were ripped off. Are they wrong? Well from their perspective no. I have every sympathy for people when they feel that the doorman probably earns more than they do in real terms. In fairness the hotel have show great restraint in responding to what are quite vitriolic complaints. To their credit they have not disputed any of the claims made. London was beautiful today, it was sunny and everybody was out enjoying it. This hotel positions you well to get the best out of London. If it was rainy and you were trapped inside the hotel all day there's not much the hotel can do to make that a fun experience. The hotel is not a 2 star hotel. I can assure you because I have stayed in some pretty bad hotels in my day. If you want the "bright lights and Coca-Cola" then you should avoid London all together. This makes the question of the Park Lane Sheraton being a 5,4,3 or 2 star hotel moot. Finally all London Hotels charge unreasonable fees for slow/unusable WiFi so be smart and go and buy a prepaid SIM or USB dongle from one of the many cell phone shops in London and get reliable fast Internet at the hotel and on the go for $30-$40 for your whole stay. I can't comment on the quality of the Wifi at the Park Lane because I am smart enough never to rely on hotel internet even when it is free.

Reviews.Title: “2* Hotel with 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: Ber909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the basis of reputation and 5 stars. The room was small and had pealing paint and a mobile air con unit in the middle of the floor. Service was poor and you had to request tea & cioffeee making for the room! Breakfast was a dissapointment, made more so by the efforts of the staff to charge us for this even though we had an inclusive price. Avoid this london overpriced Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikey1902
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel, the room we where given was not worthy of 2 stars the pain work was old and shabby the bathroom was not very nice bath was touched up with paint the floor tiles where cracked the sink tap dripped all day long i just felt so let down by who ever had rated this hotel 5 STARS. this hote needs a total Refurbishment and need to be re assessed as to its 5 Star rating !!! stay else where dont waste your hard earned money on this low rate hotel

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if they want more than £100.00 per night!”
Reviews.Author: Darren170
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night as I came to London to take my partner to the Ballet. I cannot begin to tell you how poor this hotel is! I paid £169.00 on a price comparison website for a standard room. When I arrived I was offered an upgrade to a more spacious and better room for an additional £50.00. This room was small, no view from the window and not in great condition. Carpet was peeling up in places and there wasn't even tea/coffee making facilities. An hours worth of internet cost me £6.00 and was very slow. This place was probably very nice 30 years ago. I could list over a dozen great 5 star hotels in great locations that would offer you more and charge you less. D.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: phoenix231310
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers that this wasn't the 5-star hotel that it claims to be, but it is very pleasant, comfortable and roomy. Could use some updating. Bathroom was large and bright, and included a towel warmer! Comfortable, clean beds. Nice lounge area. They claim free WiFi from the main lobby/lounge area, but only if you purchase something. Two cups of tea for the free WiFi cost us $16 USD. Location in Piccadilly was perfect to Hyde and Green parks, the underground Tube and within good walking distance to all other restaurants and shopping. The concierge service was wonderful and very helpful as this was our first visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: dr_read
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be clean and well kept. Staff were very friendly and competent. The location on Green Park is superb - a short walk from many good shopping areas as well as a the Green Park tube station. My room (816) had a gigantic double bed and still had adequate room to place luggage and walk around. Room & bathroom very clean. It's not the newest hotel in London and from that perspective I would question the 5* rating. Having said that, I also didnt pay a 5* so I have no reason to complain. Overall a very nice hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “seedy”
Reviews.Author: anubis10
Reviews.Content: Seedy is good . The hotel is dirty. The rooms dismal and small. The place generally depressing. Way overpriced. Location is great so bring a cot and sleep in front of the hotel. That’s a better value.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: nicporter1
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of staying at this hotel - think again. It certainly isn't what you expect from a 5 star hotel and falls short of normal Sheraton standards. The rooms are dated, dirty and poorly equiped. The bathrooms are awful!! Location is ok and staff were efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fine room, but the service was sub par”
Reviews.Author: howardlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine. Small rooms, but it's Europe, so....... The service throughout the entire hotel in all different types of jobs was really bad. No one seemed to want to work in a bizarre "Maybe if I ignore you you'll go away" way. Weird. I don't think I'd ever choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby rip-off”
Reviews.Author: WhereverILayMyHat
Reviews.Content: I have to concur fully with everything that illrain writes in the earlier review. I paid £159 for what I thought was going to be a lovely birthday surprise for my husband, instead I ended up feeling embarrassed that I'd been ripped off by so much and vowing to steer clear of both Sheraton hotels and lastminute.com's secret hotel rooms. I won't reiterate illrain's review, but will add the extra elements that made this stay memorable for all the wrong reasons: - check-in - no offer of help with bags from concierge, no check as to whether we'd like a newspaper in the morning; - first floor lobby - adorned for entire stay with broken vacuum cleaner sitting outside room. Nice touch; - room - furniture dated, lighting in room was insipid, curtains didn't close properly to block out light, any reachable plug socket seemed jammed or broken, window view on brick wall, regular sound of plumbing/cistern from neighbouring room filling/anyone walking or talking in lobby filled the room throughout the stay, extra cosy bed caused dip size of chasm in mattress, hair ball lying on carpet; - bathroom - looked like the worst dated 1970s public toilet I could describe (in fact a thousand words wouldn't do it justice so I've attached some pictures), dated plumbing, cheapest of toilet seats with a myriad of interesting marks and stains, chipped tiles on floor and vanity unit, mismatching tiles........ I could go on. I complained very nicely and discreetly to the trainee receptionist on checkout. Her eyes looked liked a frightened rabbit caught in the headlights as she whispered "I'm sorry". Yup, so was I.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but over-priced and in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: illrain
Reviews.Content: I suppose it's all about expectation management. When I was told I was staying in the 5* Sheraton Hotel Park Lane in London I was expecting a luxury 'experience' - the awe and grandeur of a flagship location. On first impression, when walking along Piccadilly and seeing the front of the hotel you are looking forward to the 5* experience. The front hall and walking through the bar maintains that facade. Staff were friendly and courteous. However, it was from the point that I started going up to my room that this 5* veneer started to wear thin. To give the hotel its due - it generally got the 'big' things right - service, general cleanliness and front of house. It was the small to medium things that started to add up though. The lift button to call the lift was worn out to the bare plastic below. While not a 'big' thing it did start waving a warning flag in the back of my head. A tightly run ship would not accept this. I was in a first floor room. The carpets looked dated and slightly stained. On entering the room, it felt small and dark (though I was warned by reception that this was one of the last smoke free rooms available and therefore smaller than average. I was offered a larger smoking room but declined since I wasn't confident that there wouldn't be the smell of old cigarette smoke). The basic lighting lacked the sense of either intimacy or grandeur I have experienced in lower starred hotels. The room felt somewhat stuffy, and the aircon was a standalone unit connected by an inelegant hose to the window. The fridge mini-bar didn't seem to be working as the contents didn't seem to be any cooler than room temperature. The room walls had exposed minor repairs of mounting points, possibly for pictures, but had been hastily polyfillered and not even painted over. The bathroom was very dated with old spotted marble floors, a large mirror but the silvering having seen better days, and an average size bath with shower hose fitting. Unlike other reviewers I did have plenty of high powered hot water for the shower. The bed was a good point - queen size, comfortable with crisply made clean sheets and plenty of pillows. But...make sure you bring ear plugs to get a quiet night's sleep. Even though I stayed on a Thursday night, there was a thumping beat from a disco going on downstairs somewhere, conversations overheard from neighbouring rooms and from people wandering down the corridor and occasional faint smells of 'chemicals'/'dry electricals'. The curtains in the morning weren't very light secure either. I didn't bother with breakfast as frankly, for over £20 to have just fruit juice, tea/coffee, porridge and a roll was beginning to irritate. So, in conclusion, wonderful location, great place to meet in the bar, but unless you can get a very good price for a room then don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old world hotel but in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: rejoyce1976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a "Top Secret Hotel" on lastminute.com. I knew what hotel it was before booking and was just trying to save a bit on price. It is a 5 star Hotel and we got it for £159, so I suppose it was ok value. The location is super, 4 mins walk from Green Park tube and right on Green Park. THE GOOD The reception was very good, we were duly welcomed and I would say given as good a welcome as SPG members, the checkin was very good. The concierge service was excellent, as were the porters. This is the type of stuff you love in a 5 star hotel, they were so helpful! Our room was very nice, it had high ceilings and was fitted out with lovely furniture. We requested a baby cot/crib and a porter was along within minutes with the cot. The Lobby / Bar of the Hotel is magnificent, its got a arched ceiling and is full of old world charm, I was very happy to welcome some friends and family here for a drink as an apréro. The restaurant onsite is called Citrus and I found it to be great (at the price we paid). We booked a table for 6 through toptable.com and got 50% off the food. I think if I was paying the full price for the food I would not have been as happy. THE BAD The hotel is a bit dated, this is first noted in the corridors, the 1st floor corridors were pretty horrible, awful carpet and a strong smell of chlorine, I'm not sure if there's a swimming pool somewhere, but it smelt like it. I am used to paying above average for drinks in a 5* hotel bar, but the Park Lane was exorbitant. I felt like a beer (as you often do in England), they had no beer on draft, which seems ridiculous for a 5 star hotel and they were charging about £5.50 for a 330ml bottle of beer. I also noticed on the wine list they were selling E. Guigal Côtes du Rhône wine for £40 a bottle. I recently bought this wine for €5.50 in France and I think this was a too much of a markup for an quite average wine, the hotel were most likely buying it for less. Our bathroom was not in a good condition. The tiling was old, awful and poorly done whenever it was last tiled (probably at least 20 years ago). On the 1st morning there was obviously some water problem as the hot water was running brown and was also not very hot. I showered in it, using only the hot tap, thinking back if they had rectified the problem during this time I would probably have been scalded. In all their bathrooms need a lot of attention. Then again, if they did this they could probably charge £200 per night. The minibar fridge did not work and indeed the door of it did not even stay closed, but instead had to be held closed with a Sheraton sticker. The hotel is not really that accessible. If you come in the front you have to go down a short flight of stairs and then have to go up a bigger flight of stair to go to the reception. It is possible to enter "around the back" without any stairs, but I didn't see anybody or any sign advising of this. Perhaps this is something they'll have to work on for the 2012 Olympics, Green Park Station is in the process of putting in 3 lifts for the same reason. On the 1st morning Housekeeping knocked on our door at 7:20am. We had a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and I was quite annoyed to be woken up this early. He said "Housekeeping" and then "Sorry, wrong room", this should not happen. All in all a hotel full of old world charm which is in need of a bit TLC but which has excellent staff,

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in need of a revamp”
Reviews.Author: ssacleighw
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying here was great - because of the history and the location on Piccadilly. But the hotel itself was pretty average. I stayed on level 1 - not sure what the other rooms are like. I booked on Last minute.com. My issue is not with the hotel really - it's more about the way it was sold on Lastminute.com as a 5 star hotel. The rooms I stayed in was definately not 5-star. The lobby and high tea in the afternoon are lovely at this hotel. And the location is great - next door to Buckingham Palace basically. It's about a 5 minute walk with luggage from Green Park tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Quite excellent for London”
Reviews.Author: indoboi
Reviews.Content: The lobby area, the lifts, and the corridors may not be of the usual Sheraton standard due to the age of the hotel. However, the room was fine and we found it quite excellent for our London visit. The hotel is about midway between Hyde Park Corners and Green Park tube stations but the latter is better because there are less stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed stayed at better 3/4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Takkou
Reviews.Content: Good location, impossible to find due to roadworks, reception not the easiest to find when no one around to ask either. Went for my 40th birthday treat for one night had a suite was v much looking forward to jacuzzi bath rang down to say wasn't working was told someone would be up in a few mins waited over an hour and half no one came emptied water didnt even have time to shower then to get ready to get out in time, was v annoyed as i was only there for 1 special birthday night felt v let down :( breakfast was lovely though, only one robe in room, no slippers previous 5 stars always get slippers and 2 robes, suite was quite tired overall wasn't the special stay i really hoped for on my special bday.

Reviews.Title: “Old sleeping lady”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand_FRA
Reviews.Content: First of all, location of this hotel is great, you are just across Green Park and can reach Buckingham within minutes. I like the old style reception area, but already at this point you will notice that the hotel is in need of some refurbishment. On this stay, I was upgraded to a 2 rooms Suite, the bedroom was really big, with tea/coffee making facility but no easy reachable plug (found a convenient one in the small living room -with a second TV) The view was looking in the "courtyard" of the Hotel, so a bit dark. The room was showing its age, but this is a case for most of the hotel, and it is not uncommon to have one lift out of order. Palm court is a bit depressing due to a lack of appropriate lighting, but the sofa are comfortable, something good to know, when having a drink there you can ask for a code to access to the Wifi network for free. The staff is a bit relaxed to my taste for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book a classic room”
Reviews.Author: RossfromCLT
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online at the Park Lane for 159 sterling and thought I got a real steal. Needless to say, the "Classic Room" at the Park Lane is not classic and is barely a room. DO NOT BOOK A CLASSIC ROOM. The rooms are not renovated, are tiny, stuffy and are not worth staying in if you are interested in a Park Lane experience. I was more than upset that the disclosure about the size and conditions of the rooms was not updated on the website. Luckily, management was sympathetic and responsive and for 50 sterling more per night, I was able to upgrade to a top floor renovated room, which was fantastic. So, if you are going to stay at the Park Lane, please call reservations before booking.

Reviews.Title: “A HAPPY EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Raisonneur
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay in a very nicely refurbished room. Only gripe was that the bathroom was old, but still spotless. Service was excellent. We had drinks in the beautiful lounge and found everything really great about the place. It's also very well situated for West End, sightseeing, etc. Got a deal from lastminute.com and it all worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: HelgeMortensen
Reviews.Content: I had a positive experience at this establishment. Spent four nights. Painless check-in and check-out. Buffet breakfast was decent, althought the wheat bread was hard even before insertion into the toaster. The room was very large and the daily service was perfect. They ought to put a more higher wattage bulb into the bedside reading light, as it was difficult to read by the illumination provided.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: YYZIAN
Reviews.Content: I flew to London from Toronto for 3-day weekend getaway and stayed at The Park Lane Hotel. I have stayed at this hotel before seeing that it is part of SPG chain of hotels. My stay at The Park Lane was amazing. From the time I checked in at the front desk, the front desk clerk, Begona, was very pleasant and tried to get my room ready as quickly as possible. My room was very clean and comfortable. If you are looking for a great hotel for a great price, then the Park Lane Hotel is your hotel!!! The staff are great, the rooms are clean, the hotel is in a great location, there is a nice fitness center if you need one or you can run in the park opposite the hotel, the food at Citrus restaurant is great, tea time in the dining area is awesome, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: B-Abroad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Park Lane. Like many before us, we booked through Lastminute secret hotels, paying £138 per night. We thought this was a good price for a 5 star hotel.........but therein lies the problem. There is NO WAY this is a 5 star hotel, We've stayed in better 3 star hotels. I feel very strongly that Lastminute have completely misrepresented this place. On a positive note to begin with, our room (246) was a good size and the bed was large and comfortable. On the negative, it was dark and smelled musty. The view was of walls and windows very close by. The carpets and fittings were dated and dingy. The air conditioning was a large free standing unit near the window, with a hose connected to the outside , which we didn't use because it was so noisy. No tea/coffee making facilities, no robes/slippers. The bathroom was appalling! It reminded me of the facilities at my boarding school back in the seventies....sit up straight bath, weird tiles, dirty grout, wooden toilet seat...no shower gel, no shower cap, no sewing kit or vanity set......definitely not 5 or even 4 star! However to be fair, the water was hot and plentiful, and the towels were fine. In the morning this was a very noisy spot....we began to think people were slamming doors on purpose!! But surely not.....maybe just very strong springs on the doors. Not conducive to restful sleep though. Downstairs...yes we shared the confusion re finding Reception. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. However we did sit at the bar and had 2 glasses of white wine. We weren't offered a wine menu and so assumed that we were having the house wine. We were very shocked to find that it cost £17.50 plus £1 charity donation. To finish, we didn't complain to the hotel or ask to move, because we were aware that we had booked with Lastminute, and maybe we were treated differently because of this. But we were shocked at what was being passed off as 5 star......so dishonest! We will never return, and neither will anyone else we speak to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Stunning Classic Building, Quality Old-School British Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdjnr81
Reviews.Content: I had seen a few bad reviews of this hotel after booking.. When I arrived at the hotel however, my doubts were gone. Stunning lobby and Bar area, good size clean room and comfortable (very large) bed. I stay in London a fair bit and will most certainly keep this on my short list of places to book. I must also note that the Concierge and bar staff were most helpful with bags, bar items to the room requests and helping my girlfriend find the room as she checked in before me.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: LeighOnSeaVinia
Reviews.Content: We decided to book the hotel as a last minute getaway for Valentines weekend. First off, we were told that a concierge/doorman would be able to park our car but on arrival, there was no doorman to be seen, nor for the rest of that day. We phoned reception from our car and were told to 'drive the wrong way down a one road' to the back of the hotel to access their garage as the correct road was closed due to roadworks - unbelievable that they would recommend this to a guest! When we entered the hotel, we had to wait 20 mins to check in. My partner decided to upgrade us to an executive room and here's where the real fun started. The 1st room had peeling paint and shabby, dated furniture so we asked to be moved. The 2nd room was dingy too so we asked to be moved again. The 3rd room was more contemporary but the bathroom was dirty - green mould on an electrical cover and black mould round the sink mastic and secondary double glazing; furthermore no extractor fan so once you'd had a shower the mirrors, windows and ceramic tiling were dripping with condensation - so much so, that both of us slipped when we got out the shower - unsafe. Furthermore, there were black mould patches on the bathroom ceiling. We were so fed up we didn't bother asking to move yet again, we thought we'd try to make the most of it. No bathrobes as one would expect from a 5 star executive room! We rang down for some and were provided with 2 particularly grubby towelling robes, frayed, worn and feeling like cardboard - goodness knows how many people had worn them previously. Next, we found there was no complimentary shower/body wash so off my partner went to the local Tesco express for supplies - once again, not very 5 star! Saturday evening, we asked if the inclusive breakfast could be taken in our room the following morning..yes we were told as long as we paid a covercharge. Fine we said. Sunday morning arrives and the waitress lays out the breakfast then asks us to sign for a £50 bill! No way we said, we were told last night we could have it in our room for a small surcharge. So my partner had to ring down once again and complain - at least they had the decency not to charge us as we had been misinformed. Check out was another 20 minute wait and when I handed the receptionist my feedback card and advised her we were really unhappy with our stay and could we have Sheraton's head office address, we were told no and she merely handed us the evening Manager's business card - she was downright rude in her attitude and couldn't care less that we'd had such a disappointing stay. I've stayed in better 3 class b&bs than the Park Lane and I will never stay again - in fact we've been put off staying at any of the Sheraton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A great 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Algarve
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel with lastmiute dot com as a secret hotel. It was listed as a five star, but falls short of that standard by quite away, the room was nice and clean but was very basic, no flowers in the room, no tea making facilities, no bottled free water, no bathrobes, the bathroom was very old 1930 ish and was in bit of a state, I've stopped in better 3 stars in London. Overal the room I stopped in was no more than a 3 star. I would not stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed large room/good location”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTennisbum
Reviews.Content: Stayed on points and felt they were put to good use. We were upgraded to a nice size suite with a large marble bathroom. Although the view was not what I would have liked (into the next building) the location made up for it. Enjoyed walking back thru the park at the end of the day....from West End theatres, Westminster Abbey (evensong service wonderful), etc. I agree the place could use a facelift (especially in the hallways), but I certainly wouldn't discount staying in such a great location because of worn carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and poor staff at check in”
Reviews.Author: DaveCheshire100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very tired and needs overhaul. Rooms dated, clean but very old. Check in poor, had to push to get a non smoking room, I had three identities during my stay and details, Inc adresses of other guest were accidentally disclosed to me. Told that even as a Starwood preferred guest I would not get points as I had booked through Lastminute - but I had still been loyal to Sheraton? Poor show, not so loyal now! Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: heathert390
Reviews.Content: Here is the summary of my stay at Park Lane: Day 1: Check-in. I have to huff my bags from the main entrance all the way to the front desk. Once I make it to the front desk, the bellman asks me if I would like a hand with my luggage. The room is in dire need of a make-over. The tub has rust stains and the atmosphere is quite depressing. I immediately get on the internet (which works well) to see if the hotel is haunted. Thankfully, it is not. :) I am happy to find a stocked mini-bar as I am very thirsty from huffing my bags around the hotel. Day 2: Fire alarm goes off at 6:30 am. I rush to the lobby in my pj's. I have the honor of being filmed by some tourist who wanted to capture the event on video. If it ever makes it to youtube - I am the one in the blue pj's. After 20 mins, there are no announcements made and eventually we assume we can go back to our rooms. We have tea at the hotel (very good) and listen to harp covers of the beatles and michael jackson (she is very talented). As my manager and I begin to chat, I find out that he has experienced fire alarms here each of his 3 visits. Interesting. Long waits to use elevator as one of them always seems to be out of order. Day 3: After several days of walking in bad shoes, I go down to the concierge and explain i have a blister and ask if they have a band-aid. He suggests I walk 10 blocks to the nearest pharmacy. The manager of the hotel reads my first post on Trip Advisor (which was deleted) and has someone call me to look at other rooms. I did not take advatage of their offer, but I really appreciated this gesture as it did suggest they care about their customers. Day 4: Time to check out! Overall: The location was great! I did not book via a discount site - perhaps I would feel better about the experience if I had. I think there is a clear disconnect between management and the people who work at this hotel. I probably won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: LegallyFond
Reviews.Content: I feel quite bad leaving this review, but here goes. I booked this as a secret hotel on lastminute.com and paid £99 for it - this is a decent price for a hotel room in London I admit, but it should not act as a licence to justify hotels getting away with standards lower than the 5* rating claimed and advertised. I happen to live very locally (one mile away) - I stayed here because there is heavy building work in my house and on Valentines day the last thing I wanted was to return to my dusty abode without hot water. Anyway, I did as many seem to have done - booked the hotel, found out which one it was, went straight to tripadvisor and became rather apprehensive. So I emailed management, as many seem to have done, and was told that they understood my concerns and would pick a "nice" room for me. This was done by placing me in a room on the 8th floor which, albeit apparently refurbished, was next to the customer lift shaft and the double staff lift shaft. I did see others on here complain about lift noises and think they may have been overreacting perfectionists, but the mechanics made for a loud, constant and annoying noise. I asked to change rooms and the staff were obliging, placing us on a different floor away from any lifts, though this move saw us relocate from a partially refurbished room to one of the older rooms. It was something of a downgrade. We asked to be moved again and were eventually placed on a top floor room overlooking the park - this was nice, but nothing to write home about. I can write about the quality of the hotel comparatively - I have gone for a secret hotel on Piccadilly before and ended up with The Athenaeum; that was a five star hotel undoubtedly. The Sheraton Park Lane Hotel is for some reason inexplicably dated and not well maintained. Old carpet, dating fixtures and furnishings, cracked plug sockets, no visible reception at the main Piccadilly entrance (there was another couple also stumped as where to check in and wondering around with us cluelessly, for the main entrance hall is unmanned). The staff were nice and attentive and did eventually find a solution, but this shouldn't have been the case especially as I got in touch in advance. When there are other more moden and clean hotels dotted around within a square mile radius, even 3 or 4 star boutique hotels at a simialr price, it is just a pain to have fallen for what appeared to be a five star hotel when money really would have been better spent on something which lives up to its star rating. I do not believe that tripadvisor should be used to be petty and put old B&B owners out of business, but where the hotel is part of a global and successful chain and is advertised as being a five star rating, a rant is justifiable if that hotel fails to attain the standards one would hope for.

Reviews.Title: “Really good experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilAC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the night before using Lastminutes 'top-secret' hotel promotion. I then came on here... Having read a number of reviews that were less than glowing, I decided to contact the hotel to see if a room with a view over the park could be made available, along with a few amenities one would expect (bath robes, slippers etc) to be in the room as I would not be checking in until late on. I am very pleased to say that on arrival both requests had been satisfied, and the room was immaculately presented and very spacious for a London hotel, especially given the price. I would agree with those reviewers who complain that the lobby is missing in action and that the reception area does not really befit a 'five-star' hotel; but given I booked the hotel to avoid a post-dinner commute home, rather than a vacation, this mattered little. The staff were very welcoming and the location perfect for a lazy weekend stroll. Ultimately, for what I wanted, I can not fault this hotel at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Lane Sheraton - how disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: nigelsIreland
Reviews.Content: I say in hotels on business nearly every week, so don't normally write a review unless it is particularly good, or as in this case particularly bad. I checked into the Park Lane for one night on 11 January, expecting to enjoy a night in what I expected to be a grand London 5* hotel. The ground floor of the Park Lane is fairly nice, particularly the tea room, albeit in a slightly tired, colonial way. But the real disappointment was waiting in the form of my bedroom. The room itself was grubby and smelt of cigarette smoke. But that was nothing compared to the en-suite bathroom. I suggest you loook at the photograph of the tiny bathroom, broken and dirty tiles, shower in the vbath with the curtain rail barely still attached to the wall. What a disgrace. There is no way this can be called 5 star! Shame on you Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worthy of the Sheraton name. I waited 20 minutes to check in after having to walk through the lounge off Piccadilly to get to the reception, which feels hidden and isn't well laid out. I should add this wasn't the fault of the front desk staff who were friendly, but there were two people working there and 5-6 people trying to check in. I never saw more than two people behind the front desk. Was assigned a room on the first floor, which was fortunate as it seemed the lift was broken. The rooms are spacious but poorly layed out, and not very clean. To add to the worst parts, the toilet wouldn't flush properly. Housekeeping carts were in the hallway the whole time I stayed there. The floor was creaking the whole time and I could hear people walking around at all hours of the night. And despite being in a non-smoking room, the hallway smelled overwhemingly of smoke. Upon leaving for the airport, the concierge assured me the taxi accepted credit cards. He seemed to be very friendly with the taxi driver, but of course when I get to Heathrow the taxi won't accept a credit card, and I had to find an ATM machine to pay for the ride. The location of this hotel is very good, but there are plenty of other options in the area so no reason to stay here. I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “A Joy!”
Reviews.Author: Alice223
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at the Park Lane Hotel, booked through lastminute.com as a Top Secret Hotel. I contacted the hotel before going to request tea & coffee making facilities in my room and was really pleased to get a personal email to confirm this would be done and whichwas again confirmed for me on check-in. The room was great, large, really clean and very comfortable and had a luxurious marble bathroom with both bath and walk-in shower. A perfect first visit - great staff, great facilities and a great feeling - I couldn't fault any part of it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “In Dire Need of a good cleaning and a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Agent9
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance of this hotel, from the lobby and other common areas to the room is one of neglect. The layout is not convenient as if you come in one of the two main entrances, you have to pass through the lounge and up stairs to get to the checkin. There was no bellman so I had to cart my luggage up the steps. The front desk was understaffed and there was a line. It took 15 minutes to check in. The room was rundown and very hot (but at least I could crack open the window). The fitness center was a nice surprise, it was one of the better ones I have seen in a London hotel. The main thing this hotel has going for it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Fast improving and reacting to customer comments”
Reviews.Author: Eldridge79
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times now because the location is ideal and the parking arrangements are easy. Have commented in the past though about some far from ideal rooms and bathrooms plus some sharp practices such as expensive wi fi. Happy to report that on our last visit they actually picked up on previous comments (well done Roman at the Front Desk) and went the extra mile to make our stay a most satisfactory one.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: When you enter this place you feel immediately the charme of a palace. For sure this place needs refreshment but the atmosphere and the excellent service are great. The location is also fantastic, 10min walk to Picadilly. I was lucky and got a wonderful upgrade, so nothing to complain. The beds are great and the fitness center added even more value to my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worn Out Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomg978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Park Lane Hotel during the Christmas holiday. Arrived to find a very worn out room. Base boards and door jams were dirty, carpet had heavy staining, and dust was hanging in long streams from the A/C vents up by the ceiling. The hotel itself is in bad need of refurbishment and has definitely seen better days. Have to admit that the staff was very nice, professional, and courteous at all times. The service was always excellent. Great breakfasts and excellent food with room service. Complained about the room to management, and they did accomodate with another room in much better conditon. Rooms are advertised as having irons with ironing boards, but had to request an iron to be delivered to both rooms. Lighting in the room is very dim and it is difficult to read. Don't think this hotel is worth the money spent. Management very open about the need to refurbish, but made no impression that this is a priority for them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conor98
Reviews.Content: Whilst I agree with other reviewers that this is not a 5-star hotel it must be pointed out that it doesn't exactly charge 5 star rates either. I loved this hotel and am going back to stay next week. The rooms are small - true. However, I've stayed in many 5 stars before and never had food like that served here at breakfast - amazing food and friendly service. I love the bar/reception area with the harpist making the whole afternoon tea experience relaxing and fun. Great place to base for a west-end show. 4 star hotel and top notch - go stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Anniversary I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Dot5346
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at mid-day and were pleasantly surprised to be given a room straight away - good point. Having read other reviews I ordered the tea and coffee making facilities straight away. After several requests they arrived at 21.00 only took 9 hours!! This was our 10th Wedding Anniversay and we decided a good Hotel and show would be a great way to celebrate. When we eventually received our tea tray the 'assistant manager' , pleasant young lady, telephoned to see if we were OK and asked if there was anything she could do for us. I requested fresh milk - I did not expect artificial milk in a 5 star Hotel - this she duly brought to us with a few biscuits. We had paid for 'Full Breakfast' which according to one menu included Haddock. On arrival at the dining room we were not on the list for breakfast. that had to be sorted. When my husband asked for fish we were told this was extra to the buffet. Having paid for a full breakfast we were not expecting a 'buffet'. Back to reception, I had to wait because the guy standing there said he was not serving!! Eventually I was told accept the charge and we will knock it off your account. What a way to carry on. Instead of a whow factor weekend it was a challenge of the fittest just to get what we had paid for. We could have gone abroad for the weekend. Come on Sheraton get a manager who can communicate with his or her staff. We certainly will not be going back for that 'Special' time.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Weeve11
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my girlfriend somewhere special and after my original plans fell through I booked this place lastminute. I called them up upon the day of arrival and they offered to upgrade me. Once I got there for check in the manager personally checked me in and upgraded me. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms/ beds were extremely comfortable. I eventually checked out at around 14.30 at no extra charge (dispite check out being 12.00 noon). All in all, the room was great, the staff were superb and I would definitely come here again! The location is brilliant aswell!

Reviews.Title: “Where's my Heavenly bed?!”
Reviews.Author: Moonfrye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Lane Hotel for 5 nights for a business trip to London. This is an old London hotel that was bought by Sheraton I *think* a few years back. The good: the service and the location were great. The bad: the lobby. What lobby?!?! Heaven forbid you plan on meeting colleagues or friends in the lobby- there's nowhere to stand, sit, or wait with out looking weird. Also the rooms and hallways are kind of dingy. In their day I'm sure they looked nice and flowed with the British feel of the hotel. But now, its just kind of shabby. This is definitely not a 5 star hotel. 4, sure. But not 5. My first night I was in room 819, which was nice and large. BUT happened to be right next to the room service elevator. Basically, the night before a big meeting, I got zero sleep. But this is when the good service came into play- I called the front desk and asked if I could be moved, and while I was out during the day, they move me and my luggage to another room. For the duration of my stay I was in 714 which was nice. It was very big, had high ceilings, and a couch. No view, and still dingy, but totally quiet. Next time I go back for work and have to stay here, I am requesting this room. Also, their beds are not sweet sleeper beds, fyi. I wouldnt recommend this hotel only because I think it's a little pricey for what you get. I had a really successful hotwire experience in London with the hotel I stayed in after the Sheraton, and it was much more reasonable price-wise. If you're looking for breakfast, dont break the bank at the hotel- walk two blocks towards Piccadilly, and grab an English Breakfast at Henrys right next to the Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels than this one”
Reviews.Author: touringlampie
Reviews.Content: The ground floor is great until you reach reception. It is then, almost as if they forgot it was a hotel. One person on reception, several standing around behind not serving, good cue waiting to check in. One old lift to the room. The bed was comfortable the rest was old and the bathroom needs a lot work, not being able to shower in a 5 star hotel is unacceptable. Having the disco below my room was a added extra and it took a lot of work to be moved. The next room was like a sauna with no control over the heating. I have stayed with Sheraton before all over the world and it has been great. However in London this hotel shows they have no concern for the staying guest at all. I promise you can find a better more impressive hotel at cheaper price, in the centre of London than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Was very worried by reviews but had a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: Ellie66
Reviews.Content: Booked through Lastminute.com then looked at reviews!! was really horrified and thought about cancelling the booking, Could not face waking up without any tea/coffee making facitlities. I e-mailed the manager and received a reply from Anna who said that tea/coffee making facitlities are available on request and would be placed in our room. We stayed in room 310 which overlooked Green Park and was perfectly adequate in everyway. There were no dressing gowns in the room but on flicking through the guest guide it said to ring guest services which I did. Spoke to a lovley chap (sorry i did not ask your name) and asked for a dressing gown - he said there would be no problem at all and did I want some slipers too, which was great. I also asked for some extra coffee sachets and was put through to room service who said they woud send some up. Slipppers, gown and coffee arrived promptly. If guests took a couple of minutes to read through the guest guide most things are available from guest services on request. Sheets and towels were good quality and spotlessly clean. Room was a bit hot and the air con did not make much difference but opened the window a bit and was very comfortable. The bed was fantastic - It was the best nights sleep I have ever had in any hotel - equal only to my own lovely bed! We did not eat at the hotel but had a few drinks in the Palm Court which was stunning. Drinks were expensive but the level of service and attention justified it. No worse than many other hotels in major cities. Never had anything but fantastic customer service from any member of staff, everyone had a smile and a greeting down to the lady checking the ladies loo and the maid in the corridor. I only dealt with Michael on reception who was a delight, he remembered my name on the three occaisions I met him and was so helpful and pleasant. Other reception staff I observed while waiting to check in/out seemed equally customer focused and keen to make the customer experience a good one. I have no doubt that some of the rooms at this hotel may be a bit dated and below par but can only comment on my own experience which was great. I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Mean-spirited and dreary”
Reviews.Author: hillyn
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Park Lane Sheraton hotel through lastminute.com. It seemed reasonable at £119 for a 4-star hotel in Piccadilly overlooking Green Park. Can this really be a 4-star hotel? It lacked any of the little extras that make staying in a good hotel so enjoyable: there were no tea or coffee-making facilities, no bottles of mineral water, and the room was dark and dreary - even the pictures were brown! The toiletries in the bathroom were cheap and there was no shower gel or shower cap. The shower was over the bath, and so fierce that it splashed water all over the floor; as it was difficult to clamber out of the bath anyway, it was quite dangerous with water everywhere.
