Were we given a particularly bad room because we had paid half the rack rate? Are the chambermaids told to remove all the little extras for the guests who book through lastminute-com? If not, it is stunningly bad value for those who pay over £200 a night. The breakfast was extra - £18 each with the voucher we were handed when we checked in, otherwise £23 for room service. We did not risk eating at the hotel as their meanness would surely have extended to the meals, too. Having said all that, the bed was bliss - very large, very comfortable and with beautiful sheets. We slept very well; the midday checkout time would have been welcome if we had not wanted to leave as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic, historic hotel with great, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SlimjCanada
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was a little intimidated by some of the negative reviews of this hotel by previous guests but ended up having a very pleasant experience at the Sheraton Park Lane. The hotel itself is idyllically situated near Green Park Station, right opposite Green Park and about a 7-8 minute walk to Piccadilly Circus (Regent, Oxford Sts) and Knightsbridge, Kensington in the opposite direction. Hyde Park is a 2 min jog away - so the location is central to almost everything you could want to visit in London. Arrived at the hotel on a Thursday night and found the staff very eager and willing to help weary travelers like myself (just stepped off a plane from Sydney via Singapore). The first room they assigned was a nice, roomy suite (courtesy of being SPG Platinum) but that room evidently had a smoker in before. The staff were professional and hurriedly arranged another suite as a replacement, while we indulged in a drink at the Palm Court (which is beautifully appointed!). Stayed at the hotel for a total of 3 nights and always found the staff, particularly the Concierge, Bell staff to be very helpful and polite. Thanks to all the staff that attended to us during our stay - we'll have to come back to London again and stay at the Park Lane. This is a historic hotel that knows how to treat SPG members like royalty. Staff are friendly and helpful. And I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “gross, disgusting, wouldnt ever go back unless they charged £30 and i was desperate!”
Reviews.Author: luxurygoods
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel, very excited thinking it was on park lane and thus amazing... how wrong was I! I went to london having done my exams, and thought what a nice break- goto london stay at a 5star meet friends, relax and de stress! the room was so tiny- that ive never done so many gymnastics in one room!, the heating stopped working so they felt it appropriate to give me a portable one that made noises (blowing hot air out)- not on! as was annoying as hell! the bathroom was was like a corridoor, and the shower head kept sliding down and to the side ways which resulted in water dipping on the floor and flooding my room- this i noticed in the morning!, i complained about this, including the heating at night time before I went out with my friends- hoping something would be done, they informed me when i got back that people will be fixing this in the morning as it was too late- they couldnt swap my room as was no available standard rooms. They also said free breakfast- so i ordered. In the morning I had a flooded bathroom, and a knock on the door at 7am- with people saying we have come to fix the heating- URRRRR IM SORRY BUT ITS 7AM! AND IM GOING BACK TO BED COME BACK WHEN I HAVE CHECKED OUT - FIX IT IN YOUR TIME NOT MINE! HOW DARE YOU! AND SHUT THE DOOR. I then woke up later for breakfast only to have got half the things i ordered I complained about this too. on check out i decided to let the manager know of my experience (i really do hate complaining but considering this was a destress trip to london- it caused me even mpre stress. The manager replied we gave you free breaky! my response- ARE YOU KIDDING ME? DO YOU THINK THAT CUTS IT? MONEY WAS NOT AN OBJECTION HENCE THE BOOKING OF A 5STAR HOTEL! i expected 5 star service not 1 star and below! the whole point was to book a hotel to unwind and enjoy. All I can say is any lastminute.com customers who are about to book via thier secret hotels or otherwise do not pick the hotel that says amaizng hotel OVERLOOKING green park! As this is the one! its terrible - id never go back. simple. I know this sounds like a rant - but for me this was exactly how I felt!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was staying in the 1970's!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSchmidt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a weekend to enjoy London. After booking on Lastminute.com under the secret hotels section " Unbelievable offer at a Hotel in Piccadilly - 5* - London. Overlooking Green Park, this first class hotel is only a short stroll away from Buckingham Palace", we were extremely dissapointed. The room was so old fashioned, especially the bathroon (the floor and wall tiles were something out of the 1970's). How this hotel can call itself 5 Star is beyond me...more like 2 Star (and that's being kind!). The only points that redeem it is it's location (over looking Green Park - the rooms don't), it was clean and the bar/cream teas area was very stylish (to lure you in!) but don't be fooled. Do not waste your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: chelle1983
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location – Couldn’t have been better. We stayed here at the end of January / beginning of February 2010 but had the review under a username/ account which we have now closed. We booked through last minute.com the day before and booked a top secret hotel, this was it. It cost us £300 for 3 nights which i think was quite reasonable as we were central to everything and so close to Buckingham palace. Once Last minute.com had told us that this was our hotel, we came on trip adviser and did a search, looking at the average results the hotel has acquired my boyfriend rang the hotel to speak to someone and to see if the low score were justified, the staff member agreed that the rooms were small and dated, but the location was ideal. She also advised us that we would be able to upgrade for an extra £50. On arrival we tried to upgrade, this was impossible as there were no rooms available. Would I pay the rates on the hotel website – NO WAY! We had a classic double, we agreed with the comments on trip adviser as the room was quite small and old in design, the plug sockets were temperamental so when the lamps were plugged in we had a disco effect. The bathroom was also dated, and ended up being a wet room after having a shower, the shower being a tap / mixer shower which we had to hook up on the wall, so had a life of its own when the water was turned on, the pressure turning it in to a wild hose, the only way of letting out the steam in the bathroom was from opening the bathroom window, which was overlooked by other rooms. There was a rather large air conditioning unit / dehumidifier in the main room, which made the room look over crowded. We felt that the hotel lacked atmosphere, and spent very little time there. The room had no coffee or tea facilities so we spent a small fortune at the local Café Nero. The bed was comfy, and we had 3 good nights sleep - I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesnt really want a luxurious stay, but wants to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY WAS GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: RosanaSpinelli
Reviews.Content: My husband, my little daughter and I stayed at Sheraton The Park Lane Hotel for 12 nights, in 2010, December. The staff was polite, helpful and very nice to us. I asked for the receptionist to see the three types of rooms, and we chose the reserved room (standart room) for a executive room, on the third floor, and it was large and comfortable. The breakfast was wonderful! We liked so much the hotel, the staff - specially who works at the breakfast restaurant - because they were very attentive with my daughter - the ambience and the location. We will certainly be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good to Excellent when you know to ask for what you need”
Reviews.Author: LikesKauaiGuy
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood Gold member, this hotel came recommended. The price was right, as was the location. After prepaying, and then reading reviews, I was concerned. I contacted the hotel in advance, and Mr. Paul Dunphy, the manager, made sure they were prepared. While we had some initial concerns wih our room, these were quickly resolved and, all and all, we had a wonderful stay. The location cannot be beat, and for the money , in London, it is a great value. We would stay again, and just recommend that you ask about any concerns that you have either before or at the beginning of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “2* NOT 5*!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_191
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Im no snob but it was awful! We booked through last minute hotels rooms and we would have seen a better standard of room at a travelodge! The first room we were allocated was tiny and dark. The bathroom can only be describes as "pre-war"! I went to the reception and I have to say the lady was very helpful. They offered to move us at a cost of £50 extra per night. When I asked them to simply refund our money and we would just check out and go to another hotel, they offered us one night complimentary and we had to pay for the other which we did! Awful, gloomy, shabby are words that spring to mind and for this hotel to be advertised as 5 stars is a huge misrepresentation. Also the upgrade we go was to an executive room which I have to say was bigger, had a shower and an more updated bathroom but was still a shabby affair. Wont be returning anytime soon and wouldnt advise anyone else to!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel multiple times. It is not the best hotel in London but it is the best location/price in Piccadilly. The building is beautiful with a gorgeous tea room/lounge, very large rooms overlooking Green Park, walking to Piccadilly/shopping, Berkley, Grosvenor, Mayfair and Hyde Park. Furnishings are a little dated, the interior needs a lick of paint in many areas (not run down - just needs a refresher) but it's got a very English feel and is more than adequate and comfortable at a great price for its location. Restaurant service leaves a lot to be desired but the food is excellent. This hotel probably has the worst and least knowledgeable concierge anywhere. Wifi available but not free. A few touch-ups would make this a perfect luxury hotel. 6 gbp taxi from Paddington Station. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Wrighty257
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on top secret late rooms for £ 169 on new years eve. Would normally cost around 299 -399 lovely building, decor a little tied, but pleasant enough. Rooms a little disappointing small but clean. Could do with some updating, however not bad for what we paid. Was good price for new yes eve. Can't have it all!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenearlstein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through last minute.com as a secret hotel for New Years. It was not to the description given, i have stayed in far better 3* hotels. The floors creaked, the classic room was small and oversaw a brick wall (although a park view was requested and declined), the bathtub enamel was chipped with an old school hairdryer, no iron, dirty carpets, not even a kettle for tea. Far from a 5* experience! The location is the only thing going for this hotel! The staff were unfriendly and did not smile once, which you would think is a basic in customer service! Not even given a "thank you for staying with us" as we checked out! I would never stay here again, nor would i recommend anyone chooses this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon tea at the Palm Court - don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: kempie666
Reviews.Content: Booked afternoon tea here as a birthday gift, selected one of the special celebration menu's in plenty of time. Received an email near the date saying that the gift with that menu was no longer available, therefore I could switch menu's, or stay the same and get no gift. No apology. Switched menu, expressed disappointment, got no response. Arrived on the day - no staff in the PalmCourt - had to go to the Conceirge, who inferred that I was wrong when I said there were no staff in the PalmCourt! Found staff, was eventually seated after being handed between three members of staff. Menu's were brought, orders placed. A cocktail arrived, no tea, no sandwiches etc for half-an-hour. Disappointing selection of cakes etc. No strawberry jam with the scones. Member of staff who dealt with each course was efficient, but not friendly. Used the toilets - a walk downstairs and along corridors for the men - even further for the ladies. Ladies discovered when they found the toilets they had been directed to by the staff, that they were closed. Staff nearby told them to go all the way back and use elsewhere. When a complaint was made to them about the length of walk, they were grudingly allowed to use the toilets in the banqueting suite. Tired and stained porcelain, not what you expect from an advertised five star hotel. Palm Court used as a cut through by residents to the reception area - suit-cases dragged through whilst having tea, not very pleasant. Dress code advertised as smart casual - not enforced at all, seems that the management prefer "wear what you like". Overall, I would say that this hotel is one to avoid - much better service and meal elsewhere. No excuses for this as they were not very busy in the Palm Court at all.

Reviews.Title: “How Embarrassing ........”
Reviews.Author: Salop1
Reviews.Content: As an Englishman, I have cause once again to be ashamed of one of our London hotels. The first was Le Meridien in the heart of the west-end of London and now The Park Lane Sheraton. Both supposedly five-star hotels and both SPG , Sheraton group. I stayed two nights at the Park Lane Sheraton, a dated, shabby place with complacent staff and management and very poor standards. A total lack of an eye for detail; as long as it looks good from a distance it must be OK.! Upon arrival I checked in and went to my room, an executive room (641). I am a regular user of Sheraton brand (Platinum level frequent guest) and have experienced some of the best Sheraton hotels in the world and in this case one of the worst. The carpets were filthy, actually black around the edges and under the doors when you opened them. The curtains were so old they were actually falling apart The desk-lamp shade was old and had been burned brown by the bulb The furniture was scratched and battered and worn out Even the information cards on the desk were dog-eared. No matter, on my first night, I decided it was too late to change rooms, in any case, despite three calls to “Guest Services” I could not get a reply from the Duty Manager. Requests for a call-back were ignored. I ordered room service which arrived within the allowed 30 minutes. The waiter left a corkscrew for my wine, I would have expected him at least to have offered to open it for me and check it for soundness. In most Sheraton hotels I have experienced (except this one), those staying in Executive rooms get a complimentary breakfast, not here. There is no executive lounge, no complimentary evening snacks. Not even a free newspaper. With regard to restaurants, I tried The Citrus. The in-room information says it opens at 5.30pm, this is wrong, it opens an hour later, so a wasted journey at 6pm for an early dinner. I returned at 6.30pm and was offered a limited choice of table as it was very busy; reception did not advise me to reserve a table when I checked in. The food was very average, don’t worry Michelin doesn’t feature here! The chefs “Gourmet Pizza” was an overcooked, dried up affair with some wilted rocket leaves thrown on it. I needed to use the business centre for a small printing job. It was unmanned so no-one to assist. However one of concierges helped out which was good. After some heavy complaining, (I interviewed the duty manager eventually), on my second night I was moved to a large suite overlooking the park, (however it was dark!). But the thought was good. It was a lovely suite, although newly gloss painted (perhaps that day?) so I had to sleep with heavy paint solvent fumes, as opening the window let in too much ice-cold air. I had a headache from this by the next morning. I looked forward to a nice hot soak in the big bath, but sadly water did not come out of the taps at all and it was not possible to fill it up with the hand-held bath shower. I used the ordinary shower instead but the water pressure was rather poor. So that’s it then! All in all, perhaps I should have read the Trip Advisor reports before booking this one. I naively assumed that Sheraton Brand would be good. Not so this time. At the time of writing, out of some 579 reviews, over 60% of reviews are “average” or worse, almost 36% are “poor” or “terrible” and 16% are actually “terrible”. This is not good enough for a supposedly top flight hotel in the West End of London. It’s a disgrace. My compliments to Management, Mr. Paul Dunphy, the Manager, but how can you live with reviews like this Sir? Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Requires considerable improvement in service to be five star”
Reviews.Author: LovesLondon29
Reviews.Content: Whilst this was a very short trip, I was surprised by the lack of customer service; this ranged from unfriendly check-in staff to surly waiting staff at meal-times. The building is beautiful, the rooms are rather hit and miss however. My lie-in after a late night of work was disrupted by constant drilling by workmen and the check-in staff had chosen not mentioned any ongoing refurbishment works or the noise. This isn't the first time I have stayed here but could well be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - try and secure a good rate”
Reviews.Author: davefishfins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to visit london and go xmas shopping. We got a very reasonable rate for a central london hotel. Was disappointed on arrival and checkout of the very poor service by the 2 american? receptionists - yes they were on the phone but could have at least acknowledged us. We checked in very early 10.30 and they had a room ready which was good. Beds very comfortable, bathroom and closet very good. No tea & coffee making facilities. The room was very hot, though there was an opening window and airconditioning in the hotel. The hotel corridor is a little tired - but we didn't spend much time in the corridor :) Breakfast was very good and the staff excellent. Wouldn't have been impressed if I'd paid top dollar but I was very happy. The concerige looked after our luggage on the day we checked out until we were ready to leave for the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: bewlaybros
Reviews.Content: Pretty good choice for a hotel in the centre of London. I would recommend this place as long as you can get a good deal online and not pay top dollar. The location is fantastic, being just a few minutes walk from Piccadilly Circus. Bedroom was fine. Did not eat in house so not sure about the restaurant. Had a few drinks in the bar and it was a good place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “visit to London”
Reviews.Author: mgbabine
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel pre-paid without looking at reviews. Of course, prior to trip, I read reviews and was horrified at the low ratings...not to mention overly concerned about what to expect. We arrived at hotel at 9 am coming from overseas. Were told by a female clerk that our room wasn't ready, however, it shouldn't be long. Family and myself went to Palm Court lobby to relax and when I checked back about 1 1/2 hours later, was told by another female clerk that room still wasn't ready. There was gentlemen clerk by the name of Christian who kept whispering to other 2 women clerks there about check in times and ensuring that no room was given out prior to 3pm. Being a preferred Starwood guest, I was very upset. I left and came back about 1 pm to see if our room was ready. Christian, the male clerk, told me (after whispering to a couple of other employees) that the dryer had broken and therefore linens were not being provided for the beds so it could be a few more hours. At this point, I'm steaming. I mentioned to him that that was a lame excuse and I was very disappointed at the way they were handling early checkins. However, I was more than glad to add to their poor reviews on trip advisor as soon as I got a chance. I went back tot he lobby with my little girls to wait. About 10 minutes later, Christian came over to tell me that miraculously, the dryers had been fixed and our room was being prepared. We got up to our one-bedroom suite. While it was warm and comfortable, the furniture was very outdated and the decor was very poor. Throughout our 5 day stay, we didn't spend much time in the room to allow it to bother us. Overall, the rest of our experience there was uneventful. I loved the location of this hotel (Starbucks nearby, walking distance from Piccadilly Circus and other London highlights), however, not sure I'd stay here again. It definitely needs a new facelift and the hotel staff need a class on customer service. By the way, one complimentary water is provided in the room per stay and additional bottled water is $7.00. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Lsa59
Reviews.Content: Expecting 4.5* hotel as they say what a disapointment. Where do i start. Duvet hardly fit the bed, could not hang anything long in wardrobe as safe sat in the middle, lighting very poor only bed side lamps, floor creeked so bad it woke my husband and probley room next door when i walked across it at night, no extractor in bathroom so couldnt use mirror, heating not working, and finely breakfsat what can i say only that we went to HENRYS up the road on the 2nd morning. I hope this help you by the way been home 2 weeks and still waiting for a phone call from the manager i shant hold my breath!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 5*, it IS rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: gwmtraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here prior to moving to another hotel. The hotel is unfortunately very very worn and horribly dated. It really has absolutely nothing going for it which is a shame as it is a gorgeous old building. The location is rather good being a pleasant 20 minute walk to Oxford street, the room was tiny and worn but reasonably clean. I notice many comments here are saying they are "surprised" by the poor comments, the only people who would be "surprised" are people who have been no where! I was utilising my Starwood Preferred Guest points so I would suggest that if you can get a room here for around GBP150.00.. then its a good deal! above that is just not worth it at all! vastly superior hotels are available in London than this. It would be nice to see if the cheap owner of the hotel can spend a couple of quid modernising what could be a wonderful hotel. Until then... it IS rubbish!

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing!”
Reviews.Author: Ani187061
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful! Im angry at my self for not checking trip advisor as I always do and therefore I ended up at the worst hotel ever! I arrived late as was travelling from Munich....thank god as if any earlier I would have cried myself to sleep! Room was cold with odd stand alone cooler. Stains in my bathroom. Hotel is old and needs to be refurbished. Staff ok helpfull, breakfast was nice but so slow! The room and hotel ugly!

Reviews.Title: “Staff trying hard to dispel poor review comments”
Reviews.Author: Content-Rich
Reviews.Content: Having booked my stay through a discount website, I panicked when I read the poor reviews on Trip Advisor. As a travel writer, I'd been with Starwood in Porto Cervo, so knew hospitality could be good and, of course, knew the Park Lane's excellent location. Having written to the GM to voice my concerns, I was looked after by Anna Kuras at front office, who did all she could to make our stay enjoyable. We were upgraded to 8th Floor and found the room to be excellent and the bed v comfortable. The bathroom was prefectly fine with a massive walk-in shower. True, we had to request tea & cofee making facilities but these arrived promptly. Not willing to pay £25 for breakfast (!) I can't comment on the first meal of the day but we found it easy to buy pastries etc at Fortnum's and MS close by. I lost a cufflink in the room (possibly) and the staff were most helpful in trying to locate it and keep me posted on the (fruitless) search. The only thing I would suggest is that the hotel sharpens up on its security - I did feel that anyone could wander in and out unchallenged (as we did) and I would prefer more watchfulness from the staff to check who comes in and out of the hotel. Would I book again? Yes, if the price was right and if I knew that Anna was going to keep an eye on my reservation requests!

Reviews.Title: “discount hotel attracting club kids and partiers”
Reviews.Author: RefreshinglyFrank
Reviews.Content: Other reviews are spot on, understaffed and tired, then add onto that the low rates and central location seem to attract groups of partiers who come in at 4 am crack open the red bull and vodka in their room to carry on the party and end up getting thrown out by the police at 6:30. On a Tuesday.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money so stop complaining!”
Reviews.Author: Whitey61
Reviews.Content: Wow...this place has nothed up a few bAD REVIEWS...i LOVED IT AND ENJOYED BOTH THE DECORE AND POSTION. We had a suite over looking Green Park which was well appointed and very clean and warm. The downstairs bar area is wsomething else and a real part of history.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money - it just isn't worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_Demon
Reviews.Content: I confess I didn't pay for this hotel but I am lead to believe it costs in the region of £200 a night. Unbelievable if you ask me! What do you get for your £200? We were upgraded to an executive room due to being SPG gold which was nice, and the room and bathroom were a great size, the bed was a King size and incredibly comfy. HOWEVER, the staff were at best indifferent at worst downright rude, there are no tea or coffee making facilities, one of the lights didn't work in the room, the bathroom products are cheap and didn't include a shower cap or shower gel, you have to pay an extra £24 for breakfast, you get no view, and we were kept awake all night but this strange whirring, grumbling noise from either the heater/air con in the corridor outside. The location is unbeatable but frankly you'd get more value staying at the holiday inn round the corner. Sheraton need to wake up and realise you can't operate a hotel relying on it's historical roots and art deco exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scheneider2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Lane in November this year. The Palm court is beautiful, a wonderful place to relax and have a drink or a light snack. The hotel's Italian restaurant, all I can say is wow. The service at Palm Court is slow as there is only one person most of the time.joana is the only waiter running up and down seving several guests both in the palm court and running to the restaurant.this is not expected of a five star hotel. I don't like the fact that they charge for internet use, I mean its far from a true five star hotel and may be because of the let downs ie the rooms that luck the cofee making facilities till you ask, to small and tired bath rooms it would be wiser to give things like internet free, just a thought! The rooms are okay but not what you would expect from an up market hotel. The bottom line is that i will return but expecting great impovement befitting a five star!

Reviews.Title: “Worn but nice”
Reviews.Author: ucce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my spouse 3 nights last week. As SPG Gold and after reviewing comments on this site, which made me worried, I contacted the manager expressing my concerns (I was on a pre-paid rate). He responded quickly to my email saying we would "get an appropriate room and that we will look after you". Upon check-in we were upgraded to an executive room which was pretty nice and probably refurbished, compared to other rooms reviewed here. It was definately large for beeing in a London hotel. Shortly afterwards a room-service guy showed uo with a bottle of complimentary champagne which truly was a nice gesture. Anyway, in an executive I would say this is a very good hotel. Indeed the hotel is worn, but that brings a certain charm. Breakfast was average but expensive and breakfast staff is not very service-minded. Location is of course great. If you consider this hotel, do contact the management in advance to get a good room. Overall we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Straight A for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: antonella1985
Reviews.Content: I would say my stay at this hotel was excellent. I, like many others before me, was very worried because of all the bad reviews written on trip advisor. Eventually, I got a nice room on the first floor, spacious and very clean. I couldn't believe how comfortable their beds are. All the demands that we had, were disobeyed in a short term. Concierge and the front desk were very professional and polite. The only thing that was missing in this hotel is the wellness centre. Give it a try. I didn't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, 2* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mowly1
Reviews.Content: I was initially pleased with the hotel after booking through lastminute.com for £99 a night & the 5* rating. We turned up after a 5 minute walk from green park & thought it looked fantastic. Bar looking lovely & it seemed very artistic and seemed really fantastic. When we got to the room all excited, our initial joy was ruined by the basic & cruddy look of the room. An old fashioned heater/air con fitted from thf window, towels were like sand paper, bath & if you could call it a shower were disgusting & cracked. Decoration & walls were cracked or had chips taken out if it. The bed was hard as a rock, tv was useless & the whole place needed a revamp! Room 154 was not nice!! The location however was lovely with just a 20 minute stroll into Leicester square or Oxford street. Apart from the location, this hotel was pretty dire. I would not recommend unless you were paying £50 a night, not the usual £200!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: jimalbe
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I knew not to expect a whole lot from this hotel. With that in mind, I thought we'd be better off upgrading our room type. The "upgraded" room ended up being quite small and dated. The beds were fine and the room was quiet, but the bathroom and shower could have used some updating. The location was excellent, and if you aren't paying much for the room I'd say it's worth it. If you were going to spend a considerable amount of money on a hotel, I would look elsewhere. Therefore, if you don't plan on spending much time in the room and you are able to get a good rate or use minimal points, I'd say it's worth it to stay here for its location and proximity to the Green Park Tube Stop

Reviews.Title: “Tired but charming”
Reviews.Author: GLMM22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Lane in January or this year and have to say even though it's a bit on the shabby rather than chic side I did really like it. The Palm court is beautiful, a wonderful place to relax and have a drink or a light snack. The jewel in the crown is the hotel's Italian restaurant, all I can say is wow. Hats off to the chef it was amazing. They had an excellent wine selection and menu. The service was quick and the waiters were pleasant. The reception is tired, didn't like the fact that they charged for internet use, I mean its far from a perfect hotel and maybe because of the let downs ie the rooms it would be wiser to give things like internet free, just a thought! The rooms are okay but not what you would expect from an up market hotel. All in all I would return and I hope to see improvements in the future

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: MNyarai
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel, expecting it to be 5 star. What a joke. The entrance on Park Lane is not the main one so we had to lug our bags via that back entrance and the tea room which was very busy at the time. Upon check in (which took a while) we were sent up to our room. The area around the bathroom sink was wet, the furniture in our room was ancient, and we couldn't believe the damp smell that permeated the room and corridor. Even though we were in a suite, the room was poorly laid out and we couldn't get the room service trolley in, without rearranging furniture. The tea/coffee station was nowhere near a socket and both telephones were at a desk instead of next to the bed, meaning we had to get out of bed to answer a call. The 'airconditioning unit' (if you can call it that) basically recycled the air in the room and seemed to be faulty as our room was incredibly hot. This appears to be a common complaint as we discussed this with other guests. Honestly, this was the worst hotel we have ever stayed at and we checked out after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and stay”
Reviews.Author: pam6471
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel - the service was friendly and helpful, the location superb for tourists (walking distance to buckingham palace and within a few blocks of the sightseeing tours) and great restaurants in the area. The room was clean and cozy - bathroom was immaculate. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can afford it. Wonderful suite-small single rooms for price.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette49
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location but the prices are steep so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: barlee123
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations, good location as far as public transportation, great restaurant, helpful concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned, in a good way”
Reviews.Author: RAR1972
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on lastminute.com on one of their "top secret" deals so I didn't know where we were staying until we had paid. When we received confirmation of the hotel's name, I looked on tripadvisor and was very concerned due to the bad reviews. As I had booked the hotel as a surprise for my husband to celebrate our anniversary I was very worried and contacted the hotel manager by e-mail. He responded staright away and re-assured me that he would do everything he could to make our anniversary special. Upon arrival at the hotel we were told that we had been upgraded. The service at the front desk was very good and when we reached our room, the front desk rang to make sure we were happy. The room was very spacious for London standards and had a great view over Green Park. As there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, we contacted Room Service and asked for a tray to be brought up. This arrived within 10 minutes however not only did we receive the tea tray, we also received a bottle of champagne and two glasses as it was our anniversary ! The hotel is old but I would far rather this than a minimalist, modern hotel. The bar area is beautiful and we were disappointed that we didn;t have more time so we could have a drink / afternoon tea. I genuinely believe that the manager cares about the bad reviews on this site, as he made an extra special effort to make our visit special, which it was. Finally, the location was fantastic. We went all over London over the weekend and only caught one tube when we wanted to go somewhere a bit further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Tragedy”
Reviews.Author: July1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel fails. It is in a great Mayfair location but the threadbare rooms are a nightmare with service that either doesn't exist or disappoints. The only positive is the charming tearoom in the entry. My husband and I stay in 4 an 5 star hotels dozens of nights per year and found this hotel the most dismal of all for the following reasons. Surly service was evident, even the door-man, when present, stormed ahead of me allowing the doors to swing shut in my face as I entered with 2 coffees in my hands. The front-desk clerk denied us the typical starwood platinum upgrade stating they were sold out but a quick check revealed rooms in all categories available. Further enquiry with the front desk brought no result. The rooms were painfully dated and worn and the bathrooms had a 1945 decor with layers of grime. The staff left vacuums in the hall wall overnight and the elevators failed, first one and then the other causing a general shut-down of check-outs. This badly hotel needs a thorough renovation and the staff needs thoughtul management and re-training. The fitness centre was quite new and worked very wel, that was a small consolation.

Reviews.Title: “333 Cinderella's room”
Reviews.Author: Joker1234
Reviews.Content: I used to work for Starwood company and I had the opportunity to travel all arround the world staying in hotels from this chain. This time I used my SPG point to get a free night in The Sheraton Park Lane, in London and I had the worst experience in my whole live. We made chek-in at 01:00 pm and went for some shoppings, when we arrived at 07:00 pm our luggage wasn't in our room yet. The room was frozen and there was no heater on it. I asked for one and 1 hour later we got a noisy one. But the worst is yet to come, the bathroom was dirty and windy. Our window didn't close properly and going to the toilet was similar to go to the North Pole. No coments about the views, there wasn´t. Sorry I didn´t take pictures of it but I'm still waitting the UK switch converter....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Terible Hotel an limited value for the money”
Reviews.Author: BHSA
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel late at the evening after a long day of work and traveling ,and the first thing that I experienced was that I had to search through the bar and a restaurant to find the reception. I had booked a Studio Suite witch was a 2 room "suite" with old and worn down furniture and decorations. The bathroom looked like something that was built in the early 30 this and was pretty small, the bed was hard and hash, the phone where missing parts. And to get something to pore the drink from the minibar inn I had to call guest service to provide the room with glass, that alone took 30 minutes. I took further 3 visits at the receptions to get glasses on a daily basis. And this was a room that was described as : Large Open Plan Suite, Personally Designed With Stunning City Views, Marble Bathroom With Walk-in Shower By starwoods own site. The wireless at the part of the hotel i stayed was slow and unstable and was not worth the 16 £ pr day as they charged. Some of the staff did actually show that they cared about the guests, but most of them could use a crash course in guest service. The location is good but I don't think its worth the price I payed 400 £ a night for a worn out room and the only reason I didn't check out the first night was the all hotels in London was fully booked that week.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel?? id rather stay in a prison cell, prob get better service too!”
Reviews.Author: Jasonkiran
Reviews.Content: How in the world is this a 5 star hotel?? i must say its in a great location and the bar area is quite nice, but everything else is a joke. the service from the staff is so bad that i had to go out of my way just to avoid them, the room we had which was a standard double, was terrible. im not sure what the double stands for but i think its for the disappointment you will recieve once you walk in. the room is bad but the bathroom was even worse! the tiles in the bathroom were faded and some missing, the smell was disgusting and there was some sort of electrical item on the wall but due to dirt and build up it turned yellow and was sticky!!! im not joking!!! I still dont know what it was. The carperts were filthy and stained, and the tap in the sink didnt work properly. Also the shower that is in the bath was so bad id rather wipe myself with a Wet One than use it. I've stayed in alot of hotels in my time but this gets the award for ' Greatest disappointment 2010' Read other reviews before making your choice. i didnt and payed the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bizp88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only beautiful on the inside and out, but it is only a ten minute taxi ride from King's Cross station. It is situated in an ideal spot. It across the street from Green Park, which if you take the 3 minute walk through here you are standing at the gates of Buckingham Palace. It is a 5-7 minute walk to Piccadilly Circus, and a 15 minute walk to Kensington Palace. The staff were fabulous and our stay was great. Oh yea, the first stop for the Original Open top bus tour is across and down the street 500 feet. This is a must do to get a sense of the rest of the city. Just remember to look the opposite way when you cross the street if you are visiting from the States.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALi190744
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4 night stay for my 50th Birthday in March 2010. We booked an exectutive room and had high expectations. Entrance/Reception is down a side street or through the lounge - disapointing area not what you would expect of 5 star reception area. When we checked in I asked if the executive room overlooked the park as we had requested when booking with the travel agents - was told none were available today but possibly in 2 days! - I asked if there were any other rooms available with a Park view for 2 nights, I was told 2 types of suites at such and such a cost. We decided to have a look at the room we had been allocated to see if we could put up with it for 2 nights and also to look at the cheaper of the 2 suites and then make a decision. We were able to do this and found that the 'executive' room we had been allocated was really awful - small, dark and very unappealing, the junior suite was light, overlooked the park and had plently of space. As the junior suite was going to cost approx. £50.00 extra per night, it was a no brainer for us as we had already paid £1125.00 for the holiday and opted for the junior suite for the night and then to move into an exec. room overlooking the park the following day. We shouldn't have had to pay an extra £100 but didn't want to compromise my enjoyment for my special birthday. However when we got settled in to the junior suite we found that there was only one robe and no slippers - not what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. After advsing housekeeping, these were duly brought about half an hour later. After the 2 nights we moved into a smaller room overlooking the park. This time there was only one robe and no slippers and no tra and coffee tray. After advising housekeeping, these were delivered about an hour later. Hairdresser - although advertised as open was always closed. Good points: nice breakfast, good cocktails in the lounge, in a good position on Picadilly. Overall this is not a 5 star quality hotel - executive rooms are not executive standard that you would find in other 5 star or even 4 star hotels. Whole building urgently requires modernisation.

Reviews.Title: “2-star hotel; 5-star pricing”
Reviews.Author: vagabiztravlr
Reviews.Content: Don't bother staying here until you see news about massive refurbishment and restoration. I stayed here 4 years ago and it was exquisite. But this last Oct 2010, it was beyond disappointing. Everything was dirty and worn. I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest --- but I won't stay here ever again ... Bad bad bad ...

Reviews.Title: “High End pricey but central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Empathology
Reviews.Content: You can't get more centrally located than this, though you pay a price. Needing to stay centrally for just one night, I confess I didn't pay a penny as I redeemed some points. But I left my car outside central London as their grage wanted to charge 38 GBP for the privilege of parking the night (plus central London congestion charge of 10 GBP per day). Everything you'd expect of a 5 star hotel - no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: mitchell_cutler
Reviews.Content: Good: A world class location! The Bad: Everything else: Stayed for 11 nights in Sept 2010 (Room # 830). Here's what I experienced.... The room was not checked from the previous customer's stay! Blocked toillet, slow drain in sink, oil leaking from metal door closer, patched cieling leaks not fully repaired, patched wall drillings not replaced with new tiles, computer access required a hotel engineer's visit... The lobby concierge are hit and miss with friendliness and knowledge (1 out of 3 was good)... After an afternoon rain I tripped on the unsecured lobby carpet from Picadilly side entrance, notified cutomer services about the problem but it never got fixed during our stay... The Ugly: 3 false fire alarms which required our waiting outside on the sidewalk in our pajamas...( Hotel employee said " well its better than waiting for a real fire until midnight")... Porter undoes belt and pants in full lobby view for a reset...(Yes this was a $500.00 a night room) Waitress in bar chews gum... I got trapped in a broken elevator for 20 minutes! Apparently it was the second break down of the day! Unbelieveably, the Hotel Manager never apologized for this matter... I believe I experienced enough of this hotel to give a full and accurate portrayal of my experience. Really, what Sheraton needs is some ongoing TLC and the Park Lane needs to train their floor management for real time customer service and ongoing general building maintenace....This hotel currently stinks! But, with some real ownership attention it could return to world class level!!!

Reviews.Title: “I could not find fault with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAckilaBro
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Preferred Guest, I've stayed in a number of Sheraton Hotels both here and abroad. I was planning a stay in London and booked a room at the Park Lane Hotel. Then, after I'd booked, I found some review here on Trip Advisor. Quite a number were not complimentary. Knowing the brand, I was surprised so I emailed the manager, Mr Paul Dunphy, and voiced my concerns. Mr Dunphy replied to my email and assured me there were extenuating reasons for the reviews and that I would not have any problems with the Park Lane Hotel. He was right. I went along with the thought in the back of my head that I'd made the wrong decision and I would soon find fault. How wrong I was........... The welcome was great - My wife and I arrived about two hours before check-in time and were still able to check in. The Reception staff were friendly, politeand very efficient; Housekeeping were unobtrusive, but did a great job, Waiting staff were very attentive and pleasant The room was excellent - very clean, welcoming, comfortable, bright and spacious. The location is ideal; Two hundred yards from Regent Street. One hundred yards from a Tube station and Green Park - which lead onto Buckingham Palace entrance; and two minutes to Hyde Park. I would certainly have no hseitation in referring this hotel not only to my friends, but to anyone reading these reviews Forgert the negatives - go for the positives and have a great time at this gem of a Hotel. Many thanks to Mr Dunphy and his staff. Rev Jackie Brown

Reviews.Title: “Borderline acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Travellerette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located opposite Green Park and central to many attractions. The downstairs of the hotel is nicely appointed, however reception is where the wheels came off a bit. The reception was a bit of a mess, various other guests that left there bags lying around all over the floor and you had to pick your way over various cases, pushchairs etc to get to the desk. My husband has status with the hotel chain (it was actually a redemption that we were staying on for the night), but the queue was longer for the status customers than those without - even though it was quite clear from the basic questions being asked that these guests did not have status. The room was clean and spacious but very tired, dark and dull, and the bathroom looked like a throw back to something from a scary American thriller. It was long and thin and had a very cold feeling and is in desparate need of a complete re-fit. It was a functional bathroom, but certainly not the kind of standard you expect from a Sheraton and not at all inviting or relaxing. Very disappointing all round room wise.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, Professional - I'll Be Back...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisParkes
Reviews.Content: I booked an executive room at the hotel and was extremely pleased with the quality of service, size of room and bathroom, staff service and professionalism and also the little things that really make a difference (e.g. there was no kettle in the room and once requested, this was delivered by concierge within five minutes along with a complimentary bottle of water.) I travel to London frequently on business and after being let down on so many occasions by hotels who seem only to offer cramped, basement rooms, this was an absolute joy. For sure, I will return here for my next trip and hopefully many more after that. I had reason to ask for a few things from the concierge desk during my stay from the aforementioned kettle through to walking directions and distances and each and every time I got nothing but polite, helpful advice through what was a genuinely friendly response. Also worth noting that my 7th floor room overlooked Green Park and in the distance (sun or haze, day or night) I could see in the skyline, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and the London Eye. I think, for the first time ever I have had a pleasant view when staying in a London hotel! After a working day that lasted fifteen hours during my trip, I was also extremely grateful for the wind down availability of the premium sports channels provided in the room and the very large, comfy bed that ensured I got the good nights sleep I required before the next days meetings began. Overall, a very pleasant stay, I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Grim, grimy, badly in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: alphabetsoup2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a tragedy - there is so much wasted potential here. It's a beautiful building in a wonderful location, but the hotel is badly in need of renovation. The lighting is terrible, the rooms are dated (mid '80s, I'd guess) and the whole hotel just feels thoughtlessly put together. Moreover, the rooms lack a few basic touches (the dingy hallways, icy reception staff, cheap furniture, bathrooms are stark and badly lit, no telephones on the desk, for example - only by the bed) that it would be simple to rectify. The whole place reeks of a company that is milking the last drops of cash from an aging cow that urgently needs to be put out of its misery. I travel a lot for business - I'm SPG platinum - and I have to say that this is one of the most disappointing hotels I stay at because it really could be so much better with a bit of investment in human and physical capital. I only stay here for the points and the convenience of the location - but even these won't keep me here forever.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful. We had a problem...”
Reviews.Author: Golfergirl15
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. We had a problem at home during our stay and the concierge staff went over and above to help me. When we checked out we had not been charged for any of the incoming or outgoing faxes of which there were numerous. Great location. Had a great room and good service from everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay -- great location, super staff”
Reviews.Author: moraga_ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on two separate occasions in September. Our first stay was on the 5th floor and the SPG room was adequate. On our second stay, we were given an executive SPG room (2nd floor), facing busy Park Lane. I was worried about noise, but the windows were double paned so there were no issues. The extra space in the exec room was a plus. This is an older hotel/building, but in line with our expectation of hotels in London, especially in this area. Location in the Mayfair area is excellent. With SPG, the hotel is great value. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was expensive, but we had no choice because of our early departure (although price is typical of other hotel breakfast offerings). Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: golf261
Reviews.Content: Was a little apprehensive about choosing this hotel after reading reviews, but we were using cash/points, so thought it would be fine, and it was. We were given a room on the 8th floor, and the room and bathroom were quite large. Even though there were other guests on the floor, we really did not hear anyone else. We thought the staff was quite helpful; we had to call room service twice for ice, and it was brought promptly. We enjoyed the location, and found some nice, fairly inexpensive places to eat and drink off the beaten path. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- you know what you get”
Reviews.Author: Jennyp622
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here as a solo traveler. Great Location. Outdated rooms but if you get a good price, you cant beat it. Concierge guys are very helpful, as is the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsBarr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very enjoyable 4 night stay at The Park Lane Hotel Sheraton. I was fortunate to be allocated an executive king room which was very spacious and well presented. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a log. If you are looking for a city centre location this hotel delivers. It is a short stroll to all the central London attractions including Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Green Park etc etc..... We did hear the ballroom noise on one of the nights, however, we were on a high floor and it was not too intrusive. Some reviews comment that the hotel is old and tired however I would best describe it as having character. The Palm Court (bar area) is relaxing, well presented and tended by friendly staff. One less than positive memory was the unhelpfulness and negative attitude of the concierge desk. Somebody needs to remind them they are on the front line of the hospitality industry and can influence the hotel experience of the guests Whether this hotel is a 5 star is debatable however based on my recent experience I would definitely return to The Park Lane Sheraton in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “great Location but terrible servise and attitude”
Reviews.Author: Jena43
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is unprofessional and rude. I have been charged twice on my credit card and took me three phone calls and endless discussions to receive money back. The room was smelly and did not inspire confidence that it has been cleaned well. Overall – apart from the good location – very unpleasant stay. I would not recommend the hotel to anyone. Since I was in London for a business trip – I have also complained to our travel agent. The hotel is NOT appropriate for any business traveler, since there are absolutely no business amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: psuzie
Reviews.Content: From the beginning to the end of our stay was terrible!! On arriving at the front of the hotel there was no doorman of this '5 star' hotel to ask where to park,eventually we found our way to the the back of the hotel so we could park..still no-one to greet us, one of us had to go in and find out. it actually cost £38 to stay in this grotty car park, no discount for staying in hotel. In the reception area we were greeted by an over powering smell of sewage, not a great start! Went to our classic room to be shocked at the size of them...you know the saying' you cant swing a cat'. The free standing noisy air conditioning unit took up the whole window area, the bathroom was so dated. When taking a shower,with the hand held spray, it was cold water and again in the morning it was cold!No bathrobes in the room either. We met our friends for a drink in the bar area, still smelling of sewage, we ordered our drinks. champagne arrived flat and then were told by the staff they were not, eventually they replaced them, no bottle on show, so it could have been cava for all we know. The bill arrived to be shocked of the price. they charged £19.50 for each glass! I have never in all my life paid that much for a glass of champagne and i have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. even the ritz only charge £18! When checking out of the room the following morning i told the lady at reception about there not being hot water and they should mend it before they put new guests in it and to my amazement and amusement she totally ignored me. I shall not be revisiting this hotel and it has definately put me off booking with any sheraton in the future. Finally it is definately not a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “SPG Floor Nice, But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pookiemarie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time last week with my husband and two kids. He stays here often for travel and likes the hotel enough to return. We are SPG Gold members and were staying in room 731, an executive king room. The room was large with plenty of room to move around. We had a small sofa bed for one kid and they claim that the made an exception for the rollaway bed. There was more than enough room for it. The bathroom was really nice. My husband always requests the separate shower and tub. It was really spacious and clean. The view wasn't much to write home about, but you can have everything. It was nice to see the London Eye at night from the window. The walk in closet could sleep a small child. We had central heat/AC which worked great. I wish that the Sheraton would adopt the Westin's Heavenly Bed. They are superior to any other, so much so that I bought one this summer after a two week stay at the Westin Sydney. The king bed was hard and by all appearances, rather worn. It was dipped in the middle. The pillows were all super soft so we asked for a foam or at least a firm pillow. When the guy came with just one pillow it was exactly the same at the others. When my husband called again he was told that those were all that were available. That was really a disappointment. The Westin always has a pillow menu to choose from. The really frustrating part of our stay was the not so lovely noise from the ballroom. The first night around 11pm I heard loud music and bass. I first thought it was coming from the nearby flats. After about 15 minutes I had enough and my husband called to ask if there was a function going on. The night manager said there was a wedding in the ballroom. When we asked if they could please tell the DJ to turn the music down so we(on the 7th floor no less) could please sleep. The manager was very flippant and told my husband that it would be off at midnight. He couldn't care less that we couldn't sleep. There is no excuse for that much noise that far from the party. He claimed that no one else from the 7th floor had complained. Well, I can guarantee you that if we could hear it on the 7th floor, the floors below must have had it much worse. My husband was pissed. The next day I noticed that there was a sign for yet another wedding that night. Guess what? 11pm and the music started again! So now we're on night two of no sleep. It was ridiculous. When I made the reservation to stay I never was told that a lack of sleep was part of my stay. Something needs to be done about the noise coming from the ballroom. I can assure you that this isn't a random occurance. I know for a fact that the ballroom is a very busy place and the noise must be a constant at this hotel. I would stay here again, but if I could be guaranteed that I didn't have to listen to someone's party going on. The location is amazing and the tea room is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out to be just the right place.”
Reviews.Author: LH079
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through a 'Secret' deal and having then read some of the reviews was quite concerned as to my impending visit. No need. This hotel may be old but every one of the staff we met had the visitor as their priority. The bedroom/ bathroom were perfectly clean, the bed firm and the sheets bliss. As the last reviewer, I too would have appreciated coffee and tea facilities but I got over it! The hotel is certainly of a bygone era, but it presents itself well as such and appears to cope well with all the challenges of being at 'that age'! It was ideal for a short break in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JimMurray88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Park Lane. Location was very good, and staff were friendly and helpful, particularly Anna at reception - we had been a little inconsistent in our booking and she was exceptionally understanding, courteous and helpful - left us with a very good impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, walked everywhere”
Reviews.Author: teridaveb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Picadilly. You can take a short walk through Green Park and you'll be at the front gates of Buckingham Palace. Walk a bit more along St. James's Park, turn left and you're at Trafalgar Square or turn right and you're at Big Ben and Westminster Abbey! The hotel was comfortable with good sized rooms. We really wish there was in-room coffee. We had to walk a few blocks to a Pret's to get our morning fix. Otherwise, great choice. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 5* standards”
Reviews.Author: Keef74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Park Lane on points, so maybe this review is a little more forgiving than if we had parted with a few hundred pounds. Despite the hotel's name, it is on Piccadilly and not on Park Lane, but it is just a few minutes walk from Green Park and Hyde Park Corner tube stops, so it is easy to get around. Also, the main entrance is actually round the back, so everyone does use the entrance on Piccadilly which means you do walk through a restaurant with your cases. Check in was very slow, it took us 30 mins to check in and get our keys - queue wasn't massive, just 5 poeople - the staff were just very slow. And they automatically charge an amount to your credit card rather than just taking an authorisation. Not 100% sure yet that they have creditied the amount. Room was spacious, but something wasn't quite working with the decor. Looked kind of more like a 3* hotel room with extra facilities. Needs a good makeover and refurbishment. bathroom was a little better, is large and full of marble. Not that modern looking though. Gym was small and not that well equipped, plus some of the equipment wasn't working. And you have to walk through the afore-mentioned restaurant in your gym gear to get to the gym. Not ideal if you are shy! Would I stay here again? Yes - if I was staying for free on points. The hotel is OK and location is good. Would I pay top whack to stay here? No way! Marriott Grosvenor Square is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Dissa”
Reviews.Author: Musafir86
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location however the room was terrible. The carpets were stained and the bath tub had hair in it. I would expect more from a 5 star hotel. I have stayed at the athenaeum next door which is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: paul1946
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Park Lane in London. We were very pleased with the stay, from beinning to end.The location is great. The room was well equipped and quiet, bathroom recently upgraded , lots of space. The staff were helpful and friendly.The bar is a nice place to meet .

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: mr1960
Reviews.Content: First the good news. It in quite a good location for walking to many places such as Buckingham Palace, Hyde Park etc. The reception is at the back but if you enter via the main road entrance you walk through a lovely restaurant/bar area. However, when you get your room (mine was just a standard room), I found it to be quite fusty smelling, the carpets and decor were very worn, the bedside cabinets are old wooden ones and the room was generally run down. There was a portable air conditioning unit in the room which was very noisy when on but the room was very hot when off. ( It was only 19 outside degrees during the day so it was hardly a heat wave.). There are no tea and coffee facilities in the room when you arrive but they are provided for free if you request them. I had to wait 15 mins to check out due to long queues but I far as I could see there was no quick check out facility. For a Sheraton it was disappointing. In summary its Ok for a night if you get a good deal. I did not see any upgraded rooms but do go there and stay in a standard room if you a looking for a romantic break because romantic these rooms are not

Reviews.Title: “Second visit not as good as first”
Reviews.Author: jasondarling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb and LOVED it. Apparently this was because I got a room upgrade. If you are in an upgraded SPG room, this is a fab hotel. If not, it's just a below average Sheraton. Room was a jumble of dated furniture, carpet stained, bathroom awkward and not user friendly, and the view is of nothing at all. Also my door didnt close properly (rm 217) so had to slam it ever time I entered the room as the first few times I noticed it was still propped open. Creepy. Still, the beds are comfy and the staff is nice. Location is pretty amazing too and if you are using SPG points I would definitely pick this hotel over the god awful Merdien Picadilly a few blocks away. If not SPG preferred (meaning you will be upgraded if possible) or using points, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: wazoom
Reviews.Content: As a member of Starwoods award scheme, who as stayed in numerous of their hotels around the world I can honestly say this is the most disappointing hotel I have ever stayed in. As it was Wimbledon fortnight the hotel prices in London were high so I decided to use some of my award points to redeem a night. The required points was fairly hefty, and the internet rates for the hotel were very high so I was expecting good things. Check-in was slow, in a dingy corner at the back of the hotel. When I got to my room I was shocked at it's general appearance (very old and tired), it's cleanliness and the age of it's furnishings. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been updated in 50 years. Staff didn't seem to be available to ask for recommendations on where to go and where to eat. The check-out was a drawn out affair. I have stayed in better backpacker hostels than this, and of all the hotels I have redeemed Starwoods rewards against, this was the worse, and required 3 times the number of points. It should be considered a 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel: long may it continue”
Reviews.Author: stanley_martinez
Reviews.Content: I stay with the Park Lane hotel (PLH) several times a year and always look forward to returning. The location is of course superbly situated on Old Park Lane, proximate to Hyde Park, a number of private clubs and central bus lines. I can understand why a number of visitors may think the decor needs a refresh but I for one love it and hope she retains the very best of her art deco charm and elegance. Initially, I refrequented the PLH because of her location and decor but now equally look forward to seeing the front desk staff, whom I have found friendly, attentive and quite accomodating when everything does not go according to plan. My slight quibble is that check-in can be longer than usual and rooms are frequently not ready, even more than an hour after 3PM check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: WirelessTraveler
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews prior to going to this hotel, I was worried. I even e-mailed the GM of the hotel to tell him I was concerned after reading all of the negative reviews. Honestly, I looked very hard to find the faults so that I could verify what others had been saying. I found none of them. My expectations were set that I was staying in an older hotel, in central London, with relatively small rooms (compared to what we are used to in the U.S.). I also knew that if I wanted something modern and new, I would have to stay further from the main action and the costs would be high. My wife, daughter (10 YO) and myself stayed in an executive bedroom at the hotel and it had plenty of room for us. We knew we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room, so as long as it was comfortable to sleep in, that is what we needed. The room was large enough for us, and the bathroom was larger than average. The restaurant is quiet, convenient and has good food (have afternoon tea there). There are 5-6 local bars and pubs if you go out the back way, and within a 5 minute walk (hang with the locals). If you want a hotel in the middle of the action (Buckingham Square, Harrod's nearby, Bond Street) and near an underground line (Green Park), this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: PiperNYC
Reviews.Content: I adjusted my expectations going in, based on the reviews here, as this hotel certainly doesn't compare to the usual Sheraton quality. But I paid a discounted rate and was pleased with my stay. The staff from the reception to the bar staff were all friendly and helpful. For instance, when checking out, one employee went out of their way to notice I was carrying my luggage and watched them while I checked out so I didn't have to lug them with me up a couple steps to reception. Room service was a bit slow when we requested a bucket of ice, but they were accomodating when we needed silverware for take out food we brought in with us. The rooms were spacious (between my firends and I, we stayed in two rooms). One was very large with a couch. Both rooms were old and the rugs looked like they could use a good steam cleaning, but otherwise everything was clean. When I checked in they told me you could get codes for one hour of free wifi at the bar for use in the bar area. We generally didn't have a problem getting as many codes as we needed (though one bartended told me once that you could only get a code if you bought something) and they lasted for more than one hour. The food we ate from both restaurants was good (definitely try the waffles at breakfast!) and we enjoyed high tea (which you have to book in advance), though it was a bit on the expensive side. At that price I think I would've went to Fortnum & Mason instead, though the atmosphere in the bar/tea area is nice (comfortable couches complete with harp music). The location is great. A short walk to Buckingham Palace, Picadilly Circus, etc... You're also close to the Green Park metro station and several bus stops. There was also a small antique fair at the hotel on Sunday. There's normally an admission fee, but the organizer let us in for free as guests of the hotel. There were only two problems that we had. My friend got locked in the bathroom in the middle of the night when the door jammed. She had to open it with a card. After that we used the bathroom without fully closing the door, so it wasn't a huge deal (well at least from my point of view since I wasn't the one who got trapped!) The other was you couldn't close the window curtains completely, so there was a lot of light that came into the room. It didn't bother me, but my friends said it was brighter in their room -- like a spotlight. PROS: Great location, Spacious rooms (generally clean), Friendly staff, Beautiful bar/tea area, Free wifi in the bar area, Good food CONS: Old carpet in the rooms, Bathroom door jamming, Slow room service, Window curtains don't close all the way Bottom line, at the right price, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location but a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishTeacherGlenn
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay for us in London and booked this hotel on a 'secret deal' through a well known website specialising in short notice bookings. Check in was the most laborious ever experienced anywhere in the world. With reception only populated by disgruntled guests and staff peering endlessly at their computer screens. Shortly after checking into the room there was a knock at the door, I answered it and three housekeeping staff stood there. I said hello, they just stared at me, I asked how I could help them and none of them had enough english to explain why they were there and they just walked off. Rooms had no tea or coffee making facilities, no bath foam or shower gel and wireless internet was available for £16 per day!!! No thank you. Other than the basic discounted room rate everything else in the hotel was totally overpriced unless money was no object in which case you wouldn't stay here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Average to below-average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dantx91
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick European vacation with my partner, and we booked a stay in the Park Lane Sheraton. I am a loyal Starwood customer, and we love the Mayfair neighborhood of London. Therefore, we were very eager to give this hotel a try. Sadly, our stay was exceptionally disappointing. The Park Lane is located in an excellent part of London with great access to the Underground. However, the rooms can only be described as comfortable at best; far from what we expected for the price. The rooms are more comparable to an average Best Western or Holiday Inn in the United States which is the most generous complement I can give. Further, we found the staff at the reception to be aloof, disconnected, and uninterested in meeting the needs of its clientele. Despite a neighborhood rich in history, the decor is no less than uninteresting, boring, and cramped; this is in spite of its five-star hotel prices. However, this is not a five-star hotel. In fact, we are certain it should qualify for a four-star rating; three and a half stars seem much more appropriate. If you are traveling to London, I'd highly recommend any number of other hotels we've stayed in to include the May Fair Hotel. It's a little more expensive, but it is an outstanding hotel. At the very least, you will likely avoid the terrible sense of disappointment we experienced with the Park Lane Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “great location...not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: cvarda
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location in Mayfair and sits in close proximity to some of the best hotels in the city. It is easy to walk to most parts of the West End, or take a taxi and expect to pay around 10 pounds to get to most theaters, musuems, etc. There's a very convenient tube station (Green Park) as well. Indeed, the location is the best aspect of this hotel, which is in serious need of extensive updating, especially in the guest rooms. Common areas look slightly better. There is an adequate restaurant and salon for afternoon tea, but prices are not much less than far better places to dine or have tea nearby. The food was mediocre at best. We ate only one meal and had one drink after dinner - but far prefered to eat elsewhere. Our biggest disappointment was the room. We booked an "executive room" but the room looked out onto a noisy back road (Brick Street) and was located next to the service elevator, so we could hear room service carts and maid service at all times of the day. Or night. The room size was adequate, but I'd expect more from an executive room. The bed was uncomfortable, with an awkward metal bar traversing the middle of it. Our bathroom was large and, while dated, was adequate. I have stayed in many other international Sheratons and this hotel is by far in the shabbiest condition. On two days our room had still not been cleaned/made up as of 5 in the afternoon, despite our having been gone all day. The concierge desk was also lacking. One concierge flat out said we'd have better luck trying for ourselves to get into a particular restaurant than for him to help us. Another concierge recommended enthusiastically a bus tour which turned out to be ghastly, simply wretched. Expect to pay more for any extra services - there is not free wireless or even internet access in the business room. Again, this is common in high end London hotels but then, high end London hotels have far nicer rooms than this hotel does. We used SPG points to stay in this hotel, so considering it was essentially free, I got my money's worth. But to those paying for a room here, keep your expectations realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Average is About Right”
Reviews.Author: lilroy0
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10 day trip around Europe. My wife and I used starwood points to book a free room at the Park Lane Sheraton to kick off the vacation. In retrospect, this hotel was one of the worst we stayed in. While the location is good, everything else goes downhill from there. The rooms are small, check-in and check-out was inefficient and suffered from lines, gauged guests by charging for internet access in rooms and in business center, played weird (club-like) music in the lobby area which wasn't consistent with their image, no other perks worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't pay normal or full price as it's no more 3 star overall”
Reviews.Author: poshredkitty
Reviews.Content: I got a cheap deal and wanted to stay in a nice hotel and eat room service and have a staycation in London and this was at the peak of the heatwave. So air-conditioning was a real temptation. So paying £109 per night was a very good price over the weekend at this hotel in this location. I called ahead and requested a quiet room with king sized bed. Arrived at check in time and was told room is not ready. Was offered a room with a queen size bed instead so I said I will wait. The lady at reception didn't offer any complimentary drinks with the delay of my room and was grumpy when I inquired which room number was allocated to me so I could come back and request for my room key later. She said it might be up to 1.5 hours. Got no introduction into facilities at the hotel, no offer to have my luggage stored, etc. She immediately went on to take another call on the phone and I was summarily dismissed. So i sighed and said I'd be back. Figured out myself where Luggage counter was, dropped luggage off at luggage counter and went for walk in Green Park nearby. Got back 2 hours later and room was ready. Was allocated room 417. Big room by London standards, but room looked old and tired. Clean though. Alot of foot traffic and could hear all the guests coming and going, room view was of another hotel's rooms and fire escape staircase. Bathroom was spotless and basic toiletries only.
