Don’t open window in bathroom as it lets in noise from the alley below which is where I believe the service delivery entrance is or where the service staff hang out for a smoke. First morning, was woken up by clanging of dishes and trolleys and staff talking loudly from that alley. Kept window closed for second night. Bed is truly heavenly (Sheraton are known for their Sweet Sleeper beds) and if it wasn't the paper thin walls and all the noise from the corridors filtering in throughout the night and disturbing sleep, it would have been perfect. For £109 I didn't make too much of a fuss and was staying only two days. If I had to pay peak prices or normal charges of more than £200+ per night, I would have rated it 1-2 star for service and level of noise if someone is looking for a quiet good night’s sleep. Room service was so-so, bland and typical chain hotel food. Breakfast looked chaotic with queues of people standing about, so I just went out and walked up the road to get breakfast at Wolseley instead.

Reviews.Title: “Who is the idiot who gave this hotel 5 stars?!”
Reviews.Author: Censuwine
Reviews.Content: The problem with this hotel is that it is a five star rated hotel. If it were rate two or arguably even three stars, I would be writing a positive review. Here are, in a nutshell, the pros and cons: Pros 1. Location; 2. Reasonably clean; 3. Staff who are, on the whole, quite helpful; 4. Adequate breakfast. Cons 1. Perpetually (apparently) blocked drains (during the two days I spent there a huge truck called twice to clear the drains - as one can imagine, the smell was not pleasant); 2. Check in time allowed at 3 pm. The gentlemen checking in after me was actually asked to call back at 4.30 pm so that the room would be cleaned; 3. It must be hellish for people in wheelchairs because of the several steps at ground floor level simply to get from one area of the reception to the other. 4. For a 5 star hotel the rooms are quite small; 5. There is only a portable air-conditioning unit with a pipe leading through the wall/window. It is not very effective and so noisy that it makes more sense to open a window and switch it off. 6. The bathrooms, albeit clean, is obviously very old and getting the right water temperature was awkward; 7. The minibar was sealed so that it was impossible to use it to cool drinks bought from outside; 8. Expensive - £300 per night for this? Forget it!! They are merely selling on the strength of the location.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: coolFNW
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park Lane instead of the Sheraton Park Tower in which i usually stay simply because of price. (over a $200 difference per night). London is overbooked this time of the year. I've stayed in the Park Lane many years ago, so I know (or thought I knew) what to expect. I requested an early arrival, which i didnt get, ok it happens. but i was told that i have to wait until after 3 pm. there was one room allocated for me and no other available. i reminded them of my gold status, but they were dismissive. finally when i got to my room it reeked!!! of a chemical smell. the bellhop suggested i ask for a different room as it was impossible to breathe there. i called the front desk and the man told me he will call me right back in 2 minutes. 20 minutes later i had to call him. he told me he will show me another room and he will be coming right up in 2 seconds! i was waiting in the hallway as it was impossible to stay in the room, i simply couldnt breathe in there! 1/2 hour later he still did not arrive and i had to call downstairs again! finally he arrived and showed me a dismal room. i asked him to cal the Park Tower to see if they would accomadate me, he hemmed and hawed and told me he is sure that the Park Tower doesnt have room. I corrected him and told him in fact i had called the Park Tower there was room for me. I insisted on moving and that i pay the same rate at the Park Tower as i would have paid in the Park Lane. the only good thing i can say about the Park Lane is that they paid for my taxi fare to the Park Tower. ATTENTION Sheraton!!! look at the Park Lane, it is time to do a complete update on this hotel or drop it. dont bother staying there, staff is rude and uninterested and rates are enormous compared to what you are getting. no way in the world is this a 4 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected poor quality overall stay”
Reviews.Author: globetraveleler
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood gold member and decided to stay at the Sheraton Pak Lane hotel, expecting a good experience. It was terrible from the moment I showed up. First of all when the taxi drops you off the main entrance on Picadillly to get to the reception carrying your bags you have to go through a long bar/restaurant area where people are eating or lounging, and wondering if you are going in the right direction. There was no porter to help with the bags or to ask directions. Although it was 1:45 pm, they told me that the room would not be availablel until 3 pm. It was then ready at 3:30 pm. I had reserved a superior room becasue I wanted a slightly larger room at a rate of 389 British Pounds per night plus tax. Many times I get an upgrade as a gold SPG member, but in this property not even an acknowledgement. After waiting for alomost 2 hours, when I finally got to my room it was one of the smallest rooms that I had ever stayed in my life. I travel over 50% of the year. When I asked to get the room type that I reserved, they told me that it would not be available until after 6 pm, since I had a business meeting I told them I could not wait. So they offered to give me 2000 Starwood Points, and no relief on the price. There were no amenities in the bathroom ( shampoo, soap, etc.). Half hour after I requested that these items be brought to the room the maid delivered them. The room was hot and smelly, the AC knob was broken and one could not tell if the cold air was at maximun. But there was hardly any air coming out of it. Even the porter that finally brought the lagguage upstairs commented that the room was extremely small and apologetically suggested that I should ask for a larger one. The room was very tired, the carpet and the chair at the work desk were stained,The hotel overall was old (elevators made all kind of noises) and overall it had a musty smell. The service continued to be very poor, even through the check out, where a 3 other guests were checking out and only one person was at the desk. They never asked how my stay was. It was a terrible stay, the service was bad, the property was bad. It is s shame that it is part of the starwood group of hotels.The only thing going for them is the location near the center, but there are many other hotels that are a lot better in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame...”
Reviews.Author: Renery
Reviews.Content: As noted by others, the location of this hotel is ideal. I have stayed there 3 or 4 times in the past. Each time we used Starwood points, and each time the quality of the rooms has gone down. As noted, the furniture is mismatched and old, past the "quaint" stage. Same experience schlepping down steps and through the unattended lobby and the bar/tea room, then up more steps. No assistance offered and no bellman at the door that should be the arrivals. More comments: 1. The room we were given for three people (father, mother & 11 yr old son) barely had enough room to walk around the three single beds. To get into the bathroom we had to slide the rollaway bed in one direction and to open the closet door we had to slide it in the other direction. To get past the rollaway we had to turn sideways and risk bumping the TV cabinet. This must definitely be a fire code violation. 2. I inquired about a larger room, but was told at 9 in the morning upon arrival that all the rooms were full and there were no "upgrades" available. 3. The portable air conditioner is very unsatisfactory because of the noise. It had a hose which was vented through the window. These portable air conditioners get hot and are a fire waiting to happen. 4. The bedding was not up to the standards of other Sheratons where we've stayed. 5. The woman at the front desk with a French accent was dismissive and not sympathetic (bordering on rude) when I asked her about changing our room. She noted that we were, after all, staying on points. 6. The carpet was threadbare, spotted and stained. 7. The bathtub was so old that the porcelain had worn through to reveal a dark spot under the drain. 8. The floors on the 3rd floor creaked with every step, as noted by another guest. 9. A red vacuum cleaner sat in the hall for 3 days in the same place (next to our door). 10. Etc., etc. You get the point. In all, the room was a sub-standard Sheraton room, certainly not in keeping with other Sheratons where we've had the opportunity to stay. Perhaps next time we're in London we'll try the Le Meridien. I post to TripAdvisor, so I will be sharing my experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the slurs! This is a grand hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: charltonx
Reviews.Content: The reviews here terrified me. Maybe they've cleaned up their act. Maybe I lucked out. Maybe competitors are posting false reviews. From what I read here, I was really afraid. Imagine my surprise when I checked into an incredibly swanky hotel. Just amazing. Opulence, everywhere. The staff was great. Gorgeous location. Quiet rooms. Some qualifications... the a/c was a unit that connected to the window. It worked well-enough. It didn't get the room down to arctic conditions I lime, but my tastes for cold are pretty extreme. Also, the shower was an old-fashioned, hand held model. But it worked fine, and the whole thing felt like stepping into an Art Deco time warp... in a good way. I loved everything about the hotel. Even the main court had late night food that was genuinely tasty in the classiest of environments. I'm not sure what happened to the other critics, but I just stayed in a fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Platinum treated with cold indifference by Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Robusto45
Reviews.Content: Am a Starwood Platinum travelling with wife and 18 year old daughter staying at the SPL in a Junior Suite on points. When rez was made was told that we would more than likely be upgraded to an Exeuctive level room with lounge access. Requested this in writing as well. Upon check in was told with cold indifference by front desk that neither a Park View room, or upgrade were available. Was informed that we were after all staying on points (you peasant was the implication)..told in a cold fashion that after all we were in Junior Suite (for which we spent extra points by the way. Junior Suite was supposed to have a King Bed and Sleeper Sofa...instead it has two twins shoved togehter, and a sleeper sofa which could handle only a small child. Furniture is a jumble of old cheap furniture with a few modern pices thrown in...threadbare carpet, and mis-matched curtain. All in all a reason to question one 11 year loyalty to Starwood as a Platinum.........unless you fancy a retro-Cold War Iron Curtain Hotel experience stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good...”
Reviews.Author: Anodyne1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Park Lane Hotel for 3 nights after a flight from Tel Aviv which was double its normal duration. With French airport workers being on strike we had to go around France! I was happy to see the hotel had an excellent location between Piccadilly and Knightsbridge, so easy to get to anywhere. It was about 930pm when I arrived and it was not apparent which door was the entrance, so eventually I found one that opened and struggled through it with 2 bags. I eventually found that the main entrance is in a small back street, but as there were no staff to advise at the Piccadilly entrance, I had to guess. So the entrance I entered was through the bar. It looked quite nice in an olde world way, unfortunately smelled old too. So after more struggling to get through more doors I continued the struggle up some stairs after searching in vain for a ramp. No help offered and bad luck if you are in a wheel chair. Even worse luck if there was an emergency and you had to leave quickly in a wheel chair! The health and safety people should have a field day with this place! So to check in, quite normal except I had a trainee who had to double-check each aspect of the procedure with her colleague. No problem until I had been mistakenly allocated a smoking room. I detest smoking so I requested another room and was told the hotel was full. I asked that they resolve the problem and after insisting and waiting eventually was given another non-smoking room. Seems it wasn’t full after all! I was then asked for my credit card as normal and I explained that I will pay cash for all expenses. The next morning I received a message from my bank advising of an unauthorized transaction of £225 GBP. My room had been paid in advanced with accrued points, so what was this? I immediately contacted reception to get clarification, they said indeed it was them. I then asked that they unblock the transaction and I left a cash deposit in advance of £150 GBP, as I did not intend to spend anything other than on internet access (which incidentally was charged at £16 GBP per day) and would pay cash immediately for anything I purchased. The reception staff member assured me that the credit card transaction had been immediately annulled. So after approximately 8 attempts and 6 days later with international phone calls to hotel, bank, emails, attempts by a well-intentioned but ineffective assistant manager to resolve the issue (I only received a return call by threatening to make drama after being ignored and the original problem remaining), my credit card still remains blocked! I continue to get the same ‘it is the bank not the hotel’ story, but this rings a little thin. It is not difficult to put in place a system in a hotel in a 5-star international chain that works. This system does not work and I am not happy about it. So to the room. After passing a hallway which yielded loud squeaks with each step I got to the room. It was musty and hot, so I first tried to open windows in the room and bathroom – they were old and deteriorated and opened maybe 5cm with difficulty – so I searched for the air conditioner which was an old portable model on the floor partially obscured under the curtains and attached to a hole in the window via a flexible tube. I turned it on and it was so loud that I decided to put up with the heat instead. It was a health hazard and an accident waiting to happen. The furniture was old, there were insufficient power outlets for computer, phone, etc without pulling out other electrical items on the floor and the outlet in the bathroom didn’t work – there was not even one available to fit the wheezing old hairdryer which was hidden in the cupboard. The carpet smelled weird. Paint was peeling off in places, same in the bathroom. The toilet refused to flush, but eventually worked after about 10 attempts. When I turned on the water in the bath it had a strong flow, but when changed to the shower, it dribbled out like it had a prostate problem. After stepping out of the shower I discovered a door stop placed ergonomically perfectly in the middle of the floor to break your toe. It didn’t break, but it hurt. The towels were stacked perfectly on the towel rail with the large one you needed at the bottom, so the others on top would then fall dutifully onto the floor. On attempting sleep I heard the squeaking floor outside the door and strange noises from a nearby room which were not entertaining. In the morning the light for the elevator button was not working and didn’t work during the whole stay. I could go on, but really the conclusion is obvious. This hotel needs a rethink. It is quite obviously well below 5-star standard and even obvious health and safety standards. The credit card situation is not acceptable and is still unresolved. It is disorganized and not clean enough. I cannot recommend anything other than the great location. I will be sending this letter to Sheraton, Starwood, the hotel’s manager and others. It is not good enough. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: mouseymousey
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a Friday night at the hotel and it really surpassed my expectations. We were checked in quickly and the room was immaculate with a huge and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless with a lovely shower. The bar, whilst not cheap, make the most unbelievable daiquiri, again with fantastic service. The concierge staff were also excellent and helped with left luggage on Saturday and with tracking down a pair of shoes that we left behind (thanks also to the excellent gentleman who took my call on Saturday evening regarding the shoes!). Only one thing that I can think of that wasn't perfect, there was no corkscrew in the room to open the wine from the mini bar! I really wish I'd stayed here for 2 nights, but I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: psweeting
Reviews.Content: I spent one Saturday night here with my eight year old son for a two day visit to museums in London as a treat for him in June. I booked this as a secret hotel through last-minute which still cost me about £120 without breakfast. We arrived and were checked in promptly but there we didn;t get a room as we arrived at about 11am. Bags were left and my son was given sweets and chocolates by reception which obviously had a positive effect on him. i did enquire about an upgrade (free of course) but none were available at the time. We were offered a smoking room for immediate check-in but we declined the offer. The room itself was absolutely fine and after a full day of museums and Harrods when we got back to our room at 7pm with the intention of going out again to an arcade or cinema, my son just wallowed in his bed and fell asleep watching a world cup match. The bathroom was excellent, almost as large as the room itself. The only small gripe i have is that there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room as standard. You have to call reception and they send them up. I did this but the kettle that arrived was broken and I really couldn;t be bothered to wait another 15 minutes for another to be sent up. The location of the hotel is by far the best i have experienced in London. It's on several major tube lines, with museums, Harrods and the West End accessible without any changes. I would stay again but probably only for the sub £100 bracket or if breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with fab view of Big Ben”
Reviews.Author: loriann57
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Park Lane Sheraton and upgraded to a Jr Suite. It was an outstanding room, Huge marble black and white bathroom and stellar view of Big Ben, Green Park and London eye. Our room was on the 8th floor. It was lovely to walk thru the Palm Court when we went in and out and we had two picnics in Green Park. Also v. close to Hyde Park and walking distance to Trafalgar Square. This is a wonderful hotel. They even gave me a box of chocolates for being a Starwood member. The bed we had was to die for. Even tho London is my fav city we made excuses to hang out in this room. Very nice concierge, too. He printed out a map of Portabello Market for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but just OK for price”
Reviews.Author: poisonibee
Reviews.Content: I should first say that perhaps my opinions are based on expectations from traveling frequently within the U.S. for business. Stayed here for four nights as the first part of our trip to Europe. The location is great - a short walk from Green Park tube stop and 10 minute walk to Picadilly Circus, Soho, etc. The room is quite large for European hotels. The furniture felt a bit outdated as well as the decor, but the room was always clean and generally comfortable. Used points for the first three nights and a corporate rate for the fourth night. To me, it's not worth the price, but then again, when I was researching online, even the Holiday Inn (just down the street) was $150 a night. The staff was helpful and friendly. The concierge was a little awkward (when we asked if it was quicker to take the tube or a bus to get where we wanted to go, he simply pulled out a map, told us where we were on the map and where we wanted to go, which didn't really answer our question).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel - Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Citrus12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Park Lane on my recent stay in London - and it made my trip! Upon arrival at the majestic front, bordering the Buckingham Palace, it was a dream. It had a gorgeous Palm Court, the staff could not have been nicer, and it was in the best location in the city to get to shopping, historic areas and the theatres. It was a beautiful and stately - truly befitting London.

Reviews.Title: “Well past its best - needs 300m Pounds spent on it”
Reviews.Author: B0ris69
Reviews.Content: An old lady in need of a total body lift. The floor squeaks, the carpet is threadbare, the heating didn't work, the lighting is dim, the walls needs to be painted and they have the temerity to charge 250 quid a night! Get real - either downgrade the property to two star or bite the bullet like other hotels in the area such as the Four Seasons and renovate! Apart from the half-decent breakfast I could not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like I've stepped back in time...all the way back when I was sitting in 3 star communist-times hotels in EE”
Reviews.Author: sabecketttt
Reviews.Content: I have just checked in the hotel this evening and am making plans how to get out as fast as possible, despite having a 12 days booking. Reasons: 0. (this one not really to blame on hotel, but on starwood's polcies): just learned that i will accumulate no points for the nights here, because my corporate travel agency made the booking through a 3rd party agent (was not aware that I needed to police our travel agency) 1. The bathroom does not have a shower cabin, but instead a deeply scratched bath-tub, whose white paint is peeling off rapidly. 2. This has to be the first toilet sink in a five star hotel with no space to put any toiletry on. Not a big fan of searching through the toilery bag for 2 weeks every day. 3. The room stinks. I think this is what reminds me most (along with the scratched bath-tubs) of those old hotels. It has the smell of wet, ''rusty'' walls. 4. Ok., I might be pushing it on this one: the tv has no cnn coverage. I'm not from US, and I know that in theory ''when in Rome, do as Romans do" - hence watch BBC, but have trully gotten used to watching CNN as it is widely available in hotels all around the world (including 2 others in London, of which one another starwood - Le Meridien). 5. I don't want to have to deal with the rude gentleman from reception again. His extremely sarcastic tone when informing me my reservation has no cancellation policy was the unfortunate beginning of what an irritating hotel experience. Maybe I was extremely unlucky, and in fact the rest of the staff is very polite and the rest of the rooms awesome. Otherwise, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charming but staff aloof and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Dharma4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May and loved the location-an easy walk to many shops and sights. The hotel is charming although our first room was cramped with useless furniture and the Tube was very loud. We were moved because of this to a much larger and more comfortable room.We also found the shower curtain to blow in and stick to one while showering although there was lots of water pressure. None of that was a big deal. However we found the staff to be detached and somewhat unfriendly. The concierge had "no idea" about London's famous buses (but the next shift readily pulled out the bus map),they "didn't have the time" to check a travel arrangement, and told us a taxi to the airport would be 100 pounds (so we flagged one ourselves and were charged only 52 pounds)I think hotels forget that their staff represent to a large degree, the city you are visiting as well as the establishment itself-surely some training on smiling and fulfilling the basic requirements of their position (i.e concierge) towards all their paying guests would be in order. We often stay at Starwood Hotels but this one, because of their haughty staff ,didn't quite live up to the hospitality we have come to expect from the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: unhappy99_10
Reviews.Content: While the location was great, and the price seemed ok for the area, I was quite disappointed when I saw my room. I used to live in London so I do not expect large rooms or new decor. However, my room was very worn out, the carpet looked about 50 years old and not terribly clean. I could hear the man in the next room snoring! The bathroom was very outdated. There was only a handheld shower in the tub...and nowhere to hang it so you could have a shower. They still have the hot and cold taps in the sink so you have no option for "warm" other than to fill the sink. The hairdryer looked like a Flowbie ( i.e. vacuum hose) and did not work well. To top it off, upon checkout, the front desk tells me that I have a 6pound charge from the bar the previous evening. I am pregnant and did NOT go to the bar. He said, fine, no problem, we will reverse it after saying "are you sure???". So I get home and a couple days later, I check my visa bill and there is another 35pound charge from the hotel. After calling back twice (of course long distance charges to correct the error) I finally get someone who lists off all the drinks I apparently had at the bar on my one night stay. I told them I was pregnant and not drinking so they should check their signatures or request room keys from patrons at the bar to avoid this in future. They did reverse the charges but of course I'm stuck with a loss because the exchange rate moved betweeen the time they charged and reversed it. BEWARE!!! check your charges after staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Inept housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: SK2010Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel for a short two night stay, I was pleasantly surprised after booking through Last Minute.Com as a secret hotel. The room was very spacious and clean and the bathroom was acceptable with the exception of the shower which one could use comfortably if you were 5”5 in height or shorter. The real disappointment came with the housekeeping staff who supposedly did not know that I was staying for two nights and decided to empty the wardrobe and toss my other belongings upon the bed ready for removal from the room after night one. Surely upon discovering all of my belongings in the room, I would have thought she would have had the intelligence to check with the front desk; obviously not! Thankfully, I arrived in time to correct this hopeless woman. Unfortunately however, she has binned various treats I had bought from the food hall at Harrods although, she did offer to recover these items for me from the bin!! Then an equally unintelligent and vacant looking man appeared and provided me with an incredibly insincere apology. I usually stay at the Strand Palace upon my visits to London and will in future stick that what I know. Generally and with the exception of the lady who attended me when I checked into the hotel, the staff were grumpy

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: UKYork
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through LastMinute.com's Top Secret Hotels and were very shocked when we read the many terrible TA reviews after commiting to the reservation, we'll never take this risk again... We followed the advice of another reviewer in the same predicament and contacted the hotel direct to raise our concerns. They assured us of a 'good' room (but not an upgrade) and when we arrived our room was fine. We'll never know if this would still have been the case if we hadn't emailed the hotel in advance. Our room was very large, clean but a bit dated, especially the bathrooom. We had a comfotable stay but I don't think it was worth the rate we paid, especially as that rate was supposedly discounted. Service was polite but not exceptional and was rather slow in the bar. The bar itself was very elegant but we didn't try the expensive Palm Court Tea. Also didn't have breakfast as there are always good value local alternatives available in London. Not sure I would return as have had better stays at lower star rated, less expensive hotels, but location was great and we had an enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Old building but still nice.”
Reviews.Author: aerojunkie
Reviews.Content: The Park Lane is an older hotel with odd shaped rooms (although they are very large) and corridors. The service levels are good; however, and the location is very central. As far as Starwoods properties in London are concerned, this is the best value, but that is only because the other properties are way overpriced. I'm not sure what Starwoods is thinking, but the Sheraton brand in particular, does not command $600 per night rooms as some of their London properties charge! (An except for the Le Meridien, they do not accomodate families or parties of 4). This hotel charged 204 pounds for one night during this stay. I elected to use my Starwoods points rather than pay that rate. I stayed one night and was upgraded to an Executive King room which was very large even by U.S. standards with large closets and bathroom. Room was clean with nice views of Green Park. The hotel itself is a few blocks away from the nearest tube, but is within walking distance of Oxford Street and Marble Arch shopping areas. Taxis are always available. Overall a nice stay. I would recommend this hotel if the price is no more than 200 pounds per night for a single traveler. Anything more than that, you should be able to do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, tastfully decorated, and clean quite rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HAPPY1948
Reviews.Content: We reserved two standard rooms via LastMinute.com for a very reasonable price. Our request for quiet rooms on a high floor, away from the elevator, and close together was honored. We found the rooms larger than expected and nicely decorated. The tub was large and deep. Only complaint was when showering, the curtain tended to blow inward and touch and did not keep the water from flooding the bathroom. We left the portable air conditioner on high when out of the room and the room temperature was comfortable on our return. Howerver, on a really hot day, this may not be true. The food in the bar and Citrus restaurant was excellent and they have a good wine list. Staff were professional, helpful, and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: JeanSmith1
Reviews.Content: As members of the Starwoods hotel preferred guest scheme, we selected this hotel following good experiences at other starwood/westin/sheraton resorts, fully expecting teh same standatrd of service - particularly for the price! The hotel is extremely shabby, the breakfast poor quality and over priced and our room was the smallest I have ever stayed in - there was not even sufficient space for 2 people ot pass each other at the foot of the bed. The bathroom and interconnecting doors wouldn't remain open without being wedged. There was no mirror over the dressing table - and the hairdryer flex was not long enough to reach the wardrobe mirror. The lobby on floor 8 creaked the whole way along. I reas that the management realise that refurbishmnet is needed - why then is this not reflected in the price!We had a better stay at the Hilton round the corner in March, for consderably less and with much more comfort - Never Again at a Starwood for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: LizzyPasta
Reviews.Content: We just checked out this morning from another fantastic stay at the Sheraton park Lane. Yet again, we simply could not fault it. We are regular worldwide travellers for business and leisure and this hotel is one we always love coming back to. We were on floor 7 and the room was superb, clean, quiet, large and faultless. The walk in wardrobe was more than large enough for all luggage, clothes and then even more space! The bathroom was lovely and smart, with the water-pressure very good which makes for a great shower and a fast-run bath. All staff were incredibly helpful, from the young lady who checked us in, to Anne the Irish lady who looked after us for breakfast - we always feel mothered by her and she is genuinely a friendly face first thing in the morning. The staff at the garage were also lovely, with even remembering our daughter's name and just topping off making the hotel feel 'right'. Well done Sheraton, this hotel is one we will always return to.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews-We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Love vacation time
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about this property, but our room (#439) was very pleasant, overlooked the park, and very comfortable. The room was approximately 270 square feet. The best way to get there if you don't have too much luggage is to buy an underground Oyster pass......We paid approximately $45 each for the week and took about 6-8 trips per day and went to and from the airport. Take the Green Park exit and you are about 4 blocks from the hotel. This is the first time we travelled with overhead luggage (2 bags) plus a large camera bag and large purse. A taxi from the airport to the hotel would have been $90 .......$180 round trip. We paid $90.00 for the Oyster cards and had five days of travel within the city too. Best deal in town. The best way to go around town and for airport transfers. The location of the hotel is the best. This was our 19th trip to London. Back to the hotel......the bath room was about 72 square feet. It had a stall shower with an overhead spray (not too popular with the ladies), a double sink of about six feet, magnified mirror, lots of counter space, a heated towel bar. The room had two nightstands with lamps, flat panel t.v., mini bar, safe, chair, desk, dressing table, small table near a large chair. The furnishing is a bit on the tired side, but much better than we expected. Staff was wonderful.....concierge staff, maids, front desk......all combined to make a great vacation in an exciting city. Restaurants we visited included: Bocca di Lupo (B+), Tentazioni (B), Clos Maggiore (B), Mildred for vegetarians (B-), Haozhan (Chinese) (A-).........our best meal in London. Skip the desert. We enjoyed our tour of the Globe Theater. Borough Market was nice to see. Bought some cheese and bread and took it to coffee houses for three days in a row.....just like being in Paris. Had a wonderful day visiting Hampton Court and Ham House. Wonderful sights and a great walk into Richmond where we even did a little shopping. Some very nice boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from home - excellent location- business & leisure”
Reviews.Author: AshwaniA
Reviews.Content: A classic yet modern hotel, centrally located in the heart of the city, stones throw from Birminghma Palace, walking distance to key shooping destinations..Harrods, Oxford Street, New Bond Street, Bond Street, Picaddilly...close to access key infrastrastructure..place to relax and have a perfect vacation and business trip

Reviews.Title: “Refurbishment long overdue”
Reviews.Author: MisterCoconut
Reviews.Content: Many of the other comments about this hotel are absolutely correct; This place is worn down, but the location is pretty good. The rooms are tiny, but that would not have mattered were they appealing and up to standard. Particularly the bathroom was less delicious than what could be expected. This is the main reason why I will not be choosing this hotel again. So misunderstood by owners really; The location is good, the building itself could be charming again, and the staff (of which many seem Eastern European) are friendly and capable. Not least the friendly and helpful chaps at the Concierge desk, the reception and the tea room. In my opinion this is i 3 star hotel at best, with a 4 star staff. The room service breakfast, the healthy option, was quite nice really. And the Tea Room on the ground floor is very charming - does not matter if that is a little dated, we are not sleeping there. Got a relatively good rate, I thought, but the price was still way to high for this product, it turned out. And on top of that you have to pay for WIFI - smart thing would be to offer that free - to take the edge of the many discrepancies in comfort and appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Elegant Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sorrentosarah
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone on business and wanted a hotel near to the tube station which offered a high standard of accomodation and comfort and I wasnt disappointed. The hotel is a lovely elegant building situated right on Picadilly approximately 3 minute walk from Green Park Tube station, over looking the park. I was greeted at the door with a smile and the offer of assistance with my luggage. I proceeded to check-in and was met by a friendly lady who checked me in quickly and gave me directions to my room on the 7th floor. This hotel is old, its not got brand new carpets or curtains, its not a clinical looking hotel like a travelodge or premier inn...its got character so if you want clinical dont stay here, this place has charm and so do its staff. The rooms have everything you will need and are comfortable, quiet and spotlessly clean. The bar area is lovely - reminiscent of the Waldorf in New York City and the afternoon tea is to die for, whilst the barman mixes a mean Cosmopolitan! To be honest I was worried when I read the reveiws but I can honestly say that I would recommend this hotel and I will be staying there again on business and for pleasure when I am town

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL costs!! rude staff, grubby rooms!”
Reviews.Author: aimzyp
Reviews.Content: I have never felt the need to write a review before, until now! Just returned from a night at the Sheraton Park Lane hotel, and would NEVER go again. We checked in and the lady receptionist was incredibly rude and unhelpful, practically throwing our room key on the top of the counter, without telling us where to go or what floor the room was on. Once we got to our room, the key didn't work, so we asked an employee who happened to be walking through the corridor for help, who was also rude, shrugging and telling us to go to reception. Once we went back to the reception, we received no apology, just the same rude receptionist who handed us new keys with an obvious attitude problem. Once we eventually got into our room, it was incredibly small. A sign said there was no smoking in the room but there was in fact an ashtray, and the room smelt stale. The bathroom looked old and tired, with tiles missing from the walls. Also beware that when they take a credit card at reception during check-in in case you purchase anything from the mini bar, they actually hold money (£100 in my case) from your account, which they don’t then release back to you for 5 days! (was on the phone to by bank for quite some time trying to work out where my missing funds where). So, all in all, a huge disappointment, certainly no where near 5*'s.

Reviews.Title: “Great facade but lacking in substance and a lick of paint!”
Reviews.Author: Smudge43
Reviews.Content: In truth we chose this hotel because of the location and that was very good, that said we expected significantly more in terms of quality and value for the £209.00 per night excluding VAT. Our room (839) overlooked the park which was a plus if you like that type of thing but the downside was that none of the room doors stayed open on their own and we barely had room to move around either side of the bed it was that small. The dressing table didn't have a mirror and the power point sockets had been placed that far away from the mirror on the inside of the closet door that reaching it with the hair dryer was a challenge at best. In the bathroom the windows hadn’t been cleaned for some time and the shower head leaked water over the shower rail wetting everything within a 3 feet radius including the ceiling with it’s attractive brown water mark so it had obviously been like that for some time. On informing the desk of the various issues the reply was that many rooms had been upgraded already but some still lacked a refresh, as expected no offer of a reduction was forthcoming though and the rates didn’t reflect the poor standard overall.

Reviews.Title: “Super location!”
Reviews.Author: kimberley_y2k
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was a Sheraton and I know their range of hotels has a good reputation and I'm pleased to say this particular Sheraton hotel did not disappoint. I booked this hotel as part of a package for my Husband's 30th Birthday so of course I wanted everything to be extra special and I couldn't have asked for more from the hotel and the staff. When the hotel staff found out it was my Husband's special Birthday they upgraded us to an Executive Room which had a park view - amazing! The hotel is in a perfect location for all the sights of London - most of the sights within walking distance. Unfortunately we didn't have time to eat in the restaurant but we did have breakfast which was gorgeous! All the staff here were so friendly and went out of their way to speak and be helpful. We spent some nights just sat in the bar watching the world go by, it was fantastic - the decor was lovely and there was even a harpist playing in the background. I can't praise this hotel enough - I was deliberating whether to do a party for my Husband's Birthday or a trip to London and I'm so pleased I picked London. We will definitely be going back. Thanks to all the staff. xxx

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! My new favorite hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: DesertDiva31
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at The Park Lane Sheraton Hotel in London, along with my husband and kids. The whole trip was wonderful (in spite of the ash clouds) and the hotel was a huge part of that. HOTEL: The hotel itself is one of the old grand English buildings on Piccadilly street, that gives an overall aristocratic feel. However once you enter the lobby, it has a certain "boutique hotel" atmosphere, with more personalized service and attention than you would get at one of the larger hotels in the area. The check-in process was smooth, and Christian at the front desk was more than accomodating. My husband was arriving later in the day, and I was worried how he will get a room key, but Christian took care of all that. I read reviews from others and I do not agree with their complaints about the hotel appearance. It is a historic building and you have to expect that it will not be the same as staying at a brand new "chain hotel" building. Everything was in working order, the bathrooms were lovely, the rooms were well decorated and had a coffee maker in each room. among other amenities. LOCATION: Cannot ask for more! Across the street from Green Park and a few minutes walk to Hyde Park. Lecister square and Soho are a lovely 15 min walk away, which meant we were close to Waterstones bookstore, movie theaters, West End, theaters, amazing restaurants (Nobu is a couple of blocks down and the lively and active Shepards Market is in the neighborhood behind the hotel, literally 2 min walk away). Buckingham palace is just a quick stroll through Green Park. St. James (which I was introduced to only on this trip) is a 5 min walk down the road. Not to mention Mayfair in all its glory, the fabulous shops of Bond street, Saville Row, and Regent street all within walking distance less than 15 min away! For those who prefer the Tube, Green Park station is just around the corner. There is a Marks and Spencer supermarket a couple of blocks down too (important if you have kids along on the trip). SERVICE: Absolutely wonderful. All the staff were extremely gracious and helpful. Sahil at the concierge desk did a phenomenal job in securing us exactly the ticket seat locations we wanted for the theater. He also was very helpful every day in giving us directions and helpful hints. He is among one of the best concierges I have come across in all my travels. FOOD: We were outside the hotel on most days, so we only sampled the food for dinner on one of our evenings and it was very good. The tea lounge in the hotel was always packed, so it must be good although I didnt have a chance to try it unfortunately. All in all, it was a great stay, and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “run down hotel, over priced even at special rate, room gruby”
Reviews.Author: skjdas
Reviews.Content: run down hotel, bit like a council flat from the 1960s. room wasn't what you would expect from a 5 star more like a 3 star with a slightly nicer bed. bar and restaurant has some 1950s style and was quite nice. I'm sure they have nicer rooms but you may have to pay more or complain. Way better hotels in london and also cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful around small rooms; GBP50 brings quick fix”
Reviews.Author: ladodgerone
Reviews.Content: As a family of four with two small children, I assumed a standard room at the Park Lane Sheraton would suffice. The front desk agent politely said that it was going to be a challenge, but I told her I'd like to see it for myself--and she was absolutely right. What we found was perhaps the smallest hotel room I've ever seen in London or New York or anywhere--barely big enough for a queen bed and a mini-desk, let alone anything else. Luckily she was quite nice and for 50 GBP more, we were able to get a huge room that had a sofabed for the kids, a king bed for us, and a spacious (shower + tub) bathroom on the top floor that had huge ceilings. It ended up being pricier than we wanted, all in all, but hey that's London. Convenience to Hyde Park (including Underground), Nobu (at the Metroplitain), and the Shepherd's Tavern is wonderful. We'd come back--especially once the exchange rate improves.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth the money. Shocked at state of rooms even after upgrade”
Reviews.Author: emsy85
Reviews.Content: I paid to be ungraded because the standard of the bathroom was not acceptable. Even then it was disappointing and certainly not 5 star, I would put it closer to 3 and its old and shabby. If you want better hotels in the area try the intercontinental on park lane or the atheneum next door.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ojo39
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on floor 5 which was the smoking floor. Requested a king size bed and was given a twin beds. Was told they could put a king mattress on the two beds if we preferred. Complained and requested a king NON Smoking room. Was told to come back and check in at 3pm for a king room. Room on back of hotel so very dark and dingy and bathroom very old and needed updating. No tea and coffee facilities in room, ironing board but no iron. Definately not 5 star!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraandAshley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February. We arrive on a Friday afternoon and walked through the Palm Court room to get to the reception. There was a lady in there playing a hrp while guests sat around drinking tea, was lovely!! Check in was quick, the room was nice, lovely big bed, very clean. The shower was so powerful may not be everyones choice but we lked it. The only negative I would say is that we had a terrible view, just the building opposite!! But didnt bother us and it was only a base and wanted a clean comfy place to stay. We didn't use any of the facilities so can't say what they were like. The bed was comfy and the hotel was in a good location for the west end. Would recommend!! (Better than the radissons we've stayed in).

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stop for Park Lane functions”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: Having agreed to go to an awards dinner at one of the Park Lane Hotels, I decided to find somewhere to stay that night. I couldn't believe the deal on lastminute.com, and grabbed a room quick. I then went on Trip Advisor and wondered whether I had made the right decision, the reviews are certainly mixed, so what did I find? Well, I got a lovely room, overlooking the park and high enough up to escape any noise from the street below. The staff when I checked in were very efficient and everything was as you would expect. As other reviewers have said, the beds are wonderfully comfortable, and so despite a rather late finish, I woke the next morning relaxed and ready for the day. So, is this a 5 star Hotel? I think the honest answer is its borderline, it has the grandeur and position, but there are better alternatives if that's what you really want and are prepred to pay. However, it is on a par with the other big chain Hotels in the area like the Hilton and the price more than reflects any differences. I would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, central London hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lopo85
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with last minute.com top secret hotels to stay the same night. The ground floor of the hotel is very grand and beautifully art deco decorated. Check in was quick, reception staff were helpful and polite. The room was lovely, simplely decorated , lots of room and a beautiful huge bed! Tv was also huge and plenty of choice of channels. Bathroom was clean, only downside was that the shower temperature guage seemed to have a mind of it's own! Considering I got a very good deal on this hotel (under £100) I was extremely impressed.

Reviews.Title: “don't think you get what you pay for here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dayoff2day
Reviews.Content: we were in london for the knorr chef of the year.we had two rooms in the hotel and were going to the banquet and presentation that evening .the hotel is busy and formal not over friendly but efficient the room was soo small yes it had a large flat screen TV ,dressing table somewhere to sit,table to dine but the bedroom door opened onto the bed and you could just make it around,. the bath room had cracked tiles and mirror the light fittings were stained and full of dead flies. but the banquet was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews! Our stay was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Stv
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute and was concerned about the negative reviews but should not have worried ! I was delayed on my journey there as i was given the wrong tube stop by the phone operator? i was therefore quite stressed when i arrived nearly an hour late! :-( However the staff were charming & very helpful they even gave us an upgrade as a good will jesture! The suite was of a very high standard (as to be expected) and the bed was just divine- sooo comfy and huge!!! Located right next to green park so excellent all round would definately stay again. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Poor room not worthy of five stars.”
Reviews.Author: cleverzippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights mid March after booking with last minute. I accept the cost was lower but this hotel is not worthy of five stars or even four. The room was very cramped with 12" between the end of the bed and the TV unit. The bathroom was dire with numerous cracked tiles and dirty grout. Filled our bath and the water was green! Lovely view out of draughty window onto flat roof! No tea or coffee making facilities in room. Didn't bother with breakfast at £23 a head, went to Garfunkels Leicester Square for big breakfast - £10 for the both of us. Hotel is more interested in serving high tea at £30 a head than looking after travellers. Good location for Green Park tube. Wish I'd booked HI Express.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Lambchop12
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel, you will initially be impressed. That is, until you reach your room. While the lobby and bar area of the hotel are fresh and modern, the rooms are a totally different story. We couldn't even open the door half way due to the strange placement of the furniture within the room. The bathroom was so old that the tub and other surfaces were peeling and yellow. The shower curtin didn't reach the floor so every shower caused a huge mess. And all of the faucets leaked profusely so we wasted tons of water. Overall, the location is good...just a few blocks from the Underground and a short trip to Buckingham Palace. If you're only looking for a place to sleep, save your money and book a much cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel but there aren't many things to do inside the hotel after you are done with your day's business. The location is good, so you can hop into a cab and go somewhere, but there aren't any fun.‎

Reviews.Title: “What is 5 star about this hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: Fisk123
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on this 5 star hotel via Lastminute.com so I shouldn't have expected too much. Trouble is I did. Gripes: Queued for at least 15 minutes to check in. Asked a question about the Royal Academy and was told that they didn't know what it was. Should have directed me to someone else. Room on 4th floor was v small and blocking the exit was a bedside table. I considered it a health and safety issue and asked to be moved to another room. Next on to the 6th floor and it was marginally better but still not 5 star standard. The bathroom was poor and the shower sub-standard. However having said that and like the previous post if you can cut a deal and this location is important to you then fair enough. Personally I think the Cavendish is a much better bet. Stay here if you will but be warned: it is like staying in a 2 star bed and breakfast. Oops take that back. Why would you spend £19.oo on a continental breakfast ?

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: POPSNorthants
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 12 year old grandson on an overnight stay for his birthday We chose the Sheraton because we have been to a few of there sister hotels elsewhere around the world. I'm surprised by the negative comments by some of the guest. that have also stayed at this hotel. We found the bedroom, bathroon and the rest of the facilities to be clean and tdy as expected and not shabby as one guest implied. For breakfast in the morning they provided a very good selection to choose from and we found the service to be excellent. The only negative comment we have is the bedroom was very cold so advisable to take your thermals with you. Would we stay again.. Yes..

Reviews.Title: “Think 3 star....”
Reviews.Author: TravelbunnyStAlbans
Reviews.Content: This was a top secret hotel on Last Minute and we paid £119 for a Saturday night. It was my husband's birthday and they gave us a suite overlooking Green Park. The hotel is very "tired". Everything needs an overhaul (decor, furniture, carpets). Our "suite" was really a collection of rooms with thin walls and too much furniture at very odd angles meaning I couldn't stand in front of the mirror to dry my hair. The bathroom was incredibly worn - 80s tiles, patched up with grout. Over the bath hand held shower.Cheap shower curtain. Dodgy heated towel rail. The bed was wonderfully comfortable though and the view over Green Park was fantastic. We didn't eat in the hotel but the afternoon tea looked lovely, the lounge was full of families and groups of ladies enjoying themselves and I made a mental note to take my mum there. The reception staff were nice enough and the cocktail waitress made me a special cocktail as they didn't have what I ordered. What makes this hotel, though, is the fantastic location and, if you can wangle it, beautiful views... If what matters is being really central, AND you can get it at the right price (think 3 star), then this is for you. If you want that real 5 star experience, don't stay here, you will, unfortunately, be massively disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: oldhousegirl
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel a few years ago and was pleased to see that at least some of the rooms had been upgraded. I was upgraded to an Executive Room, so I'm not sure about the others, but my room was big and comfortable. My big complaint, though (and then memories came flooding back of why I had changed rooms during a previous stay), is that the hotel is very noisy. Not street noise, but just poor design. The doors are very heavy, and they slam shut. So any time anyone comes or goes on your floor, or the floor above, you know about it. The hotel wasn't even that full, but it was impossible to get rest without earplugs. The room service cart was rolling up and down the halls, dishes and glasses all clanging together, and the room service delivery person's phone kept ringing and ringing and ringing (I don't know why he didn't pick it up). I could hear every conversation in the hall, and it seemed there were quite a few children running up and down (and you hear every footstep). I got out of bed 5 times to see what was going on. Until I put in ear plugs it was impossible to rest, and then I had the anxiety of missing my early morning wake up call. The bed is very comfortable. The location is terrific, right across from Green Park and just a block from the Green Park Tube and a short walk to everything. The staff was very nice and polite. The prices for all hotel dining are outrageous, and why bother anyway with so many excellent options in walking distance. London hotel prices overall are overpriced, so while I think this hotel would be overpriced in any other city it is really a reasonable value by comparison. It is one of very few hotels I've experience in the UK (where I have traveled extensively over the past 20 years) that doesn't have a total disaster of a shower situation -- i.e. they have managed to design a bath/shower that doesn't completely flood or wet the bathroom floor. That alone is surely worth a few extra pounds and worth a return visit (I just booked for a fall visit). The closet is enormous, which is great if you're staying a few days. I'm not crazy about having to either walk through the Palm Court or use the odd side street entrance, but that's really only a bother when checking in and out. Happy to see the additional of flavored water in the lobby as a refreshment upon arrival

Reviews.Title: “Old without the charm”
Reviews.Author: Vinomundo
Reviews.Content: It started with a ten minute wait to register at the reception. Then it got worse. Wallpaper in the corridors is damaged in many places. Carpets are stained. The room is straight from the 70s. There is not even central air conditioning. My room at a portable unit with a big tube going out the window. Wow that's impressive for a Sheraton! The bathroom has not been renovated for at least 30 years maybe 40. I complained to th manager who offered to move me to a renovated room. I guess we just don't have the same definition for renovation! Knowing that I am a Starwood Preferred Guest Corporate Member, I can hardly imagine the type of room other people would get. I ended up moving to the Halkin. Now that's a hotel! I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy let alone a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Like the hotel in The Shining...”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: ...this place has an odd, old school vibe and you could imagine Redrum painted in blood on the peeling walls dripping on to the loud patterned carpet. Like Judge Smail's wife in Caddyshack (Rodney Dangerfield said to her "You must have been something before the war!"), this property has some faded charm but is in serious need of a facelift. Sheratons are the weak link in the Starwood chain as most are over-priced, dated and have little style. Supplying the same designer soap as their Westin and W hotels brethren is not enough. The Park Lane features an excellent location on Green Park (next to Hyde Park) in classy Mayfair and is steps from 2 tube stops, Piccadilly Circus and is walking distance to Soho and the Thames, but suffers from a worn out interior, an odd lobby plan (the lobby faces an alley in the back and if you get dropped off out front on Piccadilly St. you'll have to walk with your bags through a formal tea room up and down steps. If you stay here, ask to get dropped off on Brick St., the alley). As a Starwood Gold Preferred Guest, I got a suite, but it was a weird double room layout with a small living room and small bedroom with an ancient bathroom in between, on the first floor floor facing noisy Piccadilly St. I asked to be moved to a one room suite, which was very large and had an updated bathroom but was located next to a very noisy elevator that clanged all night. They were totally booked, so I remained there. On the surface, the room looked pretty grand but upon closer inspection you'll see peeling wallpaper, sloppy caulk, gaps in the moulding, worn carpet, etc. This is somewhat standard for English hotels (and homes) in my experience. Probably the result of sloppy union laborers. Another peeve is the price of internet access. It cost 18 pounds a day or 50 pounds for the whole week. When you pay about $400 a day (265 pounds) free internet would be nice. I did manage a look at one of the standard rooms and they were pretty bleak, especially the bathrooms. Euro gripe: Why can't Europe figure out how to configure a simple shower without confusing knobs, hoses and insufficient splash guards. On the plus side, the bed, as is the norm at Starwood, was plush and as "heavenly" as advertised and the staff was friendly and helpful to the extreme. And unlike most UK hotels, the heat worked well. Can't vouch for the A/C, as it was winter. I didn't experience the afternoon "High Tea" in the Palm Room but did sample the bar which was disappointing for its lack of English beer. The snack menu was good and the Thai plate (spring rolls, Thai sausage, chicken satay) was welcome at midnight when I arrived, as local pubs close at 11:00 or so. Bottom line is that if it weren't for the Starwood points that I earned for my week's stay here (they were running a quadruple points special!) I would have stayed at one the smaller, private hotels in Kensington or Knightsbridge.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tweenas
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good, very central. Service is very good and friendly. A specail mention to Tim who runs the lobby bar, he looked after us very well. The bedrooms and especailly the bathrooms are very dated. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Starwood Options in London”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Starwood Preferred and will usually consider paying slightly more to stay at a Starwood hotel and get points. We've stayed at the Le Meridien at Piccadilly several times and this was our third time at the Sheraton. We travel to London often for business, but generally try to extend our stay through the weekend to enjoy the city. We felt we got a reasonable deal, especially since we stayed for 4 nights which offered a further discount plus 4x the starwood points. Unfortunately, once again, we were not impressed with this supposed 5-star hotel and I think we're done considering Starwood for our frequent trips to London. Don't get me wrong, the hotel has a nice central location, walking distance to shopping, theatres and restaurants. The public spaces are nice, however the hotel is rather oddly organised -- entering from Piccadilly street you need to walk through the restaurant to get to the rather unassuming lobby area. There is always someone to open the door for you and generally taxis are waiting. I usually check in late after work, often after 11pm and I'm not sure if it's just the night staff, but they're never friendly, barely saying 2 words to me before handing me my key. I found the same to be true of the other staff we encountered. Calling down to the concierge around 8am on a Sunday morning had me waiting through at least 30 rings before being answered (this is after being transferred from the front desk). I've stayed at plenty of 5-star hotels and generally it's a requirement to be friendly, but every time we walked in the hotel we were never greeted with a simple, 'good evening' from the concierge. As the entrance area is so small, it's almost awkward that they don't say anything when no one else is there. The rooms are fine and if I paid less, I wouldn't really complain, but again, for the price and the star rating, I expect more. There was no safe in the room, but otherwise the basics were there. Sheraton beds are always comfortable and this one was. The bathroom is really old and while I'm fine maintaining some of the historic personality, each room I've stayed at in the hotel has had similar variations of awkward layouts. The door was so heavy and squeaked loudly, the shower curtain was awful -- it would blow in and stick to you and keeping the door open or closed would not help. The shower was in a corner of the bathroom so with the shower curtain closed, there was barely any light in there. There is practically no counter space and I found myself keeping things on the floor. One of the most disappointing things about the room was the paper-thin walls. I went to bed around midnight on the first night only to be woken up around 2am with seemingly 6 or so people piled into the room next to me and continued to laugh, shout, etc. I was about to call downstairs to complain (which would have required getting out of bed as the phone is not on the bedside table) when I eventually fell back asleep. But it wasn't just party noise, the same group crammed in the room again about 5pm on Saturday when my husband and I were napping and even though they weren't partying, their voices, while not overly loud, were impossible to ignore. The thing that bothered me most was that when I got checked into the hotel at 11:45pm and called down for room service, I was told that the kitchen was closed. This is clearly labeled on their menus, but what I don't understand is how a supposedly 5-star hotel in a major city could not serve food at this time. I wouldn't always expect food at 3 or 4am, but 11:45 seems very reasonable to be able to call down for a sandwich. After working late and catching up with some colleagues at the pub before coming to the hotel, I was left eating a can of pringles for dinner. The hotel is really missing out here -- I had a dinner allowance that I was most willing to spend at the hotel but now I'll opt for another hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, lots to see”
Reviews.Author: travelfunaddicts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an older property but has many modern updates combined with classic English service. Staff was attentive and helpful with some minor exceptions. The food, both in the restaurant and catering was very good. Walking distance to the theatre district and shopping at Harrod's.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tilly1957
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the previous reviews we were slightly concerned about what to expect, we had a great stay. Central location, friendly staff, very clean, good breakfast, large family room. Bathroom was old fashioned but in a 1930's genteel style which they had attempted to modernise, it did not bother us. Hotel did lack a decent restaurant, we ate out each night.

Reviews.Title: “Unheated bedrooms in the middle of winter!”
Reviews.Author: ACE48
Reviews.Content: Call me old fashioned but you expect some form of heating in a bedroom of a 5 star hotel. I was told that all the bedrooms had a heated towel rail and that was all! It was a freezing cold night and I didn't feel like sitting round a towel rail especially as it was not giving off much heat. Apart from that, the bathroom was decidely grotty - cheaply patched up old bathroom suite, holes where the trim should be and a tad dirty for my liking. Shame, because I have stayed in many Sheraton hotels over the years and, until this point, had always found them to be of a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “i think it's got a bad rap - i loved it”
Reviews.Author: jasondarling
Reviews.Content: one of the better hotels i've stayed at in london. paid with spg points and had a very nice room. not sure what all the complaints are about but i am spg gold so i'm sure i got one of the better rooms. good location, good service. very british.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: ddcastillo1969
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were in Geneva visiting and we decied to hop over to London. I got on the SPG website and saw this hotel and figured that usually all SPG hotels are pretty decent. Well this hotel was I would say Decent only. Maybe a *** only not a 5 start at all. We were in a executive room will say it is big and comfortable, but the room was very cold and the heater did not work well. The bathroom was very cold (LARGE BATHROOM) but no heater in it. The hot water got LUKE warm only. I can live with this as we are rushing through london only for two days. I will say the Staff was very friendly and very helpful, from the cocncierge Richard to the checkin staff ALL VERY VERY PLEASANT. Oh I almost forgot the sink was plugged, and again we are rushing through all the sights so we are not caring at this point. Not the standard I am use to for the PRICE at 211 GBP this comes up to 454.00 US dollars. For this price there was no FREE WIFI...But in London you can purchase a few hours of Internet on their wifi systems for 3GBP for a couple hours. I will say the convenience to Picadilly was just a few blocks, and the concierge Richard showed us to some local PUBS around the area that the tourists probably would not know. THE STAFF IS 5 STAR I will say that much. This made up for the short comings of the room, but then again arent us americans spoiled.... Cheers David D Castillo Denver Rugby Football Club

Reviews.Title: “Dated in urgent need of a full overhaul”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times over the past 10 years and it was in need of an overhaul many years ago already... Rooms are not up to standard anymore, several problems with upkeep are apparent (e.g. bathrooms). Rooms tend to be rather small. Beds are soft and not great. Facilities are basic and not up to 5 star standard by far. There is a basic fitness facility, no sauna, steam room or pool. Service is OK and friendly but not always efficient. Internet can be painfully slow (10mps connection) and does not work properly all of the time, so don't rely on it if you have important mails coming through. Overall the hotel lacks some desperately needed TLC. Customers seem to be mainly European tourists and conferences. There is no executive lounge facility. Bottom line, not great for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...otherwise okay”
Reviews.Author: jbrumm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in January...to be honest, I thought the property was just fine for the price. Sure, you could stay at a more upscale hotel in the area (e.g. Ritz or the W that is opening later this summer), but this one has all the essentials if you just need a place with a central location and the usual Starwood Category 4 amenaties, including a nice LCD TV and large bathroom. I wasn't expecting much, but the rooms were spacious and the staff were very helpful. I forgot my UK power converter and they just gave me one at the front desk. The best part about this hotel is the location. You can essentially walk, or take a brief cab ride to anything you want in downtown london. Plenty of restaurants and pubs within walking distance. p.s. if you have the full english breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, don't shy away from the black pudding...it's good!! If you don't know what's in it, don't ask, just eat it :)

Reviews.Title: “Grand old dame”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Park Lane for 5 nights in January. We had requested early check in and a room with some light and we received just that. The room looked out on Green Park and even though it rained and snowed, it was fine and as light as could be. Service at check in was friendly and the housekeepers met all our requests. I had some in room internet problems but they had that working within an hour. We found everyone to be friendly and the concierge gave some great recommendations for restaurants which were appreciated by many. This hotel has THE location for us. It was on Picadilly 6 blocks down from the Ritz. It had a Pret (English Sandwich shop) and a Starbucks three blocks down from the front entrance. It had access out the back door within 3 minutes to 4 restaurants and in 10 minutes to 20-30. It was three blocks from the tube station and Taxis knew where it was at all times. It's location could not be faulted and we thought that was the BEST. Is the hotel old, yes she is. However they have a beautiful "Tea Garden" which people come from all over to go to Tea there. The rooms are on the smallish side and they have not been renovated in quite some time. That said, they were clean and the bed was comfortable and for the price we paid it was excellent. The heating worked and the noise from the streets or other rooms was not heard inside. We found our room to be quite cosy as a matter of fact with a blue tone throughout. The bathroom was made of white marble and was actually very nice. Overall, for the price paid and value we thought the Sheraton Park Lane was excellent. We will most definitely return in the future. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: PestanaJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff and excellent conference facilities.. Had a tour of the hotel and the ballroom was amazing and they have various conference rooms. my room was great with beautiful views over Green Park

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bfly2
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a weekend trip using starwoods points. after reading the reviews, i was very concerned, but it was a great stay. we did upgrade, which might be the difference, but our room was very large for a london hotel, everything new and lovely. the bathroom was huge, with a walk-in shower and a deep (but narrow) tub. the location is great, just two blocks from green park tube, and half a block from many bus lines. our room was very quiet- we never heard anyone in the hall or in adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Restless_Malcontent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Lane Sheraton for one night with my wife after a nice night of theatre and late night dinner and its locaiton near Picadilly Circus (a few steps from Green Park subway) made it very convenient. I was concerned by some of the negative reviews however we got very good service and a lovely spacious room which was clean and comfortable. I used Starwood points but even if I had paid the going rate I think it would have been very good value in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service - not 5 star building”
Reviews.Author: 123jxxjxx321
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 days with friends. As we were not with a group it was a bit hard to find the hotel at first given that there are so many other buildings with the Park Lane name. The main entrance is on a side street so we found ourselves having to enter through the lobby area in order to arrive near reception given that the other entrance is better. The service was great.. and the staff at reception, concierge and at the lobby where very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice but not as much as we expected. From the window we could only see a bunch of other windows and building very close to us. We had a discount at this hotel so it was a good value for money for the price we paid. However, I won't pay the full price to stay in this hotel again. The location was good as we could easily go anywhere we wanted, and Oxford street is just a few minutes away with the underground or bus. But the building is so small and old. Beds are confy but I cannot say the same for the bathrooms. We liked the option to choose a smoking or non-smoking room. We also appreciate the the way staff behave.. they are very 5-star and have a standard approach.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it on points or with a stellar deal”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: We had a deep discount at this hotel, so got more than our money's worth, but we would have been deeply disappointed in the rooms had we paid regular price. Comfy beds and relatively new furniture, but small rooms for this hotel class, with extremely shabby bathrooms. This was the case in several rooms on a couple floors - we checked around. The location is very convenient, walking distance to major sights and multiple Tube lines. The Palm Court room is a beautiful, comfortable place to relax with a coffee or drink or newspaper any time of day. Speaking of the newspaper, a free one is available in your room each morning, but you have to request it. The restaurants are skippable. Staff is friendly. We didn't have a terrible stay, but wouldn't go back unless we had another incredible deal or points to burn. This place is punching considerably below its weight.

Reviews.Title: “Modern And Most Uptodate Circa 1940”
Reviews.Author: chan0198
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here on cash & points since the other Starwood Hotels were not available and I was out of points after 3 nights at the Waldorf Hilton (which is great). 2 nights right after New Years. Generally nice staff, though didn't have much contact with them. Darren the head concierge was quite nice and helpful. The rooms were just SO OLD. I have never been to a Starwood property with such threadbare carpet, 1940's bathroom, furniture with warps all over them, no Sweet Sleeper beds, and just totally dingy. Thankfully I didn't pay the 200 pounds that they were charging. The fitness room was small but had the usual goods, free weights, some machines and open 24 hours. Nice location between Knightsbridge shopping area and Piccadilly/SoHo. Green Park tube station is a few blocks away. No upgrade for this gold member either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlBoston
Reviews.Content: I booked using SPG cash/points so it was a good deal for me. Only stayed one night The hotel is close to tube stations and within walking distance of a lot of attractions. As others mentioned, the parks are great for walking and running. It was awkward walking through the lounge areas hotel with my luggage but it was a minor inconvenience. The back street was safe but limited sidewalks. My room faced the back street so I missed the view. The room with a king bed was huge, especially for London hotels and the bed was comfy. It had old characteristics but it seemed modern. The hallway was huge but noisy at times and I could hear everyone walking from my room. The bathroom was very dated and the shower was horrible. I had to climb into it holding onto the grab bar, not the safest entrance and it was either too hot or too cold.
